loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: achat de l'huile rouge

loans.name: María Teresa

texts.es: María Teresa C. de 41 años de edad reside en el municipio de Colon del departamento de La Libertad con su familia que está compuesta por su esposo de 61 años de edad quien se encuentra jubilado y sus tres hijos de 17, 16 y 14 años de edad. María es una persona muy alegre en su hogar y su negocio,  hace unos años empezó con su tortillería a raíz del de la jubilación de su esposo, María tuvo la idea de iniciar su propio negocio en el cual ella podría aportar económicamente al hogar, y es así como ahora con once años de experiencia en su negocio le han dado el éxito de una clientela estable y gran demanda es por eso que ahora solicita de un crédito para comprar insumos y aumentar la producción de tortillas diarias
texts.en:
María Teresa C. is 41 years old and lives in the town of Colon in the department of La Libertad. Her husband is 61 years old and retired. The couple has three children (ages 17, 16, and 14). María is a cheerful person who started her tortilla business a few years ago shortly after her husband’s retirement. She was inspired to start her own business so that she could continue supporting her family financially. María has now been in business for eleven years and attributes her success to a stable clientele and high demand. She is requesting a loan to buy supplies so that she can increase her daily production of tortillas.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase supplies for her tortilla business

loans.name: Macharia

texts.en:
Macharia is 40 years old and married with two young daughters. He was previously a farmer but has been selling scrap metal in Nairobi for two years now. He is requesting a loan for 20,000 KES to add to his stock of scrap metal.

Macharia describes himself as hardworking and determined. Since he joined Kiva partner Faulu, he says that he has learned business management skills. As his business expands, he hopes to buy a truck for transporting his goods, and purchase a plot of land.

loans.use: To add to his stock of scrap metal

loans.name: Biyinzika Development Group A Of Mukono

texts.en: Robinah N. is 20 years old and cares for her one child in addition to her parents. She sells secondhand clothes at the local market and generates 30,000 USH per week from the business.  She would like to use the loan amount of 200,000 USH to purchase more clothing. Robinah believes that with greater inventory she will be able to boost business and attract more customers to her stall. She is very hard-working and hopes to be able to pay for the education of her child.

loans.use: Purchase more used clothing

loans.name: Lea

texts.en:
Lea D. is from the village of Paddad, Alicia, Isabela. She is 21 years old and single. To make a living, Lea owns and operates a general store, selling daily use products, such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste and other goods, in the local community. Lea has been engaged in her business for more than three years and earns approximately 1,400 PHP weekly.

In 2007, Lea joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lea is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Lea from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her general living conditions. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items in order to expand her product offering

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma, 39 years old, is a married woman. She has a 5-year-old child. She wants to give a bright future to her child. She also wants to improve her family’s living conditions. She is into rice farming. According to her, her land is now being prepared for the next planting. She wants to achieve an abundant harvest.

Emma joined CEVI to gain access to its financial services. She is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP. She will use this loan to buy seeds, fertilizers, and other farm supplies needed at her farm.

loans.use: Farm supplies

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica I. is from the village of Dimalco Bonifacio, Misamiz Occ. She is 44 years-old and married with two children. Veronica owns and operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling daily use products such as soap powder (for laundry), salt, sugar, candy, shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. Veronica has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Veronica joined Kiva partner GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Veronica is requesting a first loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy large quantities of pork

loans.name: Mailyn

texts.en:
Mailyn L. is from the village of Poblacion, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She is 26 years old. Mailyn is married and has 3 children. To make a living, Mailyn owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for sale. Mailyn has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Mailyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mailyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from GDMPC. Mailyn is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used additional capital for her business. This will be the third loan taken out by Mailyn from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: additional capital for her business

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth J. is currently in the business of selling  groundnut paste at home and is requesting a loan to purchase more bags of groundnuts to make paste to sell.  Elizabeth is 25 years old and is married to a husband who is a policeman. She has 2 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house.

 BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  

In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: purchase more bags of groundnuts to make paste to sell

loans.name: Hamrokul

texts.ru: Пошокулов Хамрокул проживает в районе Шахритуз. Возраст, 56 лет. Женат, имеет 3 детей. Жена, домохозяйка. Сам Хамрокул имеет средне- специальное образование "Бухгалтер". Более 15 лет занимается растениеводством. Имеет небольшой участок земли, где сажает пшеницу. Кредит берет для закупа минеральных удобрений.
texts.en:
P. Hamrokul lives in the Shahrituz region. He’s fifty-six years old, married and has three children. His wife is a housewife. Hamrokul has an education as an accountant. For more than fifteen years he has worked as a farmer, growing wheat on a small plot of land that he owns. He’s asking for a loan in order to buy mineral fertilizer.

Translated from Russian by Alex Kostrubsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Josefina's Group

texts.en:
Josefina B. is from the village of Baculud, Iguig, Cagayan. She is 55 years old. Josefina is the group leader of an 11-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Josefina is married and has five adult children. To make a living, Josefina owns & operates a business providing transportation services to local community members. Josefina has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Josefina joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Josefina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. Josefina is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP, which will be used to repair a transport vehicle used in the business. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Josefina from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair a transport vehicle used in the business

loans.name: Nshunga Abamwe Group, Ibanda

texts.en:
R. Denis is a hardworking man, committed to his business and agricultural enterprises. He deals in poultry farming, cattle keeping and a banana plantation, all of which generate income for his family.

Denis’s main drawback has been cattle diseases and pests that attack his cattle and plantations and which have reduced his yields. Therefore this loan is to help Denis buy more farm tools like pesticide, and mulches for the plantation. This will help him improve his yields in terms of milk, eggs and bananas, thus enabling him to meet his customers’ high demand.

The improved yields will increase Denis’s sales revenue, hence making him more able to meet his family’s requirements in terms of his children’s tuition fees and other needs and enable him to live a more self-sustaining life.

loans.use: To purchase farm tools like pesticide and mulches and manure for his plantations

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en: Erlinda is 33 years old, married, and has three children. She lives with her family in the province of Rizal in the Philippines. Her husband works as a rice vendor. To provide additional income for her family, Erlinda is starting a business buying and selling rice in the neighborhood. She is ambitious and determined to launch a successful business venture of her own. Erlinda would like to receive a loan to purchase rice inventory. Since the beginning of her membership in Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc. (ASHI), a Kiva microfinance partner in the Philippines, Erlinda is thankful for access to capital and loans to support her entrepreneurial dreams. Her long-term goals are to build a sustainable business, to fund her grandchildren’s college education, and to construct a more durable home that can withstand flooding common in her town. With the support of ASHI and Kiva, she is hopeful that her new business will generate steady income to improve her financial stability and her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: To purchase rice inventory

loans.name: Em

texts.en:
Em M., 59, is widowed and resides with her two children in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for clay and ceramic products. She is at home while her two children are employed at a local garment factory, earning an income of $2 each per day to help cover the family's expenses.

M. is requesting a loan of $150 to purchase chickens to raise. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: Buy chickens to raise

loans.name: Neang Chhay

texts.en: Mrs. Neang Chhay S. is 34 years old and lives in Andoung Samretth village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a 3-hectare plot of land to cultivate rice. She also sells groceries at her home to earn additional income to support her family. Mrs. Neang Chhay S. is requesting a loan to pay a laborer to plow her farm and to buy fertilizer and pesticide for her crops. She wants to use the rest of the loan to buy piglets for breeding and pig feed. Mrs. Neang Chhay S. is a widow with a child, who is a student in the local school.

loans.use: To pay a laborer to plow her farm, to buy fertilizer and pesticide, and to buy piglets and pig feed

loans.name: Pepertual

texts.en: Pepertual A. moves around in Abura to sell jewelry and children’s panties.  Pepertual has been educated up to the senior high level.  She is a widow living with her two children. With the income she makes from her sales, she takes care of her family. Her loan will be used to buy extra items and a variety of jewelry for sale. She wishes to use the new revenue from her business to buy a plot of land.

loans.use: buy extra items and a variety of jewelry for sale

loans.name: Lenny

texts.es:
La Sra. Lenny C. tiene 20 años, está casada hace más de tres años con el Sr. Hugo Padilla Ayala, tienen una hija de 1 año de edad. Todavía viven en casa de los padres en una zona lechera y agrícola por excelencia.

La Sra. Lenny se dedica a la lechería desde hace 5 años, toda su producción de leche entrega a una empresa que elabora productos lácteos que posteriormente venden en el mercado local. 

El primer crédito que requirió fue utilizado para comprar una ordeñadora, este equipo facilitará el trabajo haciéndolo mas eficiente y fácil. Ahora desea poder adquirir otro crédito para poder comprar una vaca lechera mas y de esa manera poder incrementar su producción de  leche cruda. En el primer crédito que obtuvo Lenny demostró mucha responsabilidad con los pagos y es por esta razón que desea que la gente de Kiva confié una vez más en ella. Y agradece a todos los que la ayudaron anterior mente y confiaron en ella.
texts.en:
Mrs. Lenny C. is 20, and has been married for three years to Hugo Padilla Ayala for more than three years. Together they have a 1 year old daughter. They still live with parents in an area known for it's excellent dairy and agricultural production. Lenny has been working in the dairy industry for the past 5 years. She delivers all her milk to a local company that processes dairy products and sells them in the local market. Her first loan was used to purchase a milking machine which made her work easier and more efficient. Now she hopes to get another loan to purchase another dairy cow to increase her production of raw milk. Lenny showed great responsibility in repaying her first loan and for that reason hopes the Kiva folks with trust her once again. She thanks all of those that helped and trusted her previously.

Translated from Spanish by Solson Scherman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: purchasing sewing materials and a new machine

loans.name: Wilfredo

texts.en:
Wilfredo B. is from the town of Trinidad. He is 51 years old, married, and has 6 adult-aged children. Wilfredo owns and operates a fishing business, and he gathers and sells seaweeds to the market. 

Wilfredo joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Wilfredo has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Wilfredo is requesting a new loan of 25000 PHP which will be used to purchase a pump fishing boat which will improve his fishing business. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About CEVI:

Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years.  Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines.  In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring.  CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance, and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase a fishing boat

loans.name: Loice

texts.en: Loice N.  is currently in the business of selling various items such as "simsim" (sesame seeds), onions, tomatoes, beans, etc.  and is requesting a loan to stock more bags of beans, "simsim" and some tomatoes to sell.  Loice is 40 years old and is married to a husband who is a businessman. She has three children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand her business by building a restaurant.

loans.use: Stock more bags of beans, "simsim" and tomatoes to sell

loans.name: Susan Koinato

texts.en:
Susan is 23 years old, a single mother of one school-going child.  She has been in livestock farming for the last three years.  

She was introduced to KADET by her friend and this will be her first loan.  She plans to use the cash to buy six calves which she will rear and sell later at a profit.

Susan hopes to build her own house in future, enabling her to move out of her parents' house where she currently lives with her child.

loans.use: To buy 6 calves which she will sell later at a profit.

loans.name: Neftalí Simeón

texts.es: Neftalí Simeón P. R. de 26 años de edad, reside en el municipio de Soypango, lugar en el cual vive junto a su compañera de vida y una pequeña hija de un año de edad. Neftalí posee una panadería propia la cual le compro a un cuñado y en la cual ha ido invirtiendo poco a poco, comprando todas las herramientas necesarias para la elaboración del pan y así mimo ha ido haciendo mejoras en el local, con el fin de poder contar con un mejor ambiente laboral. Neftalí cuenta con 5 repartidores de pan los cuales día con día entregan el pan en bicicleta por diferentes colonias. El negocio es bastante estable y así mismo le permite brindarle trabajo a otras personas, es por esta razón que solicita un préstamo con el deseo de poder mejorar su panadería comprando un horno industrial, debido a que el que posee en la actualidad es un horno artesanal; así mismo Neftalí quiere poseer mayor cantidad de materia prima como harina, manteca y otros más para hacer su trabajo más rápido y eficiente el cual no solo beneficie a su familia sino también a sus empleados.
texts.en: Neftalí Simeón P. R. is 26 years old and lives in the Soypango municipality where he lives with his life partner and little girl that is a year old. Neftalí has his own bakery that he bought from a brother-in-law and has invested in it little by little buying all of the tools necessary to make bread as well as making improvements in the place so that he can have a better working environment. Neftalí has 5 delivery people who each day deliver bread by bicycle to different neighborhoods. The business is very stable and it gives work to other people. Neftalí needs the loan since he has a traditional oven and he wants to buy an industrial oven he also wants to have a greater quantity of raw materials like flour, grease and other items to make the bread faster and more efficiently; that not only will help his family but also his employees.

loans.use: To buy raw materials to make bread and to buy an oven.

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Merlyn M. is from the village of Pigsag-an, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 54 years old, married and has 4 adult children. Merlyn owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop where she sells food & daily-use products and also retails rice. She has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Merlyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She successfully repaid a previous loan of 17,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to invest in expanding the business. Merlyn is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & provide working capital. This will be the 6th loan taken out by Merlyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & provide working capital

location.town: Pigsag-an, Cagayan De Oro City, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Sumaya Nompayan Enole

texts.en:
Sumaya Nompayan is a forty year old, modest lady from kilgoris County, South of the  Great Rift valley. She is married to Daniel who is a farmer. The couple has six children with the oldest being 18 years while youngest is two years of age.

Sumaya has been a farmer for the last 21 years and is growing stronger in this business due toa  high demand for maize as a cereal in this part of Kenya. She joined KADET limited to gain access to micro credit and is taking out her first loan. She will use the loan to hire farming fieldhands and buy maize seedlings for this planting season.

Through hiring other fieldhands, Sumaya is sure of a bumper harvest thus good profits which she will use to improve the family’s living standards and also pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To buy maize seedlings and to hire farming fields

loans.name: Alberto

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “PUNTUALITO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
El socio es el Sr. Alberto;  tiene 43 años de edad y es casado y tiene 6 hijos; el socio tiene un negocio de venta de comida quien conjuntamente trabaja con su esposa en este negocio, a su vez  el socio trabaja  en el sector turismo con su carro, transportando a los turistas a sus respectivos tours. 
 
El socio solicita el préstamo para comprar productos para cocinar como arroz y carnes.

El socio agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido
texts.en:
Alberto belongs to the “Puntualito” community bank which is located in the Cusco district of the Cusco province and Cusco department. 

Alberto is 43, married, and has 6 children. He has a business of food sales and works together with his wife in the business. He also works in the tourism sector with his car, transporting tourists to their respective tours. 

He requests the loan to purchase cooking products such as rice and meats.

Alberto is thankful to those who take part in his dream by funding the loan, and he commits to making the loan payments on schedule.

loans.use: To purchase cooking products such as rice and meats

loans.name: Dickson Kuya

texts.en:
Dickson Kuya K. is 27-years-old, married to Koitoi K., and he is father of two school going children. Dickson is a businessman involved in buying and selling of cows and he has been doing this for the last ten years. 

Dickson learnt about KADET through a marketing campaign done by KADET staff in his area of residence. This will be his first loan. He is planning to buy more cows. He will fatten the cows for about five months, then he will take them to the market to sell. With the profits he hopes to make from the proceeds of this loan, he plans to hire land for farming to increase his income.

His future dream is that he will be able to do well in business. His hope and dream is to become a large scale and commercial business man.

loans.use: To more cows and sell them after five months.

loans.name: Naida

texts.en:
Naida R., from the village of Manamong, Aloran, Misamis Occidental is 38 years old, married and has 3 children. To make a living, Naida owns and operates a business venture in the agricultural sector running a farm in local community. Engaged in her business for over five years, she earns approximately 4000 PHP a month.

In August 14, 2008 Naida joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having fully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from PMPC used to add her capital from her business, she is now requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP for additional capital. This will be Naida seventh loan from PMPC, and she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.
*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To provide additional capital of her farming business

loans.name: Lucia Milagros

texts.es: Solicitante, tiene 32 años, es madre soltera, vive en casa familiar, tiene un hijo que esta en edad escolar, se dedica al negocio hace mas de 4 años,  señora tiene la meta de tener negocio propio, y cumplir con sus sueños y objetivos, solicita credito para capital de trabajo, para invertir en el negocio,
texts.en: Lucia is 32-years old, a single mother, and lives in the family home. She has a school-aged son. She has been running her business for more than four years. Her goal is to have her own business and fulfill her dreams. Lucia is seeking financing so she can buy more products for her business.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Davud

texts.ru: Хасанов Давуд проживает в районе Шахритус. Возраст, 47 лет. Женат. Имеет троих детей. Образование среднее. Зарабатывает путем разведения крупно - рогатого скота. Этим видом деятельности занимается 15 лет. Кредит берет для закупа крупно - рогатого скота, чтобы увеличить их количество. Он хочет расширить свой бизнес и улучшить финансовое положение в семье.
texts.en:
Davud H. lives in the Shahritus region. He is 47 years old, married and has three children. He completed secondary education.

He earns his living by raising livestock. He has been engaged in these types of activities for 15 years. The loan will be used to buy young animals, in order to increase their quantity. 

He wants to expand his business and to improve the financial situation in his family.

loans.use: To purchase young animals

loans.name: Victoriano

texts.es:
Don Victoriano R. E. es trabajador de una empresa de Acueductos desde hace 20 años, desempeñando el cargo de Agente de Seguridad.

El es Casado de 55 años de edad, tiene 2 personas a su cargo y una de estas es menor de edad. El vive en el departamento de Managua en el Municipio de Ciudad Sandino.

Este es el primer crédito con CEPRODEL, el lo solicita para mejorar su casa, como es ponerle piso y hacer un muro.
texts.en:
Victoriano R. E. has worked for an aqueduct company for 20 years.  He is a security guard.

He is 55 years old and married.  He has two people under his care, and one is a minor.  He lives in the Managua department in the Ciudad Sandino municipality.

This is his first loan with Ceprodel.  He is requesting the loan to improve his house.  He will do things like put down a floor and build a wall.

loans.use: To improve his house by putting down a floor and building a wall

loans.name: Linda Buwere Women's Group-Mukono

texts.en: M. Sarah is a 31-year-old hardworking and enterprising businesswoman who has been operating a used clothing sales business in Nasuti-Mukono for 6 years. The happily married mother of two says her business's clientele consists mostly of local residents. With the improving prospects after getting this loan, M. Sarah is anticipating the growth of her business, which currently generates 65,000 UGX weekly. M. Sarah will use this loan to purchase more bales of used clothing to resell.

loans.use: to purchase more secondhand clothing

loans.name: Demetria

texts.es: Demetria D. 57 años D. edad, natural del distrito D. Quimbiri, esta casada con Isidro D. 58 años y tienen 02 hijos Linda D. 21 años y Marilyn D. 19 años juntos residen en su propia casa en la  comunidad D. nueva esperanza departamento D. Cusco. Demetria y su esposo Isidro, son el sostén D. su hogar por el cual se esmeran cada día por el mejor bienestar D. su familia, Demetria se dedica con mucho esmero a la labor que realiza. Su trabajo consiste en labrar la tierra, es campesina y cuenta con 11 hectáreas D. terreno; donD. ha cultivado, cacao, hojas D. coca, café, plátano y cítricos. Ha trabajado durante 30 años y en tiempos D. cosecha cuenta con el apoyo D. la mano ajena por lo cual contrata jornaleros; D. esa manera podrá cosechar más rápido y poder comercializar D. manera vertiginosa dichos productos a las empresas acopiadoras, quienes le remuneran muy bien por cada kilogramo D. cada producto que venD.. El problema D. su trabajo radica en no poder combatir con los insectos, que perjudican a sus plantaciones, pero ahora lo que más prioriza es comprar mas plantones D. cítricos para expandir sus sembríos y aumentar en su producción. Para  así darle una buena estabilidad económica a  su familia y pasar con tranquilidad su edad longeva. Este es su primer crédito con MFP, sabe que tiene la responsabilidad D. pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente y está dispuesta a hacerlo. Se siente muy agradecida con la institución por facilitarle el crédito solicitado. Con los 3,000 nuevos soles solicitados, comprará un lote D. terreno en donD. construirá su casa ha base D. material noble, ubicada en la ciudad D. Quimbiri.
texts.en:
Demetria is 57 years old and originally from the district of Quimbiri. She is married to Isidro, 58, and they have two children: Linda, 21 years old, and Marilyn, 19 years old. They all live in a house they own in the Nueva Esperanza community in the department of Cusco. Demetria and her husband Isidro are the pillar of their home and work hard every day to ensure the well being of their family. 

Demetria is devoted to her work. She is a farmer and ploughs the land; she has 30 hectares of land, where she grows cocoa, coca leaves, coffee, banana and citrus fruits. She has worked for 30 years. During the harvest she hires labourers to help her, so as to harvest faster and quickly sell her products to the wholesalers, who pay her very well for every kilogram of product she sells them. The problem with her work is being unable to combat the insects that damage her crops. However, her priority at the moment is to buy more citrus plants in order to expand her crops and increase production, so as to proviD. her family with financial security and have a quiet old age. 

This is her first loan with MFP. She is aware that she is responsible for paying all installments on time and she is prepared to do so. She is very grateful to the institution for having provided her with the requested loan. With the 3,000 soles requested she will buy a plot of land in the city of Quimbiri where she will build her home with solid materials.

loans.use: Buy a plot of land where to build her home.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en:
Efua A. lives in Abee which is a community near the coastline near Elmina. Her job is to sell locally-made body powder and soap as well as oil and yams. She sells these goods by carrying them on her head in large bowl. She then walks the streets in her village. 

Efua has three children she is taking care of all by herself because she is divorced and does not get any support form the children’s father. Most of the money she makes with her business is being used to take care of the basic needs of her family. She also sends her children to school which means she has to pay for books and other learning material. 

To be able to provide the opportunity of education for her children she would like to expand her business. In order to achieve this goal Efua wants to buy more goods to be able to sell more and as a result increase her profit.

loans.use: to buy more goods such as locally-made body powder, etc. for resale.

loans.name: Melba

texts.en:
Melba is 51 years old and has six children, one of them in school. Melba is married. Melba is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Melba requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional pigs and feed.

Melba has been in this business for 26 years. Melba also earns additional income from fish and food vending.

In the future, Melba would like to send her kids to school and use her income for family needs.

loans.use: to purchase additional pigs and feed

loans.name: Francois

texts.en:
Francois is 41 and is married with three children between the ages of 3 and 12 years old.  He sells various products such as slippers, umbrellas, underwear, bananas, etc. He operates his business from 7am to 6pm every day except on Saturday, and he has been engaged in this business for eleven years. His place of business is clean.

Francois has requested a loan from Kiva lenders in order to buy more products, such as slippers, umbrellas, underwear, bananas, etc. to sell.  He will reinvest any profits in this business and save for the future.

loans.use: to purchase more slippers, umbrellas, underwear, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Evaline

texts.en:
Evaline is 42 years old and her spouse Geoffrey is a teacher. They have four children, aged 17,15,11 and eight years old.  Evaline owns a cereals store in Chepkongony trading centre in Kapsabet town. She has been in the business for a period of nine years earning a monthly income of KES 19,500.

Evaline has borrowed a loan from KADET LTD of KES 50,000, this being her second loan after servicing the first loan successfully. She hopes to use the money to purchase 15 bags of dry maize and three bags of beans. She will resell these items to the local suppliers.

The profits will be used to increase the inventory in the store. She hopes to become a major supplier of maize in the area in the future.

loans.use: to purchase maize and beans for resale.

loans.name: Flor Esterfilia

texts.es:
Flor  tiene 44 años de edad, tiene 2 hijos.  Vive en casa propia la cual esta ubicada en un pequeño sector llamado Cruz de la Esperanza en la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Flor se dedica a la venta de útiles escolares, de oficina y productos escolares en su domicilio, desde hace 02 años.  A lo largo de este tiempo sus ventas se han visto en aumento en estos dos años en los cuales también ha ganado ganando la fidelidad de un  buen numero de clientes, los cuales están muy contentos con sus productos. 

Flor ha decidido solicitar un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa  de 1000nuevos soles.  El destino del crédito será para la compra de más útiles escolares y para comprar un lote de productos de belleza que se encuentra en oferta. El cual le dará una mayor rentabilidad.

Flor  es una persona bastante tranquila y responsable. Su mayor anhelo es poder crecer como empresaria y salir adelante.   Flor es una clienta nueva para Edpyme Alternativa, con buenas referencias personales y laborales.
texts.en:
Flor is 44 years old and has 2 children. She lives in her own home located in a small area, Cruz de la Esperanza, in Chiclayo.

Flor has been selling writing materials for school or office and scholastic products in her home for 2 years. During these 2 years her sales have increased and she has also won the loyalty of a good number of clients, who are very happy with her products.

Flor has decided to apply to Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 1000 PEN. The loan will be used to buy more writing materials and a batch of beauty products currently on offer, which will provide her with greater profit.

Flor is quite a calm and responsible person. Her greatest desire is to be able to grow and progress as a business woman.  Flor is a new client for Edpyme Alternativa, with good personal and work references.

loans.use: To purchase more merchandise to further her business.

loans.name: Aba

texts.en: Aba is married and has four children. She has been educated through junior high school. Her husband is a security man. Aba sells smoked fish at Kwaprow, near Abura in Cape Coast. She uses her income to pay for school fees and utility bills, as a way of assisting her husband. Aba will use the loan to purchase more fresh fish to smoke, to expand her business. With the new profits from her expanded business, Aba plans to provide a meaningful education for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more fresh fish to smoke, to expand her business.

loans.name: Flavia

texts.en:
Flavia works hard to support her family. She is married and has a business in the Philippines selling used clothes.

Flavia has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional bundles of used clothes to sell. She has been in this business for 30 years now. In the future, Flavia would like to save enough to provide a secure future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional bundles of used clothes to sell.

loans.name: Zaid

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 30 years old, married and has one child. He lives with six family members, four of whom work.

Zaid has owned a food market since 2006, selling cheese, juices, bread, daily use items, and dairy products. He is committed to his work and loyal to his clients. 

He is requesting a $2400 loan to buy a diesel generator. He is aiming to increase his income so he can improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: To buy a diesel generator.

loans.name: Marvin Antonio

texts.es: Marvin Antonio tiene 34 años, su actividad es la venta de refrescos y golosinas. Tiene más de 11 años en este negocio, es una persona luchadora que disfruta de su actividad. El negocio lo inicio cuando decidió invertir en ciertos productos fue así que con la ayuda de los financiamientos su negocio ha podido crecer. Ahora el solicita este crédito para la compra de bolsas, frutas, azúcar, pajilla, vasos desechables y una gran variedad de golosinas.
texts.en:
Marvin Antonio is 34 years old and has a business selling refreshments and candy. He has been in business for more than 11 years. Marvin is a determined person who enjoys his work. He started this business when he decided to invest in certain products. With the help of loans, he has been able to grow his business.

Now he is requesting a loan to buy bags, fruit, sugar, straws, disposable cups, and a variety of candy.

loans.use: to purchase bags, fruit, sugar, straws, disposable cups, and a variety of candy.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a motorbike and pigs to feed for selling

loans.name: Luis Alfro

texts.es:
Luis de 52 años,  es el propietario de un negocio llamado “Tienda la Única”, a 10 minutos del mar, allí donde vive con su esposa y sus 4 hijos en las edades de 12 a 18, tiene un punto de venta donde las amas de casa y la comunidad  de su barrio y de sus alrededores, compran al detalle productos de la canasta familiar, como ranchos, víveres, bebidas abarrotes etc. Sus clientes lo reconocen y cada día sus productos rotan mucho más rápido hasta quedarse sin existencia de algunos de ellos.  Esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará en mayor volumen, con ello conservaría un stock de mercancías no perecederas,  como café, azucar, arroz, aceite, enlatados, refrescos y ahorraría en precio  por la compra en volumen y también el transporte, adicionalmente teniendo productos que muy pronto terminan para no decir “no hay” a sus clientes. 
Luis inició su vida comercial hace 25 años  aproximadamente,  cuando proveniente de su natal zapoteca (departamento de Santander) se instaló en la Costa caribe e inició como empleado de una tienda, después se independizó en inició la distribución de productos lácteos en una bicicleta y agregó galletería y confitería, simultáneamente trabajó en tareas de la construcción, en una panadería hasta que recapitulando su experiencia, emprendió hace 7 meses su negocio de tienda con mucho éxito y por la aceptación que tiene de su clientela en su nicho de mercado. Luis tien el gran apoyo de su familia especialmente de sus dos hijos, que ya construyen su experiencia empresarial en su negocio mientras estudian, por eso su mayor anhelo es dejarle algún dia una fuente de ingreso segura y para ello debe trabajar persistentemente y con disciplina. Mientras esto ocurre su actual negocio le permite una rentabilidad sobre las ventas  no menor del 8,7% mientras su costo de ventas es de un 84,1% .
texts.en:
Luis is 52 years old and the owner of a business called “Tienda la Única” (The Only Store), which is 10 minutes away from the sea. He lives with his wife and their four children who range in age from 12 to 18. Housewives from the community and the surrounding areas come to his store to buy everyday items for their families such as snacks, food, beverages, groceries, and other items. His customers know him and his products sell quickly to the point that he runs out of a few items. For this reason he is requesting a Kiva loan, his first form of financing through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. He will use the funds to buy in large quantities so that he can maintain a stock of non-perishable goods such as coffee, sugar, rice, oil, canned foods, and soft drinks. By purchasing in volume, Luis will be able to get a discount and also save on shipping costs. In addition, by having more products in stock, he can stop saying “We’ve run out” to his customers.

Luis started working approximately 25 years ago. This native of Zapoteca, in the Department of Santander, moved to the Caribbean coast and started a job as a store clerk. Afterwards, he became independent and started selling dairy products from a bicycle. He also started selling candy and cookies while holding down other jobs working in construction and at a bakery so that he could gain experience. Seven months ago, Luis opened his store with great success and a warm reception from the customers who make up his niche market. Luis has the support of his family, especially from two of his children who have gained business experience while going to school. His greatest wish is to one day leave them with a secure source of income so that they can work persistently and with discipline. In the meantime, his current business is generating sales profitability of no less than 8.7% while his cost of sales is 84.1%.

loans.use: to purchase non-perishable goods in bulk such as coffee, sugar, rice, oil, canned foods, and soft drinks.

loans.name: Apal's Group

texts.en:
Apal, 28, is the treasurer of this group. She resides in the town of Tokmok with her husband and a four-year-old child. Apal’s husband is employed in a local plant, while she is a nurse in a nearby hospital. Apal has pursued this sphere, because she always knew how important health is and wanted to help make changes in people’s lives. However, after the birth of her child, she realized this job couldn’t earn enough to provide for her child's living expenses. So, in cooperation with her husband, she decided to try cattle breeding. And she wasn’t mistaken. Soon Apal bought her first calves for 5 000 soms, fattened and resold them at a good deal. Now she applied for a loan from Kiva to buy some more livestock for further breeding and reselling. If she succeeds, Apal would like to start a dairy business too. 

           --- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 

MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
								
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora is married, with three grown up children.   She is 47 years old and her spouse is a farmer.  Flora's shop sells many kinds of products, such as shampoo, toothbrushes, noodles, confectioneries and soft drinks.  She also sells vegetables and fruits. She started this business five years ago, and it provides the main source of income for her family.

Flora is requesting a loan to purchase a greater quantity and variety of basic goods, such as snack foods and beverages, to stock her store. She hopes that will enable her to increase the turnover of her business and help her to improve her living conditions and set aside some savings.

loans.use: to purchase milk, coffee, noodles and vegetables for her store

loans.name: Osnia

texts.en:
Osnia is age 28  and married to Amos, a 28 year old motor-taxi driver. They are blessed with a son  Arly, 8 who is studying in the second grade of theelementary school. Osnia owns a business of selling vegetables i.e. tomatoes, mustard greens, kangkung, carrots as well as betel nut and betel vine. She has been engaged in this business for 12 years. The business is located 500 meters from her house and she usually operates the business from 7 am to 8 pm. 

Currently, Osnia is planning to improve her business by renovating her business place and adding more stock of vegetables and kitchen herbs. To do so, Osnia is seeking for a loan of IDR 10,000,000 from TLM.

loans.use: To renovate her business place and to add more stock of vegetables and kitchen herbs to sell

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is 32 years old, married and has a two-year-old child.  

She runs a pub to earn a living. She has operated the business for one year.  

Through the training conducted by Faulu Kenya on business management skills, she has gained a lot of skills, hence improving her business.

Margaret hopes to open other outlets of her business in the future. She has requested 50,000 KES to buy beer and soda.

loans.use: To buy beer and soda.

loans.name: Mirzosaid

texts.ru: Мирзосаид честный, трудолюбивый. Раньше он продавал мебель, вот уже год занимается  покупкой и реализацией продуктов питания. Он приобретает товар с центрального рынка. Жена помогает ему в бизнесе, у них 2 детей. У Мирзосаида собственный магазин. Он имеет хорошую репутацию. Мирзосаид хочет развить бизнес, но у него нет достаточных средств. Он просит займ в размере 1000$ США и надеется, что вы ему поможете. Мирзосаид заранее благодарит вас за понимание.
texts.en: Mirzosaid is honest and hardworking. Previously he has been selling furniture but since last year he has managed his own grocery store. He purchases goods to sell in his store from the central market. His wife helps him with his business and they have two children together. Mirzosaid's grocery store has a good reputation. He would like to add more variety to the goods he offers in his store, but he is lacking the capital to make the bulk purchases. That is why Mirzosaid is requesting a loan of 1000 US dollars and he is hoping for your help. Mirzosaid would like to thank all of his lenders in advance!

loans.use: to purchase groceries

loans.name: Najib

texts.en: Najib has owned a cattle farm since 2007, where he raises cattle, poultry, chicks, etc. He is a 40-year-old Lebanese married man. He is living with his wife and one school-aged child. His business income is very important because he represents the only income provider for his family. Today, he is asking to borrow $1200 from Kiva's partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase fodder for the animals and added merchandise needed. Najib is very positive and plans to further expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase fodder for the animals and added merchandise needed

loans.name: Mauricia

texts.en:
Mauricia is 47 years old and is a married woman with 4 children. Her oldest child is 24 years old. Mauricia's husband is a farmer.

Mauricia sells barbecue to the people in her community. She marinates pork and chicken meat in the morning to sell in the afternoon. She also raises chickens to produce and sell eggs. 

Mauricia requested this loan to purchase pork and chicken meat and feeds. She hopes for her business to improve.

loans.use: buy pork and chicken meat and feeds

loans.name: Fausta

texts.es: La socia actualmente tiene 74 años D. edad, la socia continua con su negocio D. internet ella tiene su cabina D. internet y ha ido muy bien con lo que pudo ahorrar pago sus servicios y compro algunos pequeños accesorios y el mantenimiento D. las maquinas, la socia también se dedica a realizar tejidos como mantas para la venta ella en esta ocasión desea invertir el prestamo en la compra D. materiales para la elaboración D. las mantas gruesas que la socia realiza, ella desea tener buena cantidad D. tejidos en mantas para la venta en la epoca naviD.ña y tener un ingreso extra para los regalos D. los hijos y los nietos, la socia solicita el prestamo para invertir en la compra D. materiales como lanas D. colores y diferentes grosores para la elaboracion D. mantas.
texts.en: Fausta is now 74 years old, and is continuing to work in her internet cafe business, and it is going very well.  With her savings she was able to pay for her services and buy some small accessories, and do maintenance on her computers.  Fausta also makes knitted items such as blankets to sell.  At this time, she wants to invest the loan in purchasing materials to make the thick blankets that she knits.  She wants to have a good quantity of knitted blankets to sell during the Christmas season, so that she will have extra income to buy gifts for her children and grandchildren.  Fausta requests a loan to invest in materials such as a variety of wool in different colors and weights to use making blankets.

loans.use: to purchase materials to make blankets.

loans.name: Madina

texts.en:
Madina lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has 4 children, none of whom are in school. Madina has operated a pub business for over 10 years, and she works 7 days out of every week. 

Madina has requested a loan of 700,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more crates of beer and soda. Madina's main business challenges include transportation and seasonality. Her goals and hopes for her business are to own a fully stocked pub and to become a wholesaler. Madina lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity but not to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more crates of beer and soda

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizers and agricultural inputs.

loans.name: Ana

texts.es: Ana, de 32 años de edad; es madre soltera vive en casa alquilada junto a sus dos hijos Ingrid de 07 años y Yorsin de 11 años a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. Ana, es un ejemplo de madre que se esfuerza por darles lo mejor a sus hijos; pues ella se dedica a la venta de bebidas como: refrescos, cremoladas, gaseosas, cerveza. Sus principales clientes son sus vecinos, pues saben que los refrescos que toman es de fruta natural y la  atención es amable de parte de Ana. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es poder conversar con sus vecinos, pues desde hace 05 meses que trabaja en esta actividad y considera rentable este negocio, por lo que desea ampliarlo y tener más productos que ofrecer. Este será su préstamo número 02 con MFP, por tanto espera de su colaboración para continuar con sus objetivos de trabajo. En su banco comunal agradece a sus compañeros por elegirla como presidenta de su grupo. Con los 2,000 nuevos soles, podrá invertirlo en la comprar gaseosas, cervezas y  frutas para elaborar refresco como: piña, maíz morado, fresa, etc.
texts.en:
Ana, 32, is a single mother living in a rented house with her two children: Ingrid, 7, and Yorsin, 11 that she wants to provide a better quality of life for.  


Ana is an example of a mother who strives to provide the best for her children.  She sells beverages like  fruit smoothies, soft-drinks and beer.  Her main customers are her neighbors because they know that the refreshments they are enjoying are made from fresh fruit and Ana treats them with kindness.


What she likes best about her work is chatting with her neighbors.  She’s been in this line of work for five months and she believes it’s profitable so wants to expand it and have more products to sell.


This will be her MFP loan #2 so she hopes for your support to continue toward her work goals.  She thanks her fellow communal bank members for electing her President.


She will use the 2000 new soles to buy soft-drinks, beer and fruit to make smoothies with: pineapple, purple corn, strawberries, etc.

loans.use: to buy soft-drinks, beer and various types of fruit.

loans.name: Ngoc

texts.en:
Ngoc is 60 years old and single. She lives in Ho Chi Minh City. Ngoc earns an income by buying bulbs of garlic from wholesalers and then peeling the outer layer to sell to her customers for food production. She has done this since 2005. 

Ngoc is requesting a loan, which she will use to buy a larger quantity of garlic to increase her production for selling. This loan will allow her to increase her income and set aside some savings.

loans.use: to purchase a larger quantity of garlic to increase her production.

loans.name: Luz Maria

texts.es: La señora Luz Maria a sus 47 años de edad se dedica a la venta de ropa femenina e infantil, con los frutos de esta actividad ha podido sacar adelante a sus dos hijos puesto que no cuenta con el apoyo de su cónyuge del cual se separo hace dos años. Con el fin de mejorar en cuanto a su calidad de vida y bienestar de sus hijos, desea adquirir surtido con el cual pueda recuperar su clientela, mejorar sus ingresos y cumplir su sueño algún día de tener su propio almacén.
texts.en:
Luz Maria is 47, and sells women's and children's clothing. With the proceeds of this business, she has been able to raise her two children, as she doesn't have the support of her partner, from whom she separated two years ago.

With the aim of improving her quality of life, and the well-being of her children, she wishes to acquire stock with which she can win customers, improve her income, and fulfil her dream of having her own store one day.

loans.use: To buy a selection of women's and children's clothing.

loans.name: Dulce Deyanira

texts.es: La señora Dulce es una persona emprendedora  y día   con día  se  esfuerza   por  salir  adelante, actualmente  ella  se  dedica  a  la venta de  hamburguesas  la  cual  realiza  en las   noches además de  vender  joyería,   ella  acudió  con nosotros   ya  que   requiere  realizar  la compra  de materia prima para continuar  trabajando en su puesto de comida,  agradece  el apoyo  brindado para  la  realización de  su proyecto   ya  que le  proporcionara la  oportunidad  de  hacer  crecer   su  negocio.
texts.en: Sra. Dulce is an enterprising person who works day after day to get ahead. Currently she is engaged in selling hamburgers which she makes at night. In addition she sells jewelry. She came to us since she needs to purchase ingredients so she can continue working at her food stall. She is grateful for the support enabling her to carry on her work, since it provides her the opportunity to expand her business

loans.use: to purchase ingredients to make hamburgers.

loans.name: ´tony´jose Antonio

texts.en:
I have nearly 20 years of experience in making barbecue tacos (my favoriate Mexican Food!) in a small trailer. This business has been my principal source of living for me, my wife, and my children.

Unfortunately, due to a strong storm that recently whipped through Nuevo Laredo, my small trailer was severely damaged and my ingredients for making tacos were rotten when the storm ended. That is why I am asking for support to help rebuild my trailer and buy new equipment to heat the food for my customers. This loan will help me to continue generating income that will allow me to support the needs of my family.

I would like to ask for a loan of $950 dollars. More specifically, this loan money will be used for the reconstruction of my trailer and to purchase the necessary equipment for my kitchen operation. And if there are left over funds, I wish to purchase some more ingredients to meet the needs of my customers.

Thank you Kiva Lenders!

Español

Tengo casi 20 años de experiencia en la elaboración del tacos de barbacoa (mi comida mexicana favorita) en pequeño remolque. Este negocio ha sido mi fuente principal de vida para mi esposa, mis niños y propia. Desafortunadamente, debido a una fuerte tormenta que azotó recientemente en Nuevo Laredo, mi pequeño remolque fue dañado seriamente y de la misma manera los los ingredients. Por lo cual estoy pidiendo ayuda para reconstruir mi remolque y a comprar equipo nuevo para calentar los alimentos y seguir vendiendo a mis clientes. Este préstamo me ayudará a continuar generando ingresos que permitirá cubrir las necesidades de mi familia. Me gustaria solicitar un préstamo de $950 dólares. Y pagarlo en un plazo de 6 a 12 meses, este dinero será utilizado para la reconstrucción de mi remolque el equipo necesario para calendar alimento en la cocina del remolque y si sobre fondos, deseo comprar algo de ingredientes para la elaboración de tacos y asi poder seguir vendiendo a mis clientes. Gracias por su ayuda.

loans.use: trailer rebuild, buy heat and cook equipment and some ingredients for food preparation

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Open a second-hand clothing shop

loans.name: Simamao

texts.en: 30-year old Simamao comes from the small Samoan village of Saleilua.  She is married and has two children.  However, her husband is unemployed, making Simamao the breadwinner of the family.  She runs a small store in her village.  When fully stocked, Simamao can bring in a handsome profit, as the next general store is a mile away.  However, she is currently running low on inventory, and she is desperate for a loan to finance her next inventory purchase to ensure she can maintain a consistent supply for her local customers.  Her goal is to keep her customers satisfied and loyal.

loans.use: Buy merchandise and food for re-sale

loans.name: Oleg

texts.en:
Oleg has combined his love of the outdoors and healthy living with a successful rental and sales business catering to outdoor sports enthusiasts. He is based in Truskavyets, a little town near the beautiful Carpathian mountains in western Ukraine. This area is popular with tourists seeking active vacations during both the summer and winter seasons. 

Oleg rents and sells a variety of recreational equipment for people to enjoy in the outdoors. He also offers guided tours of the region along with food and lodging. He has extensive experience in his field and enjoys sharing with others. This has earned him a great reputation and a loyal clientele. Oleg makes about $600-$700 per month, enough to support himself, his wife and his son. He is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase additional rental equipment, including rock-climbing gear and paintball guns. This loan will help him improve his high quality services and provide great experiences for many more customers.

loans.use: Purchase outdoor equipment to upgrade his rental/sales business

loans.name: Luís

texts.en:
Since he was 15 years old, Luís had always liked animals. He raised chickens, ducks and pigeons in his house. His neighbors already knew him and began to buy these animals from him. When Luís got married, he continued to work on his business and also specialized in raising exotic animals such as doves, hens and peacocks. He already has a steady stream of clients and places to exhibit his animals, where he also delivers them.

The pens are in the backyard of his house and he checks and attends to the animals daily. Every weekend, Luís goes to the market and stores to offer his products. Besides this activity, Luís cooks at the community kitchens starting from 5:00 PM. These are his only sources of income.

Luís improved the structure of his pens implement a cleaning out system with a previous loan he received. He is now hopeful that he can invest in more exotic types of birds and poultry that are more profitable than the ones he raises now.

He is 37 years old, married with 3 children. His wife works at a company and supports him with the household expenses. Together they have been able to acquire their posessions—especially the house which they have changed from a house made of cane to a cement one. Theirs is a hard-working and humble family; his wishes are for his children to be able to finish school and so to have their incomes from work to help the family.

loans.use: Buy different types of birds

loans.name: Silvia Florentina

texts.es:
My name is Silvia E.. I have dedicated myself to the sale of consumer goods for the past 4 years and I am doing well but I need to offer a greater variety of products for sale. I am requesting the loan to purchase meats, dairy products and canned goods. My customers are very loyal. They appreciate the manner in which I provide service and the prices and quality of my goods. With the additional income, I wish to purchase a refrigerator to expand the products I offer and provide for my family, which is most important.

Translated from Spanish by Christian Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

Mi nombre es Silvia E. me dedico a la venta de productos de consumo popular, actividad que realizo hace 4 años en la cual me va bien, pero necesito tener mas variedad de productos para la venta, por eso estoy solicitando mi prestamo para poder comprar carnes, lacteos y embutidos, mis clientes son muy buenos ya que les gusta la forma en que los atiendo y tambien la calidad y los precios de mis productos, con la ganancia que obtenga deseo poder comprar un refrigerador para tener mas productos que necesiten refrigeracion tambien alimentar mi familia que es lo mas importante.

loans.use:
Purchase of milk, cheese, canned goods, poultry, beef, butter and sausages

compra de leche, queso, embutidos, carnes de pollo y res, mantequilla, chorizos

loans.name: Alicia De La Cruz

texts.en:
Alicia became a client of FSMA six months ago, when she took her first loan which she invested to enlarge a small business she had started seven months before that. She sells ‘longaniza’ (spicy sausage), fried bananas, potatoes and some pâtés and natural juice.

Alicia is 32 years old and is a single mother of five children. On her own, she has to provide food and educate them; she also has to pay the rent for her house and be prepared for any emergency situation. At this time, her fried food business is her only source of income.

Alicia hopes her business can keep growing and she can have her own locale where she can run her business. With the loan requested, she will purchase raw materials in order to keep producing food and preparing and selling juice. That way, she will continue saving money and improve her large family’s living conditions. Alicia will also be closer to achieving her goal which is to have a cafeteria one of these days.

loans.use: To buy raw materials in order to keep on producing food for her fried food business

loans.name: Maria Natividad

texts.es:
Maria was born in Cajamarca and was a primary school teacher until six years ago, when she decided to sell clothes in the local market. Three and a half years ago, she opened a convenience store in her home.

She is a kind, hard working mother of three children (the youngest is adopted) who struggles daily to give her children the best so they may receive the appropriate education.

She is asking for the loan to purchase goods for the convenience store and to be able to rent the home she wants to build for additional income.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise and house construction

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es:
Antonio L. is 67 years old, married and has three adult children, and one of his daughters works with him. Antonio works in media marketing, ranging from publicity and advertisements to professional service presentations, promotions, making Web sites, technical supports, etc. On top of this, he also runs a small business with 12 employees that does human resource consulting.

With the loan Antonio will purchase furniture for the office. He is in the green shirt in the photo and is standing with one of his employees in charge of commercials.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

El señor Antonio L. tiene 67 años, es casado, tiene tres hijos mayores de edad de los cuales una hija trabaja con él. Antonio se dedica al Marketing de Medios, como por ejemplo publicidad, anuncios comerciales, presentación de Servicios de profesionales, promociones, elaboración de páginas Web, soporte técnico, etc.

Además de eso tiene otra micro empresa que se dedica a la consultaría de Recursos Humanos donde da empleo a 12 personas.

El crédito que solicita lo invertirá en su publicitaria para la compra de muebles para la empresa. En la foto es el señor de remera verde que aparece junto con uno de sus empleados encargados de la edición de los comerciales.

loans.use: Purchase office furniture.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria has been a member of the community bank “Cocharacas” for two years. Through the community bank she learned to be responsible, punctual, how to educate her children, and to save.

Victoria is 44 years old. She is married and has four children. Victoria lives in the district of Acosyinchos, which is 90 minutes outside of the city of Ayacucho.

Together with her husband Victoria weaves a variety of products. She sells them to an intermediary and sometimes sells them in Ayacucho. She uses laborers to sell them at local markets.

Victoria needs a loan of 1000 soles (3 soles = $1), which she well use to buy wood and pay her laborers.

One of the most important aspects of the community bank is the interest-earning savings account each associate has. Victoria plans to use her savings to pay for her children’s education. Her dream is to own a home in the city of Ayacucho, and that her children will be professionals.

loans.use: Victoria needs a loan of 1000 soles (3 soles = $1), which she well use to buy wood and pay her laborers.

loans.name: Mario Alberto

texts.es:
Mario is 52 years old and lives in the Reconciliacion Villa. He's married and has 3 children. His wife, who has always been a great help to him, works in a cafeteria, and he works doing public transportation since from 8 years ago. Currently he is owner of a refrigeration plant, and through his many responsibilities, they have gotten ahead. With hard work and good financial habits, they have made improvements to their humble home. Now he is requesting a loan in order to further improve his house. This is how this gentleman has improved his quality of life and has made his small home better for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva volunteer.

Mario de 52 años de edad vive en Villa Reconciliación casado y con 3 hijos, su esposa que siempre ha significado un valioso apoyo para él, trabaja en un cafetín y él de transportista desde hace 8 años, es dueño de un taller de refrigeración y es en sus múltiples actividades que han logrado salir adelante, con esfuerzo y buen comportamiento de crédito han mejorado su humilde vivienda. Solicita un crédito para realizar una mejora en su casa. Así este señor ha ido mejorando calidad de vida y haciendo de su pequeña vivienda un hogar agradable para su familia.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials to improve his home. (Comprar materiales de construcción para su vivienda)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy leather, string, paint, and footwear.

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es:
Isabel started her business in order to support her children, who - in her own words - are her reason for living. When she divorced, Isabel had many financial problems, as she needed to pay off debts which her husband left her. In addition, he gave her no child support, which is the reason that she began her business 9 years ago. In the beginning she only had a grill outside her parents´ home where she started selling food. Now she has established a business selling roasted chickens and thanks to this business, has been able to maintain and educate her 4 children.

She currently needs a loan for US$1,175, which will be repaid in 6 months, to invest in some publicity and promotional articles for the business, as she is about to open a new point of sale. With your help, Isabel will reach her goals.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

Isabel inició el negocio para mantener a sus hijos que son la razón de su vida, según sus palabras. Al divorciarse Isabel tuvo muchos problemas económicos, ya que necesitaba pagar deudas que le dejó su esposo, y además el no le daba pensión para la manutención de sus hijos; por lo que comenzó hace nueve años con su negocio, al principio solo con una parrilla afuera de la casa de sus padres, donde empezó a vender comida a la gente, hasta que logro establecerse como un negocio de venta de pollo asado, gracias a este negocio ha podido mantener y darle educación a sus 4 hijos.

Ahora necesita un préstamo por US $1,175 que pagara en 6 meses para invertirlos en algo de publicidad y artículos promocionales de su negocio ya que ya que abrirá un nuevo punto de venta. Con tu ayuda Isabel alcanzara sus metas.

loans.use: Invest in publicity and promotional articles.

loans.name: Anvar

texts.ru:
Anvar S. lives with his family in Rudaki. He is married and has six children. Additionally, his daughter-in-law and his small grand daughter lives with him. They have a big family, but all of them help each other. His wife works in gold embroidery. She sews and embroiders traditional dresses for brides. He works in the Dekhkon market where he has a shop. He sells vegetables. He wants to take out a loan to increase his product turnover. He can pay off the loan in 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Melissa, Kiva volunteer.

Шокиров Анвар живет со своей семьей в районе Рудаки. Он женат и имеет шестерых детей. Кроме того вместе с ним живет сноха и маленькая внучка. У них большая семья , но они все помогают друг другу. Его жена занимается золотошитьем. Шьет и вышивает нацианальные наряды для невест. Сам он работает на рынке «Дехкон» , где имеет торговую точку. Продает овощи. Хочет получить кредит и увеличить товарооборот . Погасить кредит сможет в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Increase sales

loans.name: Helena

texts.en:
Helena is 39 years old. She is a married woman with 4 children aged 19, 15, 14, and 12. She became a milk seller in 2006. Every day, she works from 8am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $40 from her sales.

In the past, Helena has taken out 2 successful loans from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. Helena now hopes for a loan to buy more milk for her business.

loans.use: to buy more milk for her business

loans.name: Jamila's Group

texts.en:
Jamila baji is married to A. R.. She lives in the small city of Arifwala, Pakistan. She has been living in this city for the last two years. She has no children. Jamila baji is a housewife. Her husband is a salesman and sells spices. He buys spices from different shops and sells them in different markets. Presently he has no money to buy inventory. Therefore, Jamila baji is applying for a loan to buy spices to restart her husband's business.

Jamila is joined in her loan group by four others. Fatima baji and Ishrat baji each want a loan to buy groceries for their grocery shops. Safia baji wants a loan to buy wheat to re-sell. Khalida baji wants a loan to buy more vegetables to re-sell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy more inentory

loans.name: Nimia

texts.es:
La señora Nimia, socia del Grupo de Crédito Mientras Tanto “Las perlitas”, vive en el Departamento y Provincia de San Martín, Distrito de Tarapoto. Desde hace tres años se dedica a la costura y a la venta de productos de belleza. El negocio está ubicado en su propia casa, en el Jr. Libertad  Nº 498. Los clientes son sus vecinos y amigos que viven en la misma ciudad.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000, el cual será cancelado en 6 meses, lo invertirá en la compra de hilos para remallar, telas de diferentes colores y calidades, también pagará la última letra de su máquina remalladota. Nimia confecciona ropa para damas, caballeros y niños, también quiere invertir en perfumes, y desodorante, los cuales son los productos que más solicitan los clientes y que tienen mayor rotación.

Nimia tiene 51 años de edad y es natural de Tarapoto. Su meta es implementar su taller con una vitrina y más máquinas de coser.
texts.en:
Nimia, member of the group "Las perlitas", lives in the department and province of San Martín, District of Tarapoto. For three years Nimia has worked as a seamstress and in the sales of beauty products. The business is located in her own home. Her customers are neighbors and friends from the same city. With this loan of $350 US, which will be paid in 6 months, she will invest in the purchase of thread for sewing, fabrics of different colors and types, and she will also pay the rest of her loan on her sewing machine. Nimia makes clothing for women, men, and children, and would also like to invest in perfumes and deodorant, which are the products most requested by her customers and have the greatest rotation. Nimia is 51 years old and is a native of Tarapoto. Her goal is to install a display area in her shop and add more sewing machines.

Translated from Spanish by Kristy Placido, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Investment in the purchase of thread, fabric, and to pay for her sewing machine.

loans.name: Uth

texts.en: Uth Y., 48, is married and has three children. The family lives in the Kampong Cham province of Cambodia. Uth earns income growing rice and raising pigs, and typically makes US$2.5 per day. Her husband has an ice-cream sales business, and he also makes about US$2.5 per day. Uth Y. would like a loan of US$300 to be able to purchase feed for pigs as well as additional pigs for breeding.

loans.use: Purchase of pigs and feed for pigs

loans.name: Erika Junieth

texts.es: La Joven Erika Junieth solicita a AFODENIC financiamiento de su primer  crédito para invertirlo en mejora de su vivienda, construir los servicios higienicos de su casa, trabaja como conserje desde hace 2 años en la Administracion del Juzgado de Nueva Guinea, a pesar que esta clienta no tiene hijos ayuda a su madre y a su abuelita con los gastos del hogar ya que son de escasos recursos económicos, ella se caracteriza por ser una joven muy responsable, honesta y trabajadora, vive en zona # 8 de Nueva Guinea, desde  niña ha aprendido a trabajar y a valorar lo que mas ama que es su familia,  actualmente esta estudiando una licenciatura en la Universidad  Martin Lutero, su sueño es llegar a ser una profesional para servirle al pais,  y  tener estabilidad laboral para así ayudar a su familia ya que son humildes.
texts.en:
The young Erika Junieth requests from Afodenic her first loan to invest in the remodelling of her home, to put in a bathroom. She has been working as a security guard for the past 2 years at the Courthouse Administration of New Guinea. Although she does not have children of her own she helps her mother and her grandmother with the household expenses, seeing as the financial resources are scarce. She is a very responsible young woman, honest and hard working. She lives in the Zona #8 in New Guinea. Since she was a girl she has learned to work and to value what she loves the most, her family. Currently she is working towards a university degree at Martin Lutero University.
