The other child lives with her and her two grandchildren, ages six and ten.  The grandchildren are in school.  She is a single mother, and she lives in the village of Terencio Sierra de Tela, Atlántida.

She sells women’s and children’s clothes, shoes, perfume, creams, and women’s accessories.  She has had the business in her house for five years.  She previously worked as a cook in hotels, restaurants, and markets.  Then, one of her children started sending her small quantities of clothes and shoes  from the United States.  Upon seeing that they sold, she stocked up on more products.  She now has customers who order from her.  She works full time on Fridays and Saturdays because those are the days that her customers have money.

She has requested a loan from ODEF to buy new clothes and perfume.  She will do this in order to have more stock for her business.  Her plan is to get a place to establish her business.  With the help from the loans and with her earnings she will manage to have her granddaughters complete their education.

loans.use: to stock her business with new clothes and perfume.

loans.name: Viktoriya

texts.ru:
Виктория замужем, у нее двое сыновей. Она живет в селе Великая Знаменка и торгует женской и мужской одеждой на местном рынке. У Виктории два больших широких киоска, что позволяет значительно расширить ассортимент. Киоски расположены в очень удобном месте на базаре. Так как Знаменка – небольшой городок и рынок там, соответственно, тоже небольшой, спросом там пользуется в основном недорогая практичная одежда, которую и предлагает Виктория.   

Виктория занимается торговлей на рынке уже 8 лет. На данный момент доход от бизнеса составляет около 30 000 гривен. Чистая прибыль не превышает 6 000 гривен в месяц. Виктория хотела бы вложить кредит КИВА  в 15 000 гривен в приобретение зимней партии товара. Перед началом холодов на этот тип товара всегда появляется очень хороший спрос. Виктория долгое время занимается бизнесом, прослеживается постоянное развитие, поиск новых видов товара, приносящих более высокую прибыль. Она работает с широким кругом людей, привозит товар под заказ индивидуально. Ее покупатели всегда довольны обслуживанием, ассортиментом и ценами. В будущем Виктория планирует расширение киоска и сферы влияния.
Пометка: история на русском языке
texts.en:
Viktoriya is married and has two sons. She lives in the village of Velikaya Znamenka and sells men's and women's clothes at the local market. Viktoriya has two large, wide stalls, which allow her to expand her collection. The stalls are located in a very convenient spot in the market. As Znamenka is a small town, the market there is small as well and the biggest market is for inexpensive, practical clothing- just the type Viktoria offers.

Viktoriya has been trading in the market for 8 years. At this time, the income from her business is around 30,000 hryvnia. Her net income does not exceed 6,000 hryvnia per month. Viktoria would like to receive a Kiva loan of 15,000 to purchase a winter shipment of goods. Before the cold weather begins, this type of product is always in high demand. Viktoria has been in business for a long time and knows there is constant development, looking for new types of goods which bring in even higher profits. She works in a wide circle of people, ordering her goods individually. Her customers are always satisfied with her service, assortment of goods, and prices. In the future, Viktoriya plans to expand the stall and her sphere of influence.

loans.use: Purchase a shipment of winter clothes

loans.name: Jesus Margarita

texts.es:
La señora Jesus Margarita es soltera, tiene 41 años de edad, cursó el primer año de educación media, se dedica a la tejeduría de cortes típicos, inició este negocio como operaria y hasta el momento lleva 10 años de experiencia.

Solicita un préstamo para la compra de hilos de diferentes colores y clases, y crear mas productos, espera ver en el futuro su negocio grande y con amplio capital
texts.en: Jesus Margarita is 41 years old, single and completed one year of middle school. She makes a living weaving typical styles. She started the business as a machine operator and has 10 years of experience. She is requesting the loan to purchase yarns of different colors and styles to create more products. She hopes in the future to see her business grow and to expand her capital.

loans.use: to purchase yarn.

loans.name: Juan Manuel

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Managua, el señor Juan Manuel  se caracteriza por ser un buen trabajador debido a que ha sabido llevar el bienestar de su hogar y ha logrado darle una mejor condición de vida a su familia. A él se le conoce por ser una persona excelente y con buenos valores morales como persona.

En esta oficina de Ceprodel se presentó el señor Juan Manuel a solicitar crédito para mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda, el objetivo de este crédito lo necesita para la compra de materiales de construcción como bloques, arena, cemento, piedrín, hierro esto será utilizado para hacer una pared y así darle una mejor condición de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
In the city of Managua, Juan Manuel is known for being a good worker due to overseeing the wellbeing of his home and he has given his family a better quality of life.

He is known for being a good person with good personal moral values. 

Juan Manuel came to our Ceprodel office to ask for a loan to improve his housing. He is asking for this loan because he needs to buy construction materials such as blocks, sand, cement, gravel and iron to be used to build a wall and thus give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy construction materials in order to improve his living conditions

loans.name: Mehrikhon

texts.ru: Мехрихон жительница города Турсунзаде. Возраст, 40 лет. Замужем. Имеет двоих детей. Она занимается растениеводством. В этой области она уже семь лет. Кредит берет для закупа минеральных удобрений.
texts.en: Mehrikhon is a resident of the town of Tursun-zoda. She is 40 years old, married and has two children. She grows crops and has been in this business for seven years. She is taking out the loan to buy mineral fertilizer.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizer.

loans.name: Adaligia

texts.es:
Doña Adaligia,  reside en el municipio de Nindirí,  en el  departamento de Masaya. Es casada y se desempeña en la bonita labor de maestra desde hace 23 años.

Actualmente está necesitando realizar unas mejoras en su vivienda y está consciente que Ceprodel se ha dado a la tarea de beneficiar a los maestros por medio de los créditos para que puedan mejorar sus condiciones habitacionales.

Por este motivo, solicita un crédito para la compra de materiales de construcción, como arena , arenilla, cemento, zinc, piedra, hierro, ladrillos, etc. 

De esta manera, mejorará su calidad de vida, y también le ayudado a dar una mejor educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Adaligia lives in the town of Nindirí, in the department of Masaya. She is married and has had the beautiful task of being a teacher for 23 years. 
She is currently making some necessary improvements to her house and she is aware that Ceprodel has been given the task of benefiting teachers by means of giving them loans to improve their living conditions. 
For this reason, she is requesting a loan to buy construction materials such as sand, cement, zinc, stone, iron, bricks, etc.
In this way she will improve her quality of life and it will also help to give a better education to her children.

loans.use: to buy construction materials: sand, cement, zinc, stone, iron, bricks, etc.

loans.name: Fredy

texts.es:
El socio Fredy pertenece al banco comunal "MAMACHA ASUNTA DE CALCA"; El banco se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Calca perteneciente al departamento de Cusco, a una hora de la ciudad del Cusco.

El socio tiene 31 años de edad y es conviviente, la socia tiene 1 hijo de 1  y medio años de edad; El socio trabaja en el ministerio de Salud, paralelamente a esto el socio ayuda con la quinta a su mamá ya que se a vuelto un negocio familiar el apoya con la atención los fines de semana el socio en esta ocasión desea invertir el credito en la compra de cervezas para implementar el negocio familiar de la quinta restaurante. El socio solicita el prestamo para invertir en la compra de cervezas al por mayor para implementar la quinta familiar.


El socio agradece el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el tiempo establecido.
texts.en:
The borrower, Fredy, belongs to the " Mamacha Asunta de Calca" communal bank, located in the province of Calca, which is part of Cusco department, an hour from the city of Cusco. The borrower is 31, and lives with his partner. He has a 1 1/2 year-old child.  

He works in the Ministry of Health. Along with this, he helps his mother with an outdoor restaurant, as it has become a family business. He helps run it on weekends. On this occasion he wishes to use the loan to buy beer for the family business of an outdoor restaurant. 

The borrower is applying for the loan in order to buy beer at wholesale for the family's outdoor restaurant.  

He is grateful for the loan, and promises to make his instalment payments on time.

loans.use: To buy beer at wholesale for the family's outdoor restaurant.

loans.name: Nduni

texts.en: Nduni is 40 years old and married with six children. She runs a retail shop to earn a living. She has been in the business for 10 years and describes her business environment as good because she is visited regularly by her customers. She earns extra income from her farming activities. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, Nduni has been able to grow her business and hopes to expand her business further in the future. She has applied for 20,000 Kenya Shillings to buy sugar and maize flour.

loans.use: To buy sugar and maize flour.

loans.name: Valentina

texts.ru:
Валентина жила с родителями, училась, потом работала на заводе. Вышла замуж в 30 лет, решили с мужем  купить в рассрочку землю, построили теплицы. В начале  приходилось трудно, но  она и ее муж люди трудолюбивые и это их не испугало. 

На своем участке Валентина садит высокорослые помидоры весной, огурцы высаживает осенью. В прошлом году провели отопление в теплицы, теперь приходится учиться выращивать овощи по новому. Немного не удачный был осенний урожай, неожиданное похолодание  плохо повлияло на огурцы и в результате заработали меньше чем ожидали. Поэтому Валентина решила обратиться за кредитом, чтобы закупить уголь для отопления своих теплиц, ведь нужно сейчас позаботится о тепле для своих растений. Она  надеется что в этом году результат будет лучше, так как уже есть опыт прошлого года.  

Примечание: на фото Валентина вместе со своим мужем

loans.use: to purchase coal to heat green houses

loans.name: Lucy's Group

texts.en:
In Andingo village in Ndhiwa sub County, Kenya, Lucy has volunteered to be the promoter for a new chlorine dispenser. Lucy is a friendly member of the community with 3 children. Lucy lives with her family in a house made of concrete walls, concrete floor, and iron roof.

Andingo village does not have a piped water supply, so the community collects their water from Rotary borehole. This water is easily contaminated with bacteria that can cause water-borne diseases. Chlorine dispensers offer a solution to this problem by allowing people to treat their water to make it safe to drink. Lucy’s family, and the 13 other households using the local water source, need a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining chlorine dispensers at the water sources in the area. 

Lucy has volunteered to be the promoter to encourage the community to use the dispenser and to refill it with chlorine when the tank runs low. Lucy volunteered to be the promoter because she wants to help the community by encouraging them to treat water, thus allowing the community to be healthy and prosperous. There are also four other volunteer promoters from the surrounding community who are part of this group loan: Veronica, Jane, Caroline and Julius.

The Kiva loan will be repaid by Evidence Action (www.evidenceaction.org) on behalf of the community through the sale of carbon credits. Using the chlorine dispenser generates carbon credits by avoiding the need to boil water to make it safe to drink. Revenues from the sale of carbon credits to organizations and individuals wanting to reduce carbon footprints will be used to repay Kiva lenders and also to make sure that Lucy’s community can have access to safe water now and in the future.

loans.use: To install and maintain chlorine dispensers to provide access to safe drinking water for the community

loans.name: Juan

texts.en:
Juan is married with one child who is eight years old. He used to work in a factory, but they had to liquidate four years ago. Because money was tight and he had mouths to feed, Juan opened up his own business, which has become a local favorite in Guayaquil. In fact, whenever the Mifex team visits Ecuador, Juan (or “Nene” as he likes to be called) serves up the best dishes around.

He and his wife work seven days a week managing their restaurant which sells rice & beans, beef, chicken, and chorizo. His wife Betty is the cook, and Nene attends to the clients. It wasn’t easy starting the restaurant because they didn’t have much capital. However, like many other Ecuadorian businesses, they started out of their home to save money. Through perseverance, things have gone pretty well over the past four years. They have received such high demand that they had to build an extension to their home just to make space for more tables. Not only are customers coming from the local neighborhood, but from all around Guayaquil. Nene and Betty run the restaurant from 6:30 pm until 2:00 am. They are asking for this loan so that they can buy more tables and chairs, as well as prime materials such as rice and cooking oil.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about Ecuadorian businesses and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: buy more tables and chairs, as well as prime materials such as rice and cooking oil.

loans.name: Pakiza

texts.en:
48-year- old Pakiza lives in Khaladj village,Salyan region. She is married and has 3 children.
She goes to the market and stores to offer her products. 
She has a steady stream of clients and places to exhibit her sheep. She also delivers them.

loans.use: To buy 15 sheep

loans.name: Peleiupu

texts.en: Peleuipu is married with two children. The whole family is living together with Peleiupu's parents-in-law, who are very old. Life is hard for them considering that the whole extended family relies on the meagre income of her husband. When she got to know about the SPBD microfinance program, she thought of the idea of starting a small business to help her husband earn a living. Her first loan from SPBD was used to set up a pancakes and chips business. She sold them to the nearby village school. Later on she discovered that there is great demand for her products on Sunday evenings when most of the households are gathered together for family dinners. Her initial success has given her the confidence to expand her new business by buying a bigger stove and additional stock to be used for her pancakes and chips business.

loans.use: To purchase a new stove and additional stock for her business

loans.name: Nelson

texts.es:
Nelson V. is a very hardworking man. He makes clothes and hats in a small workshop he has in his house. He works there with his wife, Miriam, where each has a sewing machine. They make a certain number of pieces and then sell them to stores in the city market and surrounding areas.

Currently, Nelson and his wife are producing a lot of hats, especially for children. The sale of hats has increased significantly since Nelson invested in inks and stencils for silk screening, which he uses to put personalized names and drawings on his hats. According to Nelson, the hats that are in greatest demand are those that have the logos of various soccer clubs. With winter approaching, Nelson wants to invest in fabrics and materials for making coats, for which he needs a loan of $400.00.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Nelson V. es un hombre muy trabajador, realiza confecciones de ropas y gorras en un pequeño taller que ha formado en su casa junto con su esposa Miriam donde ambos trabajan con una máquina de coser cada uno. Ellos confecciona una cierta cantidad de piezas para luego salir a vender a las tiendas del mercado de la ciudad y alrededores. Actualmente lo que más está produciendo el señor Nelson y su esposa son gorras, sobretodo para niños. La venta de gorras se incrementó notablemente desde que Nelson invirtió en tintas y placas para serigrafia con los que realiza nombres y dibujos personalizados en sus gorras. Según cuenta Nelson las gorras que más se demanda son las que poseen escudos de diversos clubs de fútbol (soccer). De cara el invierno Don Nelson quiere invertir en la compra de telas y materiales para confeccionar ropa de abrigo para lo que necesita un préstamo deUS$400.

loans.use: To buy heavy fabrics for winter, buttons, zippers, threads, and dyes for silk screening

loans.name: Felipe

texts.es:
TRANSLATED BY MATT FLANNERY

Mr. Felipe is 47 years old, iand s widower for 5 years.  Helives with his 3 children in the district Makai de Luque. For more than nine years he has been dedicating himself to the animals for the at his house -- like pig, duck, goats, hens and cows for the sale. 

Also he sells cow milk and goat milk.  He provides to his neighbors the slaughters at the central market of the city. Their daughters dedicate themselves to the tasks of the house. Don Felipe also works by the nights as guard of security in a house and by day makes in order to have sufficient funds to maintain the family. The loan that he asks for he wishes it to invest in the purchase of balanced animals and as well as in the improvement of the corrals of the animals.

ORIGINAL SPANISH
El señor Felipe tiene 47 años, es viudo desde hace 5 años, vive con sus 3 hijos en el barrio Makai de Luque. Desde hace más de nueve años se dedica a la cría de animales para la venta en su casa, como cerdo, pato, cabras, gallinas y vacas para la venta.
También vende leche de vaca y de cabra, provee a sus vecinos y a carnicerías del mercado central de la ciudad. Sus hijas se dedican a los quehaceres de la casa.
Don Felipe también trabaja por las noches como guardia de seguridad en una casa particular  y de día realiza en su casa sus actividades cotidianas para poder tener suficiente ingreso para mantener la familia. 
El crédito que solicita lo desea invertir en la compra de animales y de balanceados así como en la mejora de los corrales de los animales.

loans.use: compra de animales y de balanceados así como en la mejora de los corrales de los animales.

loans.name: Nieves

texts.es:
Nieves is a very hard-working 20-year-old. She began working at 16 helping her mother sell used clothing to help with the family expenses and to finance her studies. She sell clothing on the street three days a week--Monday, Thursday and Sunday from 4:30 AM to 5:00PM and studies garment making at an occupational training center in her town the other days. Her dream is to some day have her own garment shop making t-shirts, overalls and pull-overs. She is working very hard towards this goal. Right now she would like to increase her stock and buy several bundles of used clothing to resell and finance her dream. She is asking for a loan of $500 which she promises to repay in 6 months. With your help, this young entrepreneur will soon see her dream of owning a garment shop a reality.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer.

Nieves tiene 20 años de edad es una joven luchadora y muy laboriosa, empezó a trabajar a la edad de 16 años, en un principio apoyando a su madre en la venta de ropa de segundo uso, oficio al que actualmente se dedica y con el que le permite apoyar económicamente a su humilde familia y cubrir el gastos de sus estudios.Vende su mercadería 3 días a la semana los lunes, jueves y domingo, en forma ambulatoria, a partir de las 4.30 de la mañana hasta las 5:00 de la tarde, el resto de días se dedica a estudiar confección textil en un centro de ocupación superior de su pequeña ciudad, el sueño de esta joven emprendedora es tener su propio taller de confección de camisetas, buzos y casacas y está dispuesta ha esforzarse día a día para concretizar lo antes posible este sueño.Por ahora desea aumentar su mercadería y comprar más fardos de ropa usada, con el fin de poderlos vender y obtener mayor beneficio económico para ahorrar lo suficiente y así en un futuro no muy lejano hacer realidad sus sueños; para esto solicita un préstamo de 500 dólares y se compromete a hacer la devolución en un lapso de 6 meses“Con tu ayuda desinteresada esta joven emprendedora podrá hacer realidad sus sueños de tener su propio taller de confección de prendas de vestir”

loans.use: To buy more merchandise for a small clothing shop.

loans.name: Suryanah

texts.en: Suryanah is 28 years old and is the mother of an 8-year-old daughter. She produces and sells some fried snacks at her house. She can earn up to $3 per day. Her husband, Misja, is a driver who earns $2 per day. She has to work hard to earn more income for her family. She requests a loan of $125 to expand her business and is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To produce more various snacks

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Nguyen Thi D. is 30 years old and her husband is 44 years old. They have a son and a daughter that are both underage of schooling. While her husband repairs clocks and watches, she does business. Because of advantageous location (in the market), her business continues very well. On average, she profits 4-5 USD/day. This profit helps paying daily living cost and repaying the loan weekly. When her husband has free time, he also helps her with her business. This time, Mrs. D. wants to borrow 950 USD to buy more products to satisfy needs of people in town.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duy Hua, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Nguyễn Thị D. năm nay 30 tuổi, còn chồng chị 44. Họ có 2 con nhỏ 1 trai 1 gái đều chưa đến độ tuổi đến trường. Trong khi chồng chị sửa chữa đồng hồ thì chị bán hàng hóa. Do địa điểm bán hàng thuận lợi (trong chợ) công việc kinh doanh của chị D. diễn ra rất thuận lợi. Trung bình 1 ngày chị lãi 4-5USD. Số tiền lãi này đủ giúp chị trang trải những chi phí hàng ngày và trả tiền tuần. Chồng chị những lúc nhàn rỗi còn giúp chị rất nhiều trong công việc bán hàng. Vòng vốn này chị D. xin vay 950USD để mua được nhiều mặt hàng hơn nữa phục vụ nhu cầu đa dạng của nhân dân trong vùng.

loans.use: Buy goods for grocery store

loans.name: Le Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs Lê Thị M., 46, has been raising cows for the last 7 years. She raises cow for beef and also for breeding. This is a stable business because beef price is always on the rise, thus it provides her family a steady income. But it requires a lot of capital to buy cows. She has 2 children who are attending school, the school fees/expenses are high. In order to raise capital for her business, Mrs M. joined TYM fund branch 4  Kim Động, Hưng Yên. Her husband is a farmer,  he is very supportive of her about this. Her family income is about 200 USD a month. This time she requests a loan of 1200 USD to buy a few cows.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Lê Thị M., 46 tuổi, làm nghề chăn nuôi được 7 năm nay. Chị chuyên chăn nuôi bò sinh sản và bò thịt phục vụ cho người dân nơi chị sinh sống. Đây là một nghề mang lại lợi nhuận tương đối ổn định vì giá bò luôn có xu hướng tăng. Tuy nhiên để mua bò cần một số vốn tương đối lớn. Hai con chị đang trong độ tuổi đi học, chi phí cao nên nhu cầu vốn càng cao. Để có nguồn vốn hỗ trợ chị đã tham gia Quỹ Tình thương tại chi nhánh 4 Kim Động, Hưng Yên. Chồng chị, một người nông dân hiền lành chất phác rất ủng hộ ý định này của vợ. Thu nhập bình quân 1 tháng của gia đình là 200USD. Vòng vốn này chị M. rất muốn vay 1200USD từ Quỹ để mua thêm vài con bò và bán ra khi được giá.

loans.use: to buy cows

loans.name: Victoire

texts.fr:
Mrs. Victoire N. was born in 1981 in LADJI, a shantytown of COTONOU. She is married and the mother of three children. She is a professional hairdresser with good business ethics. In addition she sells products in line with her activity such as cosmetics, extensions and others. She is requesting a loan to improve the conditions of her performance and to answer the demand of her customers. We are reminded that this is her third loan and that she has a large experience in this area since she opened her salon 5 years ago.

Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva volunteer.

Dame N. Victoire est née vers 1981 à LADJI un bidonville de COTONOU. Elle est mariée et mère de trois enfants. De bonne moralité elle est coiffeuse de profession. En plus de celle-ci elle vend des produits qui entre en ligne de compte de son activité tels que les produits cosmétiques, les mèches et autres. Elle sollicite ce prêt pour améliorer les conditions de sa prestation et pour répondre aux sollicitations de sa clientèle. Rappelons qu’elle est à son troisième prêt et elle a une grande expérience dans le domaine puisqu'elle a ouvert son salon de beauté il y a 05 ans.

loans.use: Purchase of cosmetic products, extensions and others.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
Señora Victoria A. B. is 44 years of age and has completed her studies to the fifth degree of grade school. She has three children in all but none depend on her for support. She lives on Deam Saavedra street in the El Cortijo sector of the province of Trujillo in the La Libertad department – Peru.

With the aid of a simple machine señora Victoria makes backpacks, briefcases and suitcases; products that she distributes in the different stores of the Sierra Libertaña and the north of Peru. Many of these establishments order from her in advance by the dozens and half dozen. At the age of 21 years she learned dressmaking. With her creativity, she designed backpacks of various models.

She belongs to the “New Peru” Communal Bank where she obtained her first loan of 300 soles. With this money she bought material to make the backpacks.

With the loan of 800 soles, which will be repaid in six months, she will buy 20 meters of wet fabric, petron and four rolls of ‘vivo’ (material to make backpacks).

Her greater dream is to have a workshop with modern machinery.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Victoria A. B. tiene 44 años de edad, estudio hasta el quinto grado de primaria. Tiene en total tres hijos pero ninguno depende de ella. Vive en la calle Deam Saavedra en el sector El Cortijo en la provincia de Trujillo en el departamento La Libertad – Perú.

Con la ayuda de una sencilla maquina la señora Victoria elabora mochilas, maletines y maletas, productos que distribuye por las diferentes tiendas de la sierra liberteña y por el norte del Perú, muchos de estos establecimientos le hacen pedidos anticipadamente, vende por docenas y media docena. Desde la edad de 21 años aprendió el curso de corte y confección, con su creatividad, diseñó mochilas de varios modelos.

Ella pertenece al Banco Comunal “Nuevo Perú” lugar donde obtuvo su primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 con este dinero compro material para elaborar las mochilas.

Con el préstamo de S/. 800.00 el cual cancelara en seis meses comprar 20 metros de tela mojada, petron y cuatro rollos de vivo (material para elaborar mochilas).

Su mayor sueño es tener su taller con maquinaria moderna.

loans.use: To buy materials for making backpacks.

loans.name: Karla Magdalena

texts.es:
Mrs. V. is 36 years old, lives in Stage III of the Hialeah neighborhood, and has a beautiful 16-year-old girl. She is an English academic advisor with five years of experience. With the loan, she wants to build a room onto her house. She has been making home improvements with the loans given to her by Afodenic and part of her savings. In the future, she wants to set up a business for the stability of her family.

Translated by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva volunteer

La Sra. V. habita en el barrio Hialeah III etapa, tiene 36 años de edad y una hermosa joven de 16 años de edad, es asesora académica del área de ingles con 5 años de experiencia. Con el préstamo desea construir un cuarto ella ha venido haciendo mejoras a su casa con prestamos que Afodenic le ha otorgado y con parte de sus ahorros. En un futuro desea poner un negocio para la solidez de su familia.

loans.use: Build a room

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria belongs to the Communal Bank “Las Mercedes,” her business is selling food at the weekly market that is developing in the district and province of Carhuaz in Ancash state

With the S/.2,000.00 nuevos soles loan, which will be repaid in 4 payments, she will buy 2 buckets of oil, 2 sacks of rice, 3 sacks of potatos, and 4 packages of various noodles.

She is 44 years old, married, and has 1 son. Her husband works from time to time, and the income she generates enables them to meet their household expenses and proviD. an education for their only child.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Maria, pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Mercedes, su negocio es la venta D. comidas en la feria semanal que se desarrolla en el distrito y provincia D. Carhuaz, departamento D. Ancash.

Con este préstamo D. S/. 2,000.00 nuevos soles, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, comprará 2 baldes D. aceite, 2 saco D. arroz, 3 saco D. papa, 4 paquetes D. fideos surtido.

Ella tiene 44 años D. edad es conviviente, su esposo trabaja eventualmente, y tienen un hijo, los ingresos que genera les permite solventar los gasto D. su hogar y la educación D. su único hijo.

loans.use: Purchase ingredients to prepare food.

loans.name: Son

texts.en: Son K., 52, is married and lives in the Kampong Cham province with her four children. She works in the fields as a farmer, making around US$2 each day, while she is also supported by  two of her children who work in the local garment factories and her son who works in the market selling fruits. The income from the two daughters is US$2.60 each day, while her son typically makes US$3 each day of net income. This has been a difficult year for farmers in Cambodia, because weather patterns have not been as consistent and inflation has been high. Many families are seeking out loans to expand and diversify their sources of income. Son K. has asked for a loan of US$1000 to expand her son’s fruit inventory. She sees his business as more profitable than her own and has set it as a higher priority. However, she would like to expand her own farmland in the future, and expand her cultivation. She is an ambitious woman who is working hard to support her family and improve its standard of living.

loans.use: Purchase more fruits to sell

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
Pedro started his business when he found himself unemployed and he had to obtain an income to support his family. He started a little more than 5 years ago helping a friend with a taxi. Little by little he progressed until today he rents a taxi that he has been working for several years.

He needs a loan of $400, which will be repaid in 5 months, to pay for some repairs that his taxi needs and to maintain it.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Pedro inicio su negocio ya que se había quedado desempleado y tenia que conseguir un ingreso para sacar adelante a su familia. comenzó hace un poco mas de 5 años ayudándole a un familiar con un taxi, poco a poco fue progresando hasta la actualidad que renta un taxi que es con el que ya tiene varios años trabajando.

El necesita un préstamo por US $400 que pagara en 5 meses para comprar algunas refacciones que su taxi necesita y darle mantenimiento.

loans.use: To pay for repairs and maintenance on his taxi.

loans.name: Nunuu

texts.en:
Nunuu is married and has 6 children. Her children are between 4 and 18 years old.

Nunuu became a food seller in 2007. Each day, she works at her business selling food. She can earn a monthly profit of about $40.

Nunuu now requests a loan to buy more food items to sell.

loans.use: To buy more food items to sell.

loans.name: Rusbi

texts.es:
La señora Rusbi, socia del Banco comunal “Mujeres de la Colina II”, vive en el  Departamento y Provincia de San Martín, Distrito de Tarapoto. Se dedica a la venta de verduras y frutas de manera ambulatoria en el mercado de la ciudad. Los clientes son las personas que también venden verduras pero en menor cantidad.

Con este préstamo de S/.800, el cual será cancelado en 6 meses, comprará  verduras en sacos como papa, cebollas, arvejas, apio, poro, zapallo, lechuga para tener bien surtido su puesto y los clientes encuentren lo que buscan.

Rusbi tiene 25 años de edad, vive con su esposo y su pequeño hijo, por quien trabaja para salir adelante. Le gusta el negocio y mantenerse ocupada. Su meta es tener su propio puesto en el mercado, en vista que vende de manera ambulatoria.
texts.en:
Señora Rusbi, member of the community bank "Mujeres de la Colina II," lives in the province of San Martín, district of Tarapoto. She is dedicated to selling vegetables and fruits in a traveling manner at the markets of the city. The clients are people who also sell vegetables but in smaller quantities. With this loan of 800 Soles, which will be repaid in six months, she will buy vegetables in sacks like potatoes, onions, peas, celery, gourds, and lettuce to expand her business and so her clients can buy what they are seeking. Rusbi is 25 years old. She lives with her husband and her little son, for whom she is working. She likes the business and it keeps her busy. Her goal is to have her own stand at the market, because right now she sells her goods in a travelling manner.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: vegetables in sacks (potatoes, onions, celery, peas, gourds, lettuce, etc.

loans.name: Gnouma

texts.fr: GNOUMA T. HABITE LE QUARTIER NDAYANE DE DIOURBEL. ELLE EVOLUE DANS LE SECTEUR DE LA TEINTURE DEPUIS 10ANS. ELLE EST MARIEE.
texts.en:
Gnouma T. lives in the Ndayane neighborhood of Diourbel. She has been working at dyeing fabric for 10 years. She is married.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of materials necessary for dyeing fabric

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi: Chị Nguyễn Thị Luận năm nay 57 tuổi. Chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 2003. Trong suốt 5 năm qua chị Luận luôn sử dụng vốn vay vào công việc buôn bán phế liệu của gia đình.Hiện nay với thu nhập 3.000.000đ từ buôn bán phế liệu và lương làm thuê của chồng kinh tế gia đình chị rất ổn định và ngày càng phát triển. Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 15 triệu đồng đầu tư vốn để đi thu mua phế liệu
texts.en:
Mrs. L. Thi Nguyen, 57 years old, has been participating in the Fund since 2003. In the past 5 years, Mrs. Nguyen has always used the loan towards the family's recycling business. Currently, with an income of 3 million VND from trading recycling materials and her husband's income as labor-for-hire, the family's finances is very stable and growing day-by-day. In this round of funding she would like to borrow 15 million VND to invest in buying recycling materials.

Translated from Vietnamese by Chi Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy materials to be recycled

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther  S.  sells charcoal and is requesting a loan to expand her business.  Esther is 28 years old and is married. Her husband is a driver. She has three children. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a shop.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights, and legal services. These programs and services are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Open up a shop

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Victoria sells drinks and bottled water. She also bakes snacks to sell. She has been in this business since 2000. Victoria is a 43 years old and she is a widow with three children. She takes care of her children alone and she hopes to give them quality education.  She needs the loan amount of 140,000 NGN ($1,000 US) to purchase more crates of drinks and bottled water to sell. She says, "Thank you to all that made this loan possible."

loans.use: To purchase more crates of drinks and bottled water to sell.

loans.name: Taciana

texts.en:
Taciana L., 48, is married and lives at Bagting, Dapitan City. She has 2 children. Her husband works as a utility worker at CGSO.

Because of her eagerness to have a better life, she works hard and patiently and does manicure and pedicure services. Later on, she does other services such as hair coloring and hair cutting. She has her friends and neighbors as her regular customers and decided to open up a small beauty parlor. But she would need to have capital for these so she was looking for an institution that would be able to help her.

Taciana found Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative and became a member on September 15, 2008. Her first loan of 3,000 php was used in buying materials and equipment for her business. She wants to purchase modern equipment, facilities and materials to increase her clientele and encourage them to look for her services so she has applied for a loan amounting to 7,000 php for additional capital. With her continued membership in Paglaum, she hopes to have a fully air-conditioned beauty parlor. She is willing to attend training, for acquisition of more skills.

loans.use: purchase of materials & chemicals for the beauty parlor

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.es:
La Sra. Cecilia Solíz, vive en la urbanización Balcón II, en el departamento de Santa Cruz, Bolivia, estudia Ingeniería Petrolera en la universidad, paralelamente cuenta con un negocio de alquiler de sillas, mesas, vajilla y de equipo de sonido para eventos especiales.
Es una  señorita soltera e independiente, con mucha ganas de superación.
El destino del credito será para aumentar su capital de trabajo, y así poder seguir solventando sus estudios, que son demasiados caros.
texts.en:
Mrs. Cecilia S. lives in the housing projects of Balcon II in the state of Santa Cruz, Bolivia. She studies Petroleum Engineering at the university and she also has a rental business. She rents chairs, tables, tableware and sound equipment for special events. Cecilia is a single and independent woman with a great desire to get ahead in life. The loan money will be used to increase her work capital and in that way continue paying for her studies, which are very expensive.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy chairs for rental business

loans.name: Tina G.

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings) from Tanzania! This is 39-year-old Tina C. from Tukuyu. She is married with two children, 14 and 17. Tina has been running a local restaurant known as “mama lishe” since 2007. When you see a SELFINA entrepreneur whose business title is ‘restaurant’ or ‘café’, you may have to adjust your mental image of what that is. A local restaurant or café in Tanzania usually consists of a rough wooden table and some long, wooden benches, with the sky as a ceiling. Such places don’t even appear in the Lonely Planet’s budget guide, but if you’re looking for a cheap and tasty meal, and someone to have a chat with, this is the place to be. The food is all-local; rice, ugali (a hot sticky dough, made from maize flour), plantain (a cooked savoury banana), all served with beans, vegetables, meat, and a variety of yummy sauces.

Tina works at the business for 12 hours per day, 6 days per week, and is assisted by one employee. Tina currently earns about 100 USD a month from her business. She is requesting a loan in order to purchase more rice, beans, salt, sugar and maize flour in bulk. In the future, she plans to open a new business. Tina thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA:

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility.

Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more rice, beans, salt, sugar and maize flour in bulk

loans.name: Kambarali

texts.ru: Камбарали Ёкубов 1969 года рождения имеет 3 детей. Он закончил всего лишь 10 классов , в университет поступать денег не хватило. Он разводит дома коров. Разведением скота занимается около 15 лет. В бизнесе помогают жена и дети. Он хочет купить коров для откорма и продажи. На рынке скот держится очень дешево он хочет успеть купить , поэтому и получает кредит для покупки скота. Узнав о Микроинвесте и поддержки КИВА сразу же обратился к нам. Благодарен за поддержку и помощь другим.
texts.en:
Kambarali Y. was born in 1969 and has three children. He has completed only 10 years of school and he did not have enough money to go to a university. He keeps and raises cows. He has been in the animal husbandry business for fifteen years. His wife and children help him with the business. He wants to buy cows for feeding and resale. The cattle is cheap right now on the market so he wants to buy it on time and this is why he plans to get a loan. He found out about MicroInvest and Kiva's support and came here right away. He is very grateful for the support and help to others.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of livestock

loans.name: Sounam Group

texts.en:
Sounam is the group leader of Sounam group. There are four members in this group. All of them would like to receive money for their businesses to purchase more materials and make good incomes for their families in the future.

Frowzan and Sounam want to take a loan for their business of bead working; they want to buy necessary materials for their business. Sayeda wants to take a loan for her husband’s business of stick selling. He wants to buy sticks for his business. Nellofar wants to take a loan for her business of tailoring. She wants to buy three new machines for her business. They all want to buy necessary materials for their businesses.

With this loan they can make their businesses grow, support their families, and make a better future for themselves and their families.

loans.use: Supplies for beadwork business

loans.name: Tchatchibara

texts.fr: Ce monsieur est marié et  père de 01 enfants, il vit avec sa famille dans le quartier d’Agoè danliko. Le commerce qu’il fait et qui lui permet d’assumer les dépenses du foyer est le commerce de friperie, cette activité marche bien a Lomé, il réalise » d’importantes recettes. Son stock de friperie a diminué, il sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour pouvoir se réapprovisionner par l’achat de 03 balots de friperie.
texts.en:
This is a gentleman who is married and the father of a child. He lives with his family in the Agoè Danliko district. He does commerce in second-hand clothing, and it is doing well in Lomé. This business enables him to assume coverage of household expenses, and he earns significant revenues. Because his inventory of used clothing has shrunk, he's requesting a loan from WAGES to be able to resupply himself by buying three bales of used clothing.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy second-hand clothing

loans.name: Nafisa

texts.en:
Nafisa Y. is single. She recently completed senior high school but for lack of money she could not continue to the university as had been her dream. She lives with her parent in a rented apartment. She is 24 years old and a businesswoman. She is a very hard-working lady who wants to cater for herself.

Nafisa has been selling cloth and lace materials for a year now. Lace material is very useful in room and office decorations. She treks to Kumasi to buy her stock of goods. For lack of adequate working capital, she buys few lace materials and lengths of cloth and sells through hawking. For this reason she requests loan support to make business progress. She believes the loan will enable her to grow her business to the expected level.

With the loan, she wants to purchase bulk supplies of lace materials, cloth and textiles. She hopes to use part of her profit to enter the university in the next academic year. She also belongs to the village bank called ‘Asomdwe’ which means Peace.

loans.use: To purchase bulk supplies of lace materials and textiles

loans.name: Koryor

texts.en:
Koryor T. is sixty years old. She is widowed and has given birth to six children (two daughters and four sons). Some of her children are currently in the senior high while the others are in the junior high or the primary schools. She lives with her children in a family house in a commercial town called Dwenase in the Western Region of Ghana. Dwenase is a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso, the district capital. 

Koryor is a food vendor. She runs a chop bar (a simple eatery) in her locality. Koryor wants a loan to buy foodstuffs such as plantain, cassava, yam, maize, etc. She buys her goods from nearby communities at affordable prices. Koryor has been in business for over twelve years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk. She aspires to expand her business and sponsor her children in school.

loans.use: To buy ingredients

loans.name: Mzaituni Group

texts.en:
Joyce M., age 25, is married with two children, ages 7 and 4. Joyce has a food business, which she started in 2005. She works daily from 9am until 6.30pm and is able to earn a monthly profit of around $323.

This will be Joyce’s second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loan to open a salon and buy a sack of powdered soap (which she sells door to door), and repaid the loan successfully. She wants a new loan to improve her salon.

Joyce will share this loan with her loan group, Mzaituni, which totals 18 members. The members of the group hold each other accountable in paying back their loans. In the picture, Joyce is first from the left in the front row.

loans.use: To improve a salon

loans.name: Amanecer Group

texts.es: “Amanecer” es un grupo de señoras con mucha simpatía, todas esperan pacientemente el inicio de su reunión a la cabeza de su presidenta María F., ellas cuentan que se agruparon por la necesidad  de contar con un capital de trabajo, todas tienen sus propios negocios como ser la venta de juguetes, verduras y comida, requieren el préstamo para comprar mercadería, otras se dedican a la producción  de chamarras, tejido de aguayo (tejido colorido) y chompas, ellas necesitan  el préstamo para comprar tela y lana. Baciliza C., una de las integrantes de aproximadamente 40 años de edad, indica  que ella vende comida (pollos a la broaster) en su domicilio que está ubicado en la zona Bautista Zaabedra y ha visto la necesidad de comprar una cocina más grande que le permita fritar mayor cantidad de pollos y poder cubrir su mercado.
texts.en:
"Amanecer" (Dawn) is a group of very pleasant ladies who patiently await the start of their meeting, chaired by María Fernández. They have formed a group because they need working capital. They all have their own business, some of them are selling toys, vegetables or food and need a loan to buy merchandise, others are producing jackets, woven aguayo (a multicolored cloth) or sweaters and need a loan to buy fabric and wool.

One of the group members, Baciliza C., who is approximately 40 years old, said she serves food (broaster chicken) at her home in the area of Bautista Zaabedra and saw the need to buy a larger kitchen to fry more chicken and meet her customers' demand.

Translated from Spanish by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise and raw materials

loans.name: Faauliuli

texts.en:
Faauliuli T.'s main source of income comes from planting and harvesting taro for sale. She is a 49-year-old woman living in the town of Vaovai. She is married and has six adult children. Faauliuli has been in this business for over four years and earns approximately 400 WST a month. (0)

In 2006, Faauliuli joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Faauliuli has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1250 WST from SPBD. This previous loan was used to purchase fertilizers such as manure.

Faauliuli is now requesting a new loan of 1500 WST which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be her third loan from SPBD. Faauliuli plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand her business.

About SPBD: SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding a taro business

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa is engaged in a hog raising business. Aside from this, she also retails charcoal in their village in order to have extra income. She wanted her business to be improved and be more profitable but due to lack of capital she couldn’t afford to purchase additional piglets to raise and hog feeds that are really needed.  Elsa would like to request for a loan amounting to PHP6, 000 to have additional capital for her business. She is hoping that her business will grow by the help of the loan she is requesting to avail.

Elsa is already 48 years old. With her husband Elito, they are blessed with five children. Most of them ended graduating in high school and unfortunately they weren’t able to pursue their studies in college due to difficulties of life. Her youngest is still attending his high school education. Elsa hopes to uplift their ways of living someday by working hard in the business she’s involved with.

loans.use: additional capital

loans.name: Tito Guillermo

texts.es:
Tito tiene 39 años de edad, es casado y vive junto a su esposa y sus dos hijas en el pueblo joven Atusparias, distrito de José Leonardo Ortiz, ubicado a cinco minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Tiene cerca de 15 años trabajando en un pequeño puesto de renovación de calzado que queda cerca al mercado Moshoqueque (el principal mercado mayorista de la ciudad), todos los días se levanta desde muy temprano para atender los pedidos de sus clientes, y debido a la constante demanda por sus servicios se queda ahí hasta muy tarde.

Su negocio es la única fuente de ingreso económico de su familia por lo que todos los días tiene que esforzarse al máximo para sacar adelante a su negocio, el se encuentra solicitando a nuestra Institución un crédito de 600 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la compra de los materiales que necesita para realizar su trabajo como hilos, tintes, plantillas, zuelas, etc.

Su más grande anhelo es comprar una mototaxi (vehículo motorizado que se utiliza en el transporte de carga y pasajeros) con la cual tendría un ingreso económico diario y de esa manera darle a su familia mayor estabilidad económica así como brindar a sus hijas la oportunidad de estudiar algún tipo de educación superior.

Anteriormente Tito ha trabajado con nosotros y ha demostrado responsabilidad y puntualidad en sus pagos por lo que es considerado como un cliente excelente.
texts.en:
Tito is 39. He is married, and he lives with his wife and their two daughters in the “Pueblo Joven” (nickname for a shanty town) Atusparias in the José Leonardo Ortiz district. It is located five minutes from the city of Chiclayo. He has been working close to 15 years in a small shoe repair stand. It is near the Moshoqueque market (main wholesale market in the city). He gets up very early every day to take care of his customers’ orders. Due to the constant demand for his services, he stays there very late. His business is the only source of income for his family. Therefore, every day he puts forth maximum effort to get ahead in his business. He is asking our institution for a loan for 600 PEN, which he plans to use to buy the necessary materials like thread, dyes, insoles, and soles, etc. His biggest desire is to buy a “mototaxi” (a motorized vehicle used to transport cargo and passengers), which would give him an extra daily income. This way he could give his family a greater economic stability like giving his daughters the opportunity to have some type of post high school education. Tito has previously worked with us, and he has demonstrated responsibility and punctuality in his payments. Therefore, he is considered to be an excellent client.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy thread, dyes, insoles, and soles for shoe repair

loans.name: Llerme

texts.es:
Llerme tiene 55 años, es una mujer muy comprometida con el desarrollo de su familia, con quienes vive en su pequeña casa. Su anhelo es mejorar sus condiciones de vida. Su negocio es la venta de abarrotes, lo cual realiza en un espacio que implementó en su casa para su tienda desde hace 5 años. Aquí trabaja arduamente en compañía de su pareja, quien le tiende una mano en los momentos más tediosos. Pero a pesar del estrés de algunos días, Llerme  siempre tiene una gran sonrisa para recibir a sus clientes, quienes están muy contentos por las atenciones que les brindan. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo son las conversaciones que mantiene con sus vecinas, quienes encuentran en ella a una amiga. Sin embargo, lo más difícil es tener que lidiar con la delincuencia que se presenta por su zona, pues los ladrones siempre están al asecho. Para el futuro, Llerme espera incrementar sus ingresos y ampliar su local para ofrecer nuevos productos, además de asegurar su local para evitar sufrir robos.
Este es su primer crédito de manera individual con Microfinanzas PRISMA, donde también forma parte de un banco comunal y es reconocida como una de las socias más alegres y cumplidas con sus pagos. Los dos mil soles solicitados serán invertidos en la compra de productos nuevos para surtir su tienda.
texts.en:
Llerme is 55 years old. She is a woman who is very committed to the development of her family with whom she lives in her small house. Her desire is to improve their living conditions. Her business is selling groceries, which she performs in a space that she created in her house for her store five years ago. Here, she works hard alongside her spouse who lends her a hand in the most tedious moments. However, despite the stress of some days, Llerme always has a big smile when she receives her customers who are very happy for the attention she provides. What she likes the most about her work are the conversations that she has with her neighbors, who see her as a friend. Nevertheless, what is most difficult is to have to deal with the crime in her area since the theives are always waiting in ambush. For the future, Llerme hopes to increase her income and expand her shop in order to offer new products, in addition to make her store more secure to avoid robberies. This is her first individual loan with Microfinanzas PRISMA where she also formed part of a community bank and is recognized as one of the members who is happiest and most punctual with payments. The two thousand requested soles will be invested in the purchase of new products with which to stock her store.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase in merchandise.

loans.name: Son

texts.en: Son K., 49, is married and lives with her husband in the Takeo province. She is a professional decorates handicrafts. Since 1997, she has been using beads and other materials to make flower on woman clothes to earn a living and typically making US$1.50 each day. Decorates dress is a kind of Khmer traditional dress and people wears it during Water Festival, P’chum Ben or Khmer New Year. It takes around 7-10 days to complete each dress and its price is expensive too. Most of the people prefer hand made than machine made. She said she knows how to decorate from her mother and she has started doing that business since she was not married yet. Son Ken is asking for a loan of US$700 to purchase more silk and beads to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more silk and beads.

loans.name: Allan

texts.en:
Allan C. is from the village of Barra, Tudela, Misamis Occidental. He is 32 years old and married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Allan owns and operates a business harvesting and selling farm-raised fish in the local community. Allan has been engaged in his business for over six years and earns approximately $173 a month from these activities.

In 2009, Allan joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. Allan is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be his first loan from PMPC. He plans to use any additional revenue generated to improve his business. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding his business

loans.name: Glennys Yamira

texts.es: El negocio de la señora Glenny  H. es la venta de cd, películas, músicas y venta de video juegos que desde hace dos años vende el cual inicio con  ayuda de su esposo tenían un buen dinero invertido pero por el destino su esposo murió en un accidente el cual la familia de el le quito todo las compras. Tuve que regresar a casa de mi madre en donde me han dado el amor y el apoyo para continuar con poco dinero compre películas y ya voy invirtiendo mas en el negocio y con el préstamo que en Afodenic estoy haciendo comprare películas variadas para adulto y niños, en música, y video  juego. Lo cual espera alcanzar buenas ganancias para recuperarse en las ventas y obtener su clientela. Tiene 32 años y dos  hijo de 2 y 11 años de edad, el cual estudia la primaria. Lo que mas desea es poder tener su propia casa para no depender de su familia y poder dejar a sus hijos una casa. Muy contenta por la oportunidad que la institución esta dando ya que gracia esta inversión logrará sus nuevas metas.
texts.en:
Glenny H., 32, has sold CDs, DVDs, music and video games for the past two years. She and her husband started their business together with a good-sized investment. However, destiny intervened and her husband was killed in an accident. His family took all the sales from her. She had to return to her mother's house where she received all the love and support to continue. With a little money she bought a few films and is now investing a bit more in the business. With the Afodenic loan she is buying a variety of films for adults and children, music, and video games. She hopes to make good profits to recover her sales and establish a client base. She has two children, a 2-year-old and an 11-year-old, who is in elementary school. Her greatest wish is to have her own home so as not to depend on her family and have a home to leave to her children. She is very happy for the opportunity the institution has given her thanks to which she will reach her new goals.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a variety of DVDs and CDs to attract customers and improve sales.

loans.name: Ochirbat

texts.en:
Ochirbat O. is 25 years old and lives with her parents in a house in the Bayanzurkh district of Ulaanbaatar, the largest city and capital of Mongolia. She operates a clothing trading business, primarily selling undergarments, in the city. She started her business in 2009 and has quickly built a stable operation. She works very hard and is gaining valuable business experience everyday. O. hopes continued growth will allow her to expand her operation in the future.

She is a very passionate person who is very eager to succeed in life. She says, "I hope to have my own shop in the future." She is requesting a 2,000,000 tugrug (~1400 USD) loan to purchase more undergarments to sell at her clothing store.

About XacBank XacBank was founded in 2001, and listed its first loan on Kiva in January 2009. It is the largest microfinance organization in Mongolia, but also has mainstream commercial operations. XacBank has the vision, scale and innovation to develop and implement new solutions to poverty. It is currently utilizing Kiva’s 0% lending interest rate to return 9% of interest paid from borrowers to them in the form of a savings account at the end of their loans. This not only allows borrowers to gain financially, but also encourages them to save.

To get regular updates from XacBank, please join our lending team: http://www.kiva.org/team/xacbank_mongolia To lend to more Mongolian borrowers, please click here:http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&queryString=Mongolia&status=fundRaising&gender=All§ors[]=All®ions[]=All&sortBy=Expiring+Soon

loans.use: To purchase more undergarments to sell at her clothing store

loans.name: Zorigt

texts.en:
Zorigt G. lives with his mother in Tuv province, one of Mongolia's central provinces. His mother is already retired but helps in his business. Zorigt has been trying different businesses to be successful. He started a business making food with seaweed in 2006; however, it did not go well and he decided to switch to production of baked goods. Today Zorigt makes eight types of baked goods and sells them at various supermarkets in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He says that he has finally got the kind of business he was looking for, and aims to expand his business. He plans to hire two bakery specialists and produce more baked goods in order to meet supermarkets' orders. He requests a loan to purchase necessary bakery equipment and ingredients for his business.

About XacBank
XacBank was founded in 2001, and listed its first loan on Kiva in January 2009. It is the largest microfinance organization in Mongolia, but also has mainstream commercial operations. XacBank has the vision, scale and innovation to develop and implement new solutions to poverty. It is currently utilizing Kiva’s 0% lending interest rate to return 9% of interest paid from borrowers to them in the form of a savings account at the end of their loans. This not only allows borrowers to gain financially, but also encourages them to save.

To get regular updates from XacBank, please join our lending team: http://www.kiva.org/team/xacbank_mongolia

To lend to more Mongolian borrowers, please click here:http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&queryString=Mongolia&status=fundRaising&gender=All&sectors[]=All&regions[]=All&sortBy=Expiring+Soon

loans.use: To purchase bakery equipment and bakery ingredients

loans.name: Chenda

texts.en:
Mr. Haem Him is 45 years old and lives in Prey Mien village in Takeo province. He is the father of three children who are employed in a garment factory. He is farmer who owns 1-hectare (2.5-acre) piece of land on which he cultivates rice. His wife, Mrs. Heng Vath, is a pig breeder. His wife is shown in the picture with him.

Although this couple tries to work hard, they still earn less income than needed to support their family living. Thus, Mr. Haem Him decided to ask for a loan to start a new business using rice to make wine to sell. He would use the rest of money to buy five more piglets to raise and pig feed.

loans.use: To start a rice wine business and to buy five piglets and pig feed

loans.name: Eduviges

texts.en: Eduviges E. is from the village of Mahinog, Camiguin Province. She is 53 years old, is married, and has four school-aged children. Eduviges owns and operates a business making and selling food, selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. She is just starting this business. In 2009, Eduviges joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 4,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy vegetables and spices to sell to her customers

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
Lilibeth G. is from the village of Tangaro, Catarman Camiguin Province. She is 46 years old. Lilibeth is married and has 3 school-aged children. Lilibeth is starting a business venture in the manufacturing sector making bamboo walling and selling it in the local community. Lilibeth is just starting this business.

In 2010, Lilibeth joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to have the ability to engage in business activities. Lilibeth is requesting a loan of 4000 PHP, which will be used to purchase materials for her bamboo wall business. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Lilibeth from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials for her bamboo walling business.

loans.name: Luvsanpurev

texts.en:
Luvsanpurev is 22 years old and lives with his mother, brother, and another sibling in Arhangai province, Mongolia.  They live together in a 'ger', the Mongolian nomadic tent.  Her mother is a herder and has a few head of livestock. Luvsanpurev's brother works in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia, and his sibling is a university student. They have been living in their current home for 22 years.   

Since Luvsanpurev was a child, he helped his father manufacture wooden products. Unfortunately, his father passed away in 2006, and from that time he has worked independently, manufacturing wooden products on his own. Luvsanpurev's family helps him if any help is needed,  and generally the whole family is very supportive of his business. 

He began with a working capital of 50,000 tugrugs (~ 35 USD), but with his hard work his working capital has increased to 300,000 tugrugs (~ 211 USD).  Luvsanpurev has been planning to grow his business in the future. He is a very hard-working person and has great communication skills. He says, “I would like to make my mother happier by working hard and continuing to pay for my sibling's university tuition fee.” He is requesting a 500,000 tugrug (~351 USD) loan to purchase planks for his business.

loans.use: To purchase planks for his business.

loans.name: Basajja Mivule Group, Mukono

texts.en:
At the top left in the small photo is S. Henry who also appears in the group photo.

On the face of it, Henry is an ambitious man. He is a 35-year-old married man with two children aged 8 and 6 years who both go to school. He sells charcoal as a business and his operating area is in Kazinga in Mukono district.

Henry has been operating this business for the last two years and reckons that since he began he probably makes a paltry 35,000 shillings per week. Henry is also an employee of Azam factories that make baking flour, hence earning a monthly salary.

Despite this, Henry has big plans to expand into a more lucrative business. For that reason, he says he needs a loan to be able to push through his plans by buying more sacks of charcoal to sell. In this business, he is mostly helped by his wife.

loans.use: To buy more sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Bobby

texts.en:
Bobby S. is from the village of Brgy. 4, Talakag Bukidnon. He is 35 years old. Bobby is separated from his spouse and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Bobby owns & operates a service-based business. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing hairdressing & beauty services to local community members. Bobby has been engaged in his business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Bobby joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Bobby is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to expand services provided. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Bobby from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase materials needed to expand services provided

loans.name: Esperanza Leonor

texts.es:
Esperanza P. de 35 años, vive en una zona periurbana en el Guasmo (fue nombrado así debido a la especie de árboles Guazuma ulmifolia. El Guasmo es un barrio popular, de clase humilde, que anteriormente era una hacienda) de Guayaquil. Su esposo es maestro albañil ellos tienen 2 hijos de 18 y 15  años de edad. 

Esperanza hace 5 años atrás invirtió sus ahorros en ropa para venderlas caminando de casa en casa en las zonas que ellas mas conocía. Esa manera de vender tuvo muy buena acogida ya que a las personas les gusto la facilidad de comprar ropa sin ir a un centro comercial. 

Por esa muy buena idea ella obtuvo suficientes ingresos para comprar una carpa y poner un puesto de ropa en las afueras del mercado del Guasmo. Ella ahora trabaja desde las 07:00 hasta las 12:30 todos los días. Vende pantalones, blusas, ropa interior etc.

Con el préstamo quiere comprar pantalones, blusas, ropa interior para su puesto de venta de ropa. En el futuro quiere tener otro puesto de ropa y así asegurar el futuro de su familia.
texts.en:
Esperanza P., 35, lives in a periurban area of El Guasmo, Guayaquil (so-called due to a species of tree, Guazuma ulmifolia. El Guasmo is a popular, low-income neighborhood that used to be a hacienda). Her husband is a master bricklayer and they have two children: 18 and 15 years of age. Five years ago Esperanza invested her savings in clothing to sell door-to-door in neighborhoods that she was most familiar with. This method of selling was well-received because people enjoyed the ease of buying without having to go to shopping centers. This very good idea of hers made it possible for her to buy a tent and set up a clothing sales stall outside the El Guasmo market. Now she works from 7 until 12:30 every day; she sells pants, blouses, underwear, etc. She will use the funds to buy pants, blouses and underwear to stock her stall. In the future she would like to have another sales stall to insure her family’s future.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For pants and blouses.

loans.name: Chan's Group

texts.en:
The four people who make up this group loan live in Pump Edth village in Takeo province. They will use the loan for different purposes. 

Mrs. Chan P. is the group leader who has been selected by all the members. She is a vegetable and fruit seller in her local village and her husband, Mr. Ry Lay, is a farmer who owns a two-hectare plot of land to grow rice and vegetables to sell to support his family. Although they try to work hard, they can not earn enough income. So to improve their family's living conditions, they want to start a new business but they do not have enough money. 

Thus, Mrs. Chan P. is applying for a loan to buy chickens, piglets, and pig and chicken feed for the animals. She supports two children, one of whom is enrolled in local public school, while the younger one is only four years old.

loans.use: To buy chickens, piglets, and pig and chicken feed

loans.name: Zarina

texts.en:
Zarina is the mother of two children. Her husband is a simple worker and does not earn that much. To help her husband, Zarina started cooking confectionery and selling it at the market. But her cakes were so tasty that customers started to come to her house to order them. Now, since Zarina has many loyal customers, she wants to buy some good cooking equipment to produce more cakes. In this way, she hopes to improve her standard of living.

More about Tajikistan
Tajikistan, a key post on the Silk Road, is perhaps best known for its rich history. It was the location for the end of Alexander the Great's rule, and is known for its great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country, with its epic mountain passes, is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language and a civilization that dates back to the fourth millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mix of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

However, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the USSR, damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93 per cent of the country is mountainous and only 7 per cent of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands of people to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

More about IMON International
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase cooking equipment

loans.name: Pichet

texts.en:
Mr. Pichet S., is 27 years old and his wife, Mrs. Chamroeun Oeun, is 25 years old. They have been married since 2003 and have two children: one son and one daughter, both of them still young. The family lives on an Island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. Pichet was not available for the photo so his wife is shown instead.

Pichet has been a wooden-house constructor for four years, working in his village and in the nearby districts. His wife is a silk weaver. He does not have enough construction materials to work, so he is applying for his first loan of $700 to purchase construction materials for his business. He will also use part of the loan to buy silk materials for his wife’s weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials for his business and silk materials for his wife’s weaving business

loans.name: Rolando Jose

texts.es:
Rolando de 43 años de edad, tiene 3 hijos, los 2 menores estudian la primaria, labora como operario especializado desde hace 10 años para el INTA de Nueva Guinea. Su esposa se encarga del cuido de la casa y de la familia. 

Don Rolando esta solicitando su 7mo crèdito para cambiarle el zinc a su pequeña casa, se ha caracterizado por ser un cliente bien responsable con sus compromisos, honesto y muy querido por sus jefe.   

Su mayor sueño es que su tres hijos estudien y trabajen para que sean peronas de bien ya que el no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar por falta de recursos economicos.
texts.en:
Rolando is 43 years old and has three children. The two youngest are elementary school students. He has worked as a specialized operator for ten years for INTA (Nicaraguan Institute for Agricultural Technology). His wife is in charge of looking after the home and the family.

Don Rolando is requesting his seventh loan to replace the zinc sheeting of his small house. He is known for being a responsible client with all of his commitments. Rolando is honest and appreciated by his boss.

His greatest wish is to see his three children study and work to become good people since he did not have the opportunity to receive an education due to a lack of financial resources.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sheets of zinc

loans.name: Elena

texts.es:
Elena es socia del Bancomunal Amaquella, tiene 24 años, es conviviente y tiene un hijo de tres años que esta en inicial, se dedica a la venta pantalones Jeans, esta venta lo realiza en las ferias que se organizan en diferentes localidades, también reparte a diferentes negociantes. La compra de los pantalones lo realiza en la ciudad de Lima semanalmente, este viaje le permite traer novedades.
