El sueño de Elena es poder abrir una tienda para poder ofrecer su mercadería, que su hijo sea profesional y tener una casa propia.
texts.en:
Elena is a member of the Amaquella Communal Bank. She is 24 years old, in a common law marriage, and has a three year old son in nursery school. Elena sells jeans at the fairs that are organized in different locations. She also distributes her products to various merchants. Elena acquires her merchandise in the city of Lima on a weekly basis. With each trip she is able to bring back new styles.

Elena dreams of opening a store where she can sell her merchandise, seeing her son become a professional, and having a home of her own.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Acquire jeans to sell

loans.name: Clémentine  Flavie

texts.fr:
femme de 38 ans, marié et mère d'un enfant agée de 18 ans scolariser et ayant 5 personnes en charge.ayant quitter ses études en terminale elle se lance dans la restauration en 2000, sa recette est de 10000frs minimun par jour.
avec se prêt elle aimerai renforcer son activité en achetant de la boissons gaseuze et des vivres frais et du de restauration comme des assietes, poisson salé, poisson fumé,légume, feuille de manioc, manioc,haricot,riz,huile et bien d'autres condiments.
comme strategie elle s'efforce à améliorer la qualité de sa cuisine pour mieux attirer les clients et aussi épargner chaque jour apres la vente.
elle veut ouvrir  dans  futur en ayant un grand restaurant  plus moderne, avoir une maison et surtout soutenir sa fille à faire ses études de médecine, son restaurant  est tres populaire ,   car elle reçoit beaucoup des gens chez elle et est très acceuillante.
texts.en:
This is a 38-year-old woman who is married and the mother of an 18-year-old child in school. She has five people to support. Having dropped out of school in her last year of high school, she got started in the restaurant business in 2000. Her income amounts to 10,000 francs minimum per day. With this loan, she would like to bolster her business by buying carbonated soft drinks, fresh provisions, and restaurant goods, such as plates, salted fish, smoked fish, vegetables, cassava leaves, cassava, beans, rice, oil, and many other condiments. As a strategy, she strives to improve the quality of her cooking in order to attract more customers and also to save money each day after the sales are made. In the future, she wants to open a big restaurant that is more modern, to have a house, and especially to support her daughter in studying medicine. Her restaurant is very popular, since many people go there, and she is very welcoming.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying beverages and restaurant supplies

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph G. is from the town of Banga. He is 31 years-old and unmarried. To make a living, Joseph owns and operates a business raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Joseph has been engaged in his business for over five years. He says he works hard to save for his future family as he plans to have his own family someday.

Joseph joined Kiva partner CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Joseph is requesting a first loan in the amount of 6,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve his business. 

About CEVI:

Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly in recent years.  Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines.  In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring.  CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but also savings, insurance and training which is provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, seedlings and young crops.

loans.name: Darwin

texts.es: El Sr. Darwin tiene  23 años de edad,  tiene   un hijo, es separado   alquila un cuarto  por el Barrio San Silvestre,  El Sr. Darwin es hijo del propietario del micro el  trabaja como  chofer de su Papa  hace 5 años de la línea 41, su Papa le dio este trabajo un poco para consolarlo de su separación ya que el se quería ir fuera del País. El crédito que se le otorgo es para el mantenimiento del micro (engrase, cambio de aceite  y/otros...). El señor mostro su satisfacción  por la oportunidad  que le dio la institución al otorgarle un segundo crédito.
texts.en:
Darwin, 23, is separated and has a son. He lives in a rented room in San Silvestre neighborhood. He has worked driving a microbus, that is owned by his father, for the last five years along Route 41. His father gave Darwin this job to cheer him up after his separation because he wanted to leave the country. The loan he was granted is for maintenance for the microbus (lube, oil change and others). He expressed his satisfaction with the Institution for the opportunity it gave him by granting his second loan.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For microbus maintenance.

loans.name: Marietta

texts.en:
Marietta C. (pictured at her vegetable vending business) is a married woman who has seven children between the ages of 12 to 32 years old. Her husband, Romeo, is 60 years old and a farmer. The family lives in Purok Paraiso within Barangay Taloc, Bago City, in the province of Negros Occidental on the Western Visayas islands. Marietta has three businesses: selling vegetables, running a general store and farming. Romeo also helps in his wife's business activities.

Marietta joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2008 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past five loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Marietta has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 16,000 PHP helped her earn a monthly profit of 15,000 PHP, so lifting the family's standard of living.

This time, for her sixth loan cycle, she is borrowing 25,000 PHP, which she intends to use to buy fertilizer for her farm and buy some pigs to raise so that she can continue to save up to educate her children and lift their living conditions. Marietta C. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

About NWTF:

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pigs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchasing wood

loans.name: John Ngaruiya

texts.en:
John has operated a transport business in Naivasha town for the last three years.  He is 33 years old, married to Ann Njeri and they have two children.

He was introduced to KADET LTD by his friend and this will be his third loan.  He has paid his previous loans well and in good time.  He plans to buy a new motorbike with the loan.

In the future, John hopes to own a lorry, which he will use for transporting goods.

loans.use: To buy a new motorcycle.

loans.name: Jose Alberto

texts.es: El Sr. M. trabaja en una fabrica industrial al igual que su esposa cada quien en diferente turno para poder atender entre los dos una  tienda de abarrotes que tienen en su casa y tener suficiente entrada economica en el hogar para mejorar el nivel de vida de su familia. El negocio va funsionando bien y quieren seguir apliandolo, es por eso que requieren de este prestamo.
texts.en: Mr M. and his wife work in a factory.  Each of them works a different shift so that they can both spend time serving in the grocery store which they have in their home and also so that they have sufficient money coming into the home to improve their family's standard of living.  The business is doing well and they would like to continue expanding it.  This is the reason they are requesting the loan.

loans.use: Investment in his business

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en: Theresa K. is divorced and has five dependants. She sells foodstuffs such as cassava, plantain, and others in Elmina. She also sells kenkey (fermented corn dough wrapped in corn or banana leaves) and fish, which she has been doing for 15 years. Demand for her foodstuffs is increasing. She is asking for a loan to expand her business by purchasing other kinds of foodstuffs requested by her customers. Theresa uses her income to see to the well-being of her family. Theresa plans to reinvest her additional income.

loans.use: To purchase other kinds of foodstuffs

loans.name: Margenis Del Carmen

texts.es:
Margenis del Carmen es una mujer de Pueblo Nuevo, un municipio ubicado en el departamento de Córdoba, donde pasó la mayor parte de su vida para luego llegar a Barranquilla,  donde se casó y nacieron  sus dos hijos, que ahora están en las   edades de 8 y 12 años.
 Margenis se dedica  a la fabricación de prendas de vestir, que inició una vez quedó sin su empleo en la zona Franca de Barranquilla, donde inició como auxiliar de servicios generales y logró ser jefe de calidad  y diseño,  mientras  se  capacitaba  en todo lo relacionado con las operaciones de la confección y se perfeccionaba mediante el trabajo formal.  Con su experiencia de 12 años fue como nació su gran empresa,  que hoy  cuenta con dos operarias y sus líneas principales son la  femenina  y masculina; Margenis  tiene una clientela fija ubicada en su natal Pueblo Viejo  y también en Barranquilla en estas dos partes, vende sus diseños mediante crédito, de acuerdo a sus posibilidades y a las de sus clientes; tiene además un contrato con una importante empresa a quien le confecciona y recupera su inversión a los 45 días.   Cuando Margenis comenzó su negocio compró su maquinaria a crédito y gradualmente fue respondiendo a su obligación, hasta cumplir con ella en su totalidad. Aunque su negocio inició en firme hace 4 años, hace dos lo legalizó, para acceder a  mercados mas formales. Con su Credikiva, primer financiamiento de Margenis con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo,  comprará materias primas e insumos como telas, hilos, pellón, correderas, para poder cumplir con los pedidos  ella a través de su proceso que consiste en : Diseñar, cortar, preparara, ensamblar, filetear y controlar la calidad, elaborará vestidos femeninos, para venderlos, con ello  planea  obtener una utilidad aproximada del 25%, para continuar  creciendo y reinvirtiendo en esta época decembrina, que es de mucho repunte en las ventas para cualquier tipo de negocio. 
Su gran sueño es convertir su negocio en un taller de alta costura reconocido,   con muchos empleados y con un local propio. Sus principales desafíos son la falta de capital cuando hay muchos pedidos pero siempre se las ingenia para recuperar su cartera y poder cumplir con lo que recupera, y es que del capital que reúna y apalanque depende el cumplimiento de su sueño.
texts.en:
Margenis del Carmen is a woman from Pueblo Nuevo, a town in Córdoba department, which is where she spent most of her life.  She then moved to Barranquilla where she married and had two children who are now 8 and 12 years old.

Margenis makes clothes.  She started her business when she lost her job in the free-trade zone in Barranquilla.  She started work as a general services assistant and rose to become head of quality and design, while she trained in everything related to clothes making and perfected her skills through her formal job.

With 12 years of experience, she started her business which today employs two workers.  Her main lines are women's and men's clothing.  Margenis has regular customers in her home town of Pueblo Nuevo and also in Barranquilla.  She sells her designs in these two places.  She sells on credit according to her own situation and that of her customers.  She also has a contract with an important company for which she makes clothing and recovers her investment in 45 days.

When Margenis started her business she bought her machinery on credit and paid back bit by bit until it was completely paid for.  Although she started her business 4 years ago, she made it fully legal 2 years ago so that she could access more formal markets.

This Kiva loan is Margenis' first one with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  She will use it to buy raw materials and supplies such as fabric, threads, sheepskin and zippers so that she can fill the orders which she has.  Her production process is: designing, cutting, preparing, assembling, filleting and quality control.  She will make women's outfits to sell and hopes to make profits of approximately 25% on that activity so that she can continue to grow and reinvest in this December period which sees sales increase for all businesses.

Margenis' greatest dream is to turn her business into a well-known, haute couture workshop with many employees and her own premises.  Her main challenge is the lack of capital when there are many orders to fill.  However, she always devises some way of recovering her wallet and being able to manage with what she recovers.  Fulfilling her dream depends on the money that she manages to get hold of and leverage.

loans.use: To buy fabric, threads, sheepskin and zippers so that she can fill her orders

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy clothes

loans.name: Demesia

texts.es:
Demesia es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Huancheñas”  del distrito Huancané,  provincia D. Huancané y departamento D. Puno, tiene 45 años, estado civil casada tiene 06 hijos (03 dependientes), tiene estudios D. educación primaria incompleto.

La señora trabaja  con el Movimiento  Manuela  Ramos desD. hace 01 año, su primer préstamo  solicitado fue D. S/. 500.00 dinero que invirtió en su negocio D. venta D. comidas.

Solicitará un nuevo crédito por la suma D. S/. 1500.00 nuevos soles, dinero que invertirá en seis sacos D. arroz, cinco bolsas D. fideos, aceites, papa, etc., 
Ella recibe la ayuda D. sus hijos y su esposo trabaja es transportista.

Su sueño es tener más capital para construir su casa y poner una pensión (servicio D. alquiler D. habitaciones y alimentos).

Lo que le gusta D. su Banco Comunal es la alegría D. las socias y lo que gana sus ahorros.
texts.en:
Demesia, 45, is a member of the “Las Huancheñas” communal bank located in Huancané district, Huancané province, Puno department.  She’s married and has six children, three of whom still depend on her.  She did not finish elementary school.

She has collaborated with the Manuela Ramos Movement for the last year.  Her first requested loan was for 500 soles that she used in her meal sale business.

She will ask for a new, 1500 new sol, loan to buy six sacks of rice, five bags of noodles, cooking oils, potatoes, etc.

She gets help from her children and her husband works in transportation.

Her dream is to have more capital to build her house and set up an pensión (room rental and meals service).

What she likes about her communal bank is the cheerfulness of the members and what her savings earn.

loans.use: To buy six sacks of rice, five bags of noodles, cooking oils, potatoes, etc.

loans.name: Mirzohokim

texts.en:
S. Mirzohokim is 35 years old. He is married and has three children. Her wife is a housekeeper and the business of Mirzohokim is the main source of income of his large family. Mirzohokim is providing the services of transportation for the last 3 years. Each day on his lorry he is transporting different products of his clients. Mirzohokim is dreaming all of his children to be well-educated so that he is why he is working hard. As a result the business generates the significant income allowing him supporting his large family. In order to provide the better service for his clients and with that way to earn more, Mirzohokim needs to purchase the spare parts for his lorry to fix it. He believes that this will make his business more profitable. With this purpose he requests $1500 USD.  Being loaned for the second time Mirzohokim is sure that he will repay the loan in time with no violation.     


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing of spare parts in order to fix his lorry (truck) and continue his transportation service .

loans.name: Josie

texts.en:
Josie Y. is from the town of San Vicente Bajo. She is 28 years old. Josie is married and has one infant-aged child. To make a living, she owns and operates a "sari-sari" store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately $125 a month for this activity.

In 2008, Josie joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC.

Josie is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her 3rd loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Luk

texts.en:
Mrs. Luk T. was born in 1963, and she is a villager who lives in Khsom village in Kandal province. She and her husband, Mr. Kong Thet, are farmers who own a plot of land which they use to grow rice to sell to support their family. 

In order to do this farming, Mrs. Luk T. would like to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers, pesticide and gasoline for growing rice. Aside from being a farmer, her husband is also a construction worker where he can receive a small salary to support his family. 

This couple has six children: two are seamstresses in a garment factory and the others are attending the local school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, pesticide and gasoline for growing rice

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es:
Alicia tiene 28 años de edad, es soltera y reside junto a su familia  en el sector Santa María, una zona urbano marginal de la ciudad de Chiclayo, una ciudad bastante conocida a nivel nacional por su potencial turístico y comercial.

Ella cuenta con un pequeño negocio de venta de ropa para niños y adultos. El negocio tiene una antigüedad de un año. Las prendas que vende son para todo público y actualmente cuenta con una clientela fidelizada. Los ingresos que le brinda esta actividad le sirven para solventar sus gastos personales y de su familia.

Alicia desea surtir en inventario de su negocio debido al cambio de temporada. Por ese motivo ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de  1000 nuevos soles con los cuales comprará diversas prendas como jeans, blusas, conjuntos para niños, entre otros, atendiendo a las solicitudes de sus clientes ya que existe una alta demanda por productos debido a que es conocida por dicha actividad en la zona.
texts.en:
Alicia, 28, is single living with her family in the Santa María sector, a marginal urban zone of the city of Chiclayo, a city that is quite well known nationally for its touristic and commercial potential.

She has had a small business for a year selling children’s and adult’s clothes .  The items she sells are for all the public and she currently has an established customer base.  Income from this activity makes it possible for her to meet her personal and family expenses.

Alicia wants to stock the business according to the change in season.  Because of this she thought it convenient to ask Edpyme Alternativa for a 1000 new sol loan to buy assorted articles of clothing like: jeans, blouses, and children’s outfits, among others thereby meeting her customer requests since there is high demand because she’s so well known for this activity in the area.

loans.use: To buy more merchandise for her business.

loans.name: Sreynak's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Sreynak is a group leader who has been selected by four members who make up this group loan. All the members will use their portions of the loan for different purposes that can improve their families' standard of living. 

Mrs. Sreynak was born in 1977. She is a widow with four children, two of whom are employed in garment factories while the others are studying in local public school. 

She is a pig breeder who is able to earn some profit to support her family. Recently, she has had a problem because she does not have money to buy pig food. So to improve this business, Mrs. Sreynak is asking for a loan to buy pig food for breeding her pigs.

loans.use: to buy pig food

loans.name: Aniceta

texts.en:
Aniceta works hard to support her family. Aniceta is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Aniceta requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase fishing gear.

Aniceta has been in this business for 20 years now and earns additional income from fishing.

In the future, Aniceta would like to improve her living and renovate their house.

loans.use: to purchase fishing gear

loans.name: Vital

texts.en:
Vital is 27 years old and is married with a three-year-old child. He makes a living as a photographer. Vital’s business is well-organized and he has two years of experience. His studio is open from seven in the morning to ten at night every day. 

Vital has requested a Kiva loan through Vision Finance Company to buy new materials for his photography studio such as a new camera and computer. Vital plans to reinvest the profits from his loan into his business.

loans.use: to buy materials for his photography studio

loans.name: Sofia

texts.en:
Sofia is a married woman with two children – both of whom graduated from school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. 

For the past five years, Sofia has operated a beauty salon. Her potential customers are neighbouring community members. In addition, she also operates a cosmetics shop which contributes another source of income. Sofia dreams of incorporating her beauty salon business and establishing a hairdressing college. 

With the 20,000 Kenyan shilling loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase hair food oil, chemicals and a blow dryer. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase hair food oil, chemicals and a blow dryer.

loans.name: Las Minas (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Las Minas esta formado por 11 mujeres luchadoras, emprendedoras que siempre ven la vida con optimismo, laboran en diferentes actividades que les permiten aportar a  la economía de sus hogares y sacar  adelante a sus hijos. Viven por la comunidad de Las Minas que pertenece a la parroquia del Valle, esta parroquia tiene hermosos paisajes, su gente se dedica al comercio, cría de animales o a la agricultura, muchos salen diariamente a la ciudad a ejercer varios trabajos, el Valle tiene personas muy amables y cordiales que mantienen su cultura y tradiciones.

La Señora. María Felicia S. vive en la comunidad de Las Minas, tiene 40 años de edad, es casada y tiene 7 hijos, dos son  casados e independientes, uno de 20 años que trabaja y le ayuda economícamente, su hijo de  13 años le ayuda en la casa, sus dos siguientes hijos estudian en una escuelita de la localidad y su ultimo hijo que tiene de 2 años de edad. Su esposo labora como albañil, con el trabajo conyugal han logrado construir su casa propia.
 
Doña María se dedica a la cría de  pollos y cuyes los mismos que los vende en su comunidad, también se dedica a tejer sombreros de paja toquilla ya que aprendió esta actividad por habilidad, sus productos los vende a su selecta clientela.
 
Se encuentra en el tercer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal al cual fue invitada por una amiga, el dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de cuyes y en su alimento.

Su meta es criar más animales como chanchos.
texts.en:
The Las Minas communal bank is made up of 11 tenacious and enterprising women who always view life with optimism. They work in different businesses that permit them to contribute to the upkeep of their households and the progress of their children.

They live in the community of Las Minas which is a part of the parish of El Valle. This parish has beautiful scenery. Its people are involved in raising animals or farming. Many go to the city every day to carry out various jobs. The people of El Valle are very friendly and cordial and maintain their traditional culture.

Señora María Felicia S. lives in Las Minas. She is 40 years old, married, and has 7 children. Two are married and independent. A 20 year old works and helps support the family. Her 13 year old son helps around the house. Her two next youngest children study in the local school, and her youngest is two years old. Her husband is a construction worker. Together they have succeeded in building their own house.

Doña María raises chickens and guinea pigs which she sells in her community. She also weaves straw shawls. She became proficient in this activity and sells her products to a select group of customers.

This is the third loan that she is seeking through the communal bank, which a friend invited her to join. She is going to invest the loan in purchasing guinea pigs and animal feed. Her goal is to raise more animals such as pigs.

loans.use: to purchase animals and animal feed.

loans.name: Mario

texts.es:
El señor Mario tiene 42 años de edad, convive con la señora Adela con la cual tiene 2 hijos menores.
Se dedica en el ramo de Olería, cuya actividad aprendió de cuna, pues, su papá también era olero, y ahora él trata de ir mejorando sus técnicas dentro del rubro.
El solicita el préstamo para comprar mayor cantidad de arcilla y arena, y así aumentar su producción y por ende su ingreso.
Mario es muy  activo, tiene visión de crecimiento y cumple cabalmente con sus compromisos, su máximo sueño es mejorar su calidad de vida para poder brindarle oportunidades de educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Mario is 42 years old.  He lives with Adela and they have two dependent children.

Mario is in the brick making business.  This is a trade that he learned as a young child since his dad was also a brick maker.  Mario is now trying to improve his techniques in the field.

Mario is requesting a loan to buy a larger quantity of clay and sand so that he can increase his production and, consequently, his income.

Mario is very active.  He plans to grow in his business and make his loan repayments punctually.  His biggest dream is to improve his quality of life so that he can provide his children with educational opportunities.

loans.use: to buy clay and sand

loans.name: Ludmila

texts.en:
Ludmila, who is married with one child, sells men's clothing at the central market in Melitopol city. Ludmila has been in this business for 14 years, and during that time has developed her business well. She currently has three business locations and many repeat clients, and her goal is to open a small store to sell clothing. 

Ludmila would like to borrow 20,000 UAH to purchase seasonal inventory, hoping to thereby increase sales and move closer to achieving her business goal.

loans.use: to purchase seasonal inventory: T-shirts, shorts, etc.

loans.name: Bushra

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. She is 45 years old, married, and has three children.

Bushra has been a tailor since 2002; she makes and repairs women's and kids' clothing. She gained experience from her father. She has a good reputation and she is well known in her area.

She is requesting a $2400 loan. She is aiming to earn more profit so she can improve her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: To buy two tailoring machines and a generator.

loans.name: Genelie

texts.en:
Genelie is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of vegetables to sell for her vegetable vending business.

Genelie has been in this business for 14 years. Genelie earns additional income from rice and vegetable farming.

Genelie has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Mwale Group

texts.en:
Halima, who is in her early 50s, is married with two adult children and two grandchildren who go to school. She has had a charcoal store since 1998.  She works from 6am to 7pm daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be her seventh loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to buy land, to make bricks for building her house, for school fees and household expenses and has paid back all of her loans successfully. She hopes for a loan to buy more sacks of charcoal.

She will share this loan with her loan group "Mwale" which has a total of 15 members who will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

loans.use: To buy more sacks of charcoal.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en: Veronica is 30 years old and lives with her partner. She has one son who is five years old. She is a teacher at a school for small children ages four to seven. In addition, she also runs a small store from her house on the weekends that sells various types of snacks and beverages. She is asking for a loan in order to purchase more snacks and drinks such as chips, cookies, ice cream, and soft drinks. She desires to expand her business and begin selling a larger quantity of products and the loan will help her to do so. Veronica is committed to making the necessary loan payments on time.

loans.use: to buy more snacks and beverages for her small store.

loans.name: Mwanahamisi

texts.en:
Mwanahamisi is a divorced woman with one child who already graduated from school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past 15 years, she has operated a charcoal selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. Her major challenge is seasonality. During the rainy season, the availability of charcoal is low compared to demand. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Rosine

texts.en:
Rosine is a hardworking entrepreneur who for the past twelve years has had a food vending business in the Philippines. She earns additional income from buying and selling lechon (roast suckling pig).

Rosine has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She is now requesting a loan of 14,000 PHP to purchase ingredients for her food vending business.

Rosine dreams to save enough money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for her food vending business.

loans.name: Chona

texts.en:
Chona is 40 years old and lives in Bontod, Larena, Siquijor, Philippines.  She is married with four children.

Chona is running a new business of selling rice to earn a living.  Each month, she earns PHP 3,500.00 doing this type of work.   She has requested a loan for 15,000 to purchase more sacks of rice.

Chona has been a member of Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative for eleven months.  In the future, Chona hopes to improve their living conditions and  save money for her children's education.

loans.use: To purchase more sacks of rice

loans.name: Augustine

texts.fr:
Augustine est mariée et a 6 enfants à charges. Elle réside dans sa propre maison dans une banlieue à l'Ouest de Cotonou, la capitale économique du Bénin. 
Elle commercialise des céréales, de l'igname et des divers dans une boutique installée à son domicile. Elle mène cette activité depuis 1995 et en maîtrise tous les contours. Augustine fait ses achats dans les marchés des villages de production des produits. 
Au terme de son 2ème crédit et face à la demande croissante de ses clients, elle a sollicité FINADEV pour un renouvellement. Avec le présent prêt, elle pourra effectuer des achats en gros afin de réduire à la fois la fréquence et le coût d'approvisionnement et maximiser son profit. Le revenu supplémentaire engendré par ce crédit lui permettra d'améliorer sa participation aux charges du foyer et faire face aux besoins grandissants de son ménage.
texts.en:
Augustine is married and raising six children. She lives in her own home in a suburb in the west of Cotonou, the economic capital of Bénin. She sells cereals, cocoyams, and various items in a little shop located in her home. She has been in this business since 1995 and is well versed in it. She buys her merchandise in the marketplaces of villages where the items are produced. 

Having arrived at the end of her second loan term and faced with growing demand from her customers, she has asked FINADEV to renew her loan. With this current loan, she will be able to buy wholesale so as to reduce both the frequency and the cost of resupplying her business and thus maximize her profit. 

The supplementary income generated by this loan will allow her to contribute more to supporting her household and to deal with its growing needs.

loans.use: to buy 40 sacks of cereals and 20 sacks of cocoyams.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.pt:
Nasceu no Distrito de Namaacha, Provincia  de Maputo, sul  de Moçambique, solteira e mãe de 6 filhos destes 3 frequentam a escola. Fez a 4ª classe e não continuou por falta de condições financeiras. Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e não sustenta mais ninguem. 

É  comerciante ambulante ha mais de 11 anos e tem um rendimento de cerca de 4.000.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria (BIM).
Nunca teve emprestimos noutros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de uma amiga que tambem é cliente desta instituição. Este é o terceiro emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 14.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar panelas, para aumentar a quantidade da sua mercadoria. Os primeiros emprestimos foram de: 8.000.00mt, e 12.000.00mt, para o comercio.  
Compromete-se a pagar sem problemas e no futuro pretende solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku para construir um estabelecimento comercial e diversificar a sua mercadoria.
texts.en:
Rosa was born in Namaacha District, Maputo Province in southern Mozambique. She is single and has six children; three of them go to school. Rosa finished fourth grade but did not continue with school because of financial problems. She lives in her own house with her family and does not support anyone else.

She has made sales on foot for more than 11 years and has a monthly income of about 4,000 meticais. She uses the money for household expenses and saves some in her bank account (at BIM).

Rosa has never had loans from other banks, and she learned about Hluvuku through a friend who is also a customer of this institution. This is her third Hluvuku loan. She is asking for 14,000 meticais to buy pots and pans so she can increase her inventory. The previous loans were for 8,000 and 12,000 meticais, and were for the business.

She promises to make her payments without problems, and in the future she intends to ask Hluvuku for more loans to build a store and diversify her merchandise.

loans.use: to buy and sell pots and pans.

loans.name: Perlita

texts.en: Perlita is a married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She runs a sari-sari store business, which helps provide for her family's daily needs. She sells items like soy sauce, vinegar and canned goods. She also cooks food that she sells to the people in her community. Perlita has requested a loan to buy more items to sell such as canned goods and fruits. She hopes to have a bigger store in the future.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell such as canned goods and fruits

loans.name: Javier Sebastian

texts.es:
Javier de 41 años de edad, vive con su familia en su casa propia, cuenta con los servicios de agua y luz, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de Chepén que pertenece al departamento de La Libertad.  Los pobladores de ésta zona se dedican a la agricultura y ganadería.

Javier maneja su propia mototaxi (transporte que se utiliza para movilizarse en distancias cortas, con un cupo máximo de 3 personas) desde hace algunos años, está actividad lo realiza en la misma zona donde vive, a pesar de la competencia, él trata en lo posible desde muy temprano movilizar una buena cantidad de pasajeros a sus diferentes destinos, y así tenga mayor cantidad de ingresos para solventar sus gastos y necesidades familiares.

El crédito que ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa es de 500 nuevos soles y su destino será para el mantenimiento de su mototaxi, porque está presentando algunas fallas mecánicas, con la finalidad de seguir brindando un buen servicio a su clientela.  Javier es una persona con muchas ganas de trabajar y de salir adelante en la vida para seguir ayudando a su familia a mejorar y alcanzar sus metas en la vida.
texts.en:
Javier, 41, lives with his family in his own home with water and electricity located in the rural area of the district of Chepén in the department of La Libertad.  The inhabitants of this area work in agriculture and livestock.

Javier has been driving his own mototaxi for several years.  (This transportation is used to go short distances, with a maximum of three people.)  He works in the same area in which he lives, in spite of the competition.  He tries as hard as possible and from very early to move a large number of passengers to their various destinations so he can have a higher income to pay for his expenses and family necessities.

The loan of 500 PEN that he has requested from Edpyme Alternativa will be for maintenance on his mototaxi, because it is showing some mechanical flaws.  His goal is to continue offering his customers good service.

Javier is a person who wants to work and get ahead in life to be able to continue helping his family improve and reach their goals in life.

loans.use: to maintain his mototaxi to continue offering his customers good service.

loans.name: Abilia

texts.en:
Abilia is 62-years-old and lives in Ibabao, Siquijor. Siquijor.  She is married with 7 children.

Abilia sells firewood to earn a living.  She earns, PHp 1,500.00 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan amounting to PHP 4,000.00 to purchase more firewood to sell.

Abilia has been a member of Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative for one month.  In the future, Abilia would like to help her family.

loans.use: to purchase more firewood to sell.

loans.name: Pv - Pub Group

texts.en:
Husna, who is in her early 40s, is married and has three children who have finished school. Husna has  been selling clothes for three years. She works from 9 a.m to 8 p.m daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Husna's 2nd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loan to increase her clothing sales and for household expenses. Husna has repaid her loan successfully. She now wants a loan to buy more clothes to resell. 

Husna will share this loan with her group " PV - PUB" which consists of 16 members who will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to resell.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana tiene 34 años vive con sus hijos y esposo en Guamote un pueblo rural que se encuentra a una hora de Riobamba en la Sierra Centro de Ecuador. Juana es una mujer trabajadora, responsable y amable pero cuando se trata de injusticias su caracter es fuerte.

Juana trabaja con su esposo en la crianza de vacas para la producción de leche, el negocio no les ayuda a sutentar sus gastos y necesidades de su hogar pero el ingreso que tienen actualmente es bajo debido a que tienen por el momento una sola vaca y un ternero, es por eso que realiza su tercer crédito en Fodemi, que va a ser invertido en la compra de una vaca lechera que mejorará la producción y aumentarán sus ingresos. Con estos ingresos podrán mejorar su calidad de vida.

Su sueño es es poder convertirse en una microempresaria de productos lácteos.
texts.en:
Juana is 34 years old. She lives with her children and husband in Guamote, a rural town located one hour away from Riobamba in the central mountains of Ecuador. She is a hard working, kind and responsible woman but has a strong character in the face of injustice.
Juana works with her husband raising cattle for the production of milk. The business does not help them cover all of their household expenses and needs because their current income is low, since they now only own one cow and one calf. Therefore, Juana is asking for her third loan with our institution, which she will invest in the purchase of a milking cow. She expects to improve production and increase her income, thus improving her quality of life. 
Her dream is to become a micro-entrepreneur in the dairy products industry.

loans.use: to purchase a milking cow to expand her dairy business

loans.name: Candida

texts.es:
En Chacaraseca una comarca localizada en el ara rural de la ciudad de León, vive Cándida una mujer luchadora, dinámica y proactiva que le gusta salir adelante muy a pesar de no ser una mujer con estudios profesionales ha sabido desarrollarse en el comercio, ella se dedica a la crianza de cerdos, siembra y tiene una mini pulpería que s de mucha ayuda en su comarca donde no son muy comunes las pulperías. Además es madre y padre de sus 4 hijos que junto con ella han salido adelante con lo poco que han logrado obtener. Comenzó a criar cerdos a los 16 años de edad, este fue su primer negocio después se fue a sembrar yuca, ajonjolí, maíz, frijoles y posteriormente ha ido invirtiendo en su mini pulpería. 
Ella requiere el préstamo para compra de cerdos de crianza. Pues el crédito le ayudara en adquirir cerdos de raza para crianza donde el peso y la reproducción son dos parámetros muy importantes para sus clientes. Una de sus expectativas es tener una granja de cerdos reproductores y hacer crecer su pulpería para ofrecer  variedad productos  de mucha necesidad en su comunidad.
texts.en:
Cándida lives in Chacaraseca, a region located in the rural area of León.  She is a dynamic and proactive woman, a fighter who likes to get ahead.  Very much in spite of not being a woman who studied a profession, she has learned how to develop herself in business.

She works raising pigs and planting, and she has a mini- grocery store that is a big help in her region where grocery stores are not very common.  She also is mother and father to her four children who, together with her, have gotten ahead with the little they have managed to get.  She began raising pigs when she was 16 years old.  That was her first business; later she began to grow yucca, sesame, corn, and beans, and subsequently she has been investing in her mini-grocery store.

She needs the loan to buy pigs to raise.  The loan will help her acquire pigs for raising, since weight and reproduction are two very important parameters for her customers.  One of her expectations is to have a farm of pigs for reproducing and make her grocery store grow to offer a variety of products of great necessity in her community.

loans.use: to buy pigs to raise.

loans.name: Sovanny's Group

texts.en:
Single and 29 years old, Sovanny is a farmer in a rural area of the Thmor Koul district. She supplements her income by raising pigs and chickens. She has been in this business for more than three years and she earns around five U.S. dollars per day. 

Sovanny leads a group of three female members. She has been with VisionFund for one year, while her group members have been with VisionFund from one year to five years. She is now requesting another loan. She wants to use the entire loan to buy more baby chickens for her business. This loan will enable her to increase her business and earn more income to make a better living and have a small farm for her pigs.

loans.use: to buy more baby chickens for her business.

loans.name: María Monserrate

texts.es:
En la ciudadela El Florón de la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Renacer.

En este lugar vive la señorita María, tiene 19 años de edad, está soltera y vive en la casa de los padres.

Ella estudia cosmetología en una Universidad de Portoviejo, además de ser una muy buena estudiante para obtener sus propios recursos y con esto ayudarse con los gastos de sus estudios, realiza trabajos de belleza y arreglo personal y así saca provecho de lo que está estudiando, realiza diversidad de trabajos, como tinturados, maquillajes, pintado de uñas,  etc. Trabaja todos los días cuando  sus clientes requieren de sus servicios, ella también realiza trabajos en su casa y a domicilio. Lleva más de 4 años dedicada a esta actividad y le va muy bien a pesar de que aun no cuenta con un local establecido las herramientas necesarias.

Este crédito lo va a emplear para comprar tintes, maquillajes, tijeras, cepillos, cremas, etc. útiles para su trabajo. Este es su tercer ciclo  en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la facilidad para conseguir los créditos.
 
Sus sueños son algún dia tener un SPA y por lo pronto terminar sus estudios.
texts.en:
The “Renacer” (Reborn) communal bank meets every two weeks in the residential community of El Florón in the city of Portoviejo, the capital of Manabí.  It has been known as the City of the Royal Tamarinds for many years.

This is where 19 year old María lives.  She is single and lives in her parents’ house.  She is studying cosmetology in a university in Portoviejo.  In addition to being a very good student in order to obtain her own resources and help with her educational expenses, she does beauty and personal grooming jobs to take advantage of what she is studying.  She does a diversity of jobs like hair coloring, make-up, and manicures, etc.

She works every day when her customers require her services.  She also does jobs in her house and at the customer’s house.  She has been doing this business activity for four years.  It is going very well for her even though she does not have an established place and the equipment that she needs.

She will use this loan to buy hair coloring, make-up, scissors, brushes, and creams, etc.  These items are useful in her work.  This is her third cycle in the communal bank.  She likes it for the ease of getting the loans.

Her dreams are to one day have a Spa and to finish her studies soon.

loans.use: to buy hair coloring, make-up, scissors, brushes, and creams, etc

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy building materials for his business.

loans.name: Hung

texts.en:
Hung, 51, is the father of one son. Together with his wife, Hung lives in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City. He and his wife earn income from selling rice. He began this business five years ago.

He would like a loan to buy a greater quantity of rice so that he can attract more customers and increase the turnover of his business. 

He hopes that, through the loan, he will be able to increase his income and improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a greater quantity of rice so that he can attract more customers.

loans.name: Kizlarhon

texts.ru:
У Кизлархон есть коровник, где она занимается животноводством.  Она хорошо справляется со своей работой.  Кизлархон занимается этими делами уже более 10 лет. У нее большой опыт работы. Многие соседи берут совет от нее. Она уже знает, как заниматься животноводством. Благодаря ее родителям, что сейчас Кизлархон имеет работу. 
Кизлархон проживает на районе Чиликул вместе мужем и детьми. Муж занимается сельскохозяйственной деятельностью. В животноводстве Кизлархону также помогают ее дети. Кизлархон в основном разводит крупнорогатого скота и в дальнейшем после откорма перепродает их на скотном рынке. В настоящий момент Кизлархон просит кредит, чтобы купить крупнорогатого скота и увеличить поголовье скота и за счет этого увеличить доход от животноводческой деятельности. В будущем у Кизлархон большие планы. Онан верит в Вас и на Вашу поддержку. С Вашей помощью она будет добиться много чего в жизни.
texts.en:
Kizlarhon has a cowshed where she is engaged in animal husbandry. She copes well with her work. Kizlarhon has been in this business for more than ten years. She has a lot of work experience. A lot of neighbours take advice from her. She already knows how to work in animal husbandry. It is thanks to her parents that Kizlarhon now has work. 

Kizlarhon lives in Jilikul district with her husband and children. Her husband is engaged in the farming business. Kizlarhon's children also help her with animal husbandry. Kizlarhon mainly breeds large cattle, and after fattening them up she later resells them at the cattle market. 

Currently, Kizlarhon is asking for a loan to buy some large cattle and increase her livestock headcount. With this, she will increase her income from her animal husbandry business. Kizlarhon has more plans for the future. She believes in you and your support. With your help she will be able to achieve a lot of things in life.

loans.use: Для расширения животноводческой деятельности и купли крупнорогатого скота.

loans.name: Nonghai Group

texts.en: Bualai’s village sources much of their drinking water from local wells, streams, and collected rainwater.  These sources of water are not safe to drink without treatment by boiling.  Bualai and his group are excited that the filter was available on a payment plan that made it much more affordable.  Treating drinking water requires cash and time, which now he can shift to other pursuits.  Bualai and his village also understand the impact unsafe drinking water has on their family’s budgets. The filter is guaranteed for 2 years; within this 2 years filter users, like Bualai’s family, identify a substantial decrease in illness and associated medical costs.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: María Adriana

texts.en:
ENGLISH

Four years ago Adriana and her husband began their small business in order to provide a better future to their family because they have three children. In the beginning they only sold second hand cloths and notions. Today the business is rapidly growing and is a notions and stationery store with a great variety of items.

Their business setting is a great location, in a new zone of the city which has been growing fast lately and at the same time the demand of their products has been increased. This is the reason why Adriana is requesting a loan for $200 USD to pay back in a term of 3-6 months to supply a diversity of items.

ESPAÑOL

Hace cuatro años que Adriana y su esposo iniciaron su pequeño negocio vendiendo ropa usada y algunos artículos de mercería con el objetivo de brindar un mejor futuro para sus familia, ya que tienen tres hijos. Con el tiempo su negocio ha ido creciendo y ha llegado a ser una Mercería y Papelería en donde ofrecen una gran variedad de artículos.

Su negocio esta muy bien ubicado en una zona de la ciudad que ha estado creciendo mucho, es por eso que la demanda por sus productos se ha ido incrementando y debido a ello, Adriana solicita un crédito por $ 200 USD para surtir de mercancía variada su negocio, ella piensa pagarlo en un plazo de 3-6 meses.

loans.use: Merchandise

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane Wangari, aged 50 years, is recently widowed, having lost her husband in January 2007. She has two children and two grand-children, who all depend on her, because her children are only able to get casual jobs once in a while. Jane sells cooked foods, within the Kiambiu slums, including beans, black beans and githeri, a mixture of maize and beans boiled together.

Jane previously had an embroidery business which collapsed after one of her sons was involved in a road accident, where she spent all she had including business money on his medical expenses. This son eventually died, leaving Jane and her other children absolutely poor. Jane had previously borrowed some money from one of the big Micro-finance institutions in Kenya, to enable her to run this business. Due to the medical problem in the family, she was unable to continue with the loan repayments, hence could not borrow again, since she was now viewed as a risky client.  

Jane started off her current business in early 2006, after she borrowed a tin of beans from a businessman, who allowed her to cook and sell the beans, then later make the payments for the borrowed tin of beans.  From the same proceeds, she managed to buy her first tin of beans, which she continued to cook, hence setting up the business. Jane is now a member of the Vumilia group of Action Now Kenya, in the Kiambiu slums, where she has so far accessed two levels of loans, of Usd. 57 and Usd. 85, both of which she used to increase her stock, and which she has since repaid successfully. 

Currently Jane has only one sufuria (cooking pot) of her own, while the other two she has are borrowed, and the owner has actually been asking her to return them. Jane therefore seeks to buy two sufurias of a bigger size than what she is currently using, together with two jikos (cooking stoves) big enough for the pots she will buy. The biggest benefit to Jane will be that she will be able to return the borrowed pots, and also acquire bigger pots that will enable her to make more food, as is required by her customers. She also intends to introduce the sale of boiled green maize (corn) and green grams, which her customers have been requesting her to make.

As part of goodwill, Jane reserves the bean stock she gets from the boiled beans and githeri, to give to some of the women within the Kiambiu slums, who are too poor to buy food. They use this stock to make a stew for the family meal, hence their children don’t have to sleep hungry as long as Jane is there. 

A loan of $75 which will be given to her in kind (i.e ANK will purchase the two pots and cooking stoves for her), will assist her not only to achieve her objective of preparing more food, but will also enable her to have more stock to serve to more people in need. The repayment period for this loan will be between 4 – 8 months.

loans.use: To purchase 2 sufurias (cooking pots) and 2 jikos (inexpensive cooking stoves)

loans.name: Setima

texts.en: Setima used to work, but was forced to quit her job to look after her four little children. Now that her children are older, Setima realized that in order to augment her husband’s salary, she needed to also earn living. Setima then joined the SPBD microfinance program to start a small retail shop in front of her house. She paid off that loan and now plans to obtain a bigger loan to expand her shop, and also build a billiard game shed near it, as a way of attracting more customers to her store.

loans.use: To purchase more goods for her retail shop and purchase a billiard table to start a billiard game business near her store

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en: I've dedicated myself to selling bottled drinks. I also sell snacks, bread, rolls and candy. The drinks sell the most since there are businesses close by that sell food and they always buy their drinks from me. With this business I help my family. Currently I need capital to be able to add more supplies to my business and I need your help.

loans.use: Buy more bottled drinks to sell

loans.name: Virginia

texts.es:
Mrs. Virginia B., 62, was widowed seven years ago. She has three grown children, all with families of their own. She lives alone in her own house and runs a business selling fabric of various types as well as accessories for various types of clothing.

She used to run this business with her husband. When he died after forty years of being together, her grief affected her ability to run her business. But after a few years, she began to regain the strength and courage to keep fighting and in this way make her business prosper.

She has always lived in the city of Encarnación. Her two daughters live and work in the capital city of Asunción, where they are raising their families. Her 42-year-old son lives in the same city as she does and is always nearby.

She has been in this business more than 16 years. She knows the market and has an established client base in spite of the difficulties she has lived through. She is eager to advance her business and needs some capital to give the business she started with her husband a boost.

She is asking for a loan of $1000 so that she can stock fabric, feathers, sequins, and similar merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Antonio and Sarah Padial, Kiva Volunteers

La Señora Virginia (62 años) es viuda desde hace 7 años, tiene 3 hijos mayores, todos independientes y con sus respectivas familias. Vive sola en su casa propia y lleva adelante un negocio de venta de telas de diferentes tipos, además de accesorios para trajes diversos. Este negocio lo llevaba adelante con su marido, pero cuando él falleció, luego de haber compartido 40 años de matrimonio con Doña Virginia, la angustia que le quedó afecto el funcionamiento del negocio. Después de unos años fue tomando nuevamente fuerzas para seguir luchando y así llevar adelante su microempresa. Su residencia siempre ha sido en la ciudad de Encarnación, 2 de sus hijas están en la ciudad capital de Asunción trabajando y formando su familia en esa ciudad, su hijo de 42 años vive en la misma cuidad que ella y la acompaña permanentemente. Ella se dedica a este ramo hace más de 16 años, conoce el mercado y tiene una clientela formada a pesar de las dificultades personales que vivió. Tiene muchas ganas de seguir llevando adelante su negocio, y necesita un poco de capital para impulsar la empresa que empezó con su marido. El préstamo solicitado de $ 1000, es para la compra de mercaderías: telas, plumas, lentejuelas y otros.

loans.use: To buy fabric, sequined cloth, feathers, etc., for dance outfits.

loans.name: Ni Ketut Suliati

texts.id:
Ni Ketut Suliati started selling krupuk ceker ayam ( a type of local chicken crackers made of chicken claws) since 1982. She makes them from her home. She lives with her husband and two children. Her daily income from this is Rp 50.000,00. Due to daily expenses of Rp 10.000,00 and her child's monthly expenses of 250.000,00 forces her to work and her husband income of Rp 300.000,0 is insufficient. Even though with the current price inflation and the epidemic of bird flu has not stop her. She knows that her chicken that she use is free from any sickness, and her customers keep on coming back for more. She has manage to put her children to school with this. To expand her business, she wants to buy better chicken claws.

Translated from Bahasa by Bernard , Kiva volunteer.

Ni Ketut Suliati menekuni usaha jual krupuk ceker ayam sejak tahun 1982. Tempat usahanya adalah rumahnya sendiri. Dia tinggal bersama suami dan dua orang anaknya. Keuntungan yang diperoleh dari usaha ini mencapai Rp 50.000,00/hari. Biaya hidup Rp 10.000,00/hari dan biaya pendidikan anaknya Rp 250.000,00/bulan mengharuskan dia berkerja. Penghasilan suami yang Rp 300.000,00/bulan sebagai guru honorer tentu tidak mencukupi. Harga barang naik dan masalah flu burung yang beredar tidak membuatnya menghentikan usaha ini. Dia mengerjakannya sendiri dan dia tahu bahwa ayam yang dia pakai sehat. Selain itu, banyak pelanggan yang memintanya untuk tetap memproduksi krupuk ceker ayam tersebut. Suliati bisa menyekolahkan kedua anaknya melalui usaha ini. Usaha ini ingin dia kembangkan. Pinjaman yang dia peroleh akan dia gunakan untuk membeli ceker – ceker ayam lebih optimal.

loans.use: Membeli ceker – ceker ayam. To buy chicken claws as raw material.

loans.name: Jamada

texts.en:
The next “evolution” in construction of buildings in villages after mud and twig construction was baked adobe brick and then concrete. One sees all types in Uganda, but in the outskirts of Kampala, adobe and concrete have replaced mud and twig. Jamada’s business, Bright Classic Dobbi (Dobbi means "washing" or "cleaning"), is a typical village building made of concrete with either a wood or metal door large enough to open across the entire front, in order to be more welcoming to customers. Often people will live in the back with their families using only by a simple curtain to separate the living space from the business space. The roof is usually corrugated steel. There are no windows.
Jamada has a cleaning business. He washes the clothes in a plastic basin that he sets out front. Water is carried from the well in five gallon plastic jerry cans which were originally used for cooking oil. After the clothes are dried, he heats a heavily weighted iron over the charcoal stove and presses the garments.
Jamada is married with five children. He and his wife also care for an additional three orphans. He has been in business for eight years, and he dreams buying a small plot and building his own home. He is requesting a loan of $250 to buy supplies for his business and to pay school fees.

loans.use: To buy supplies for his business and to pay school fees.

loans.name: Shazia

texts.en: My name is Shazia R. and I'm from Lahore, the second largest city in Pakistan. I am married with six children, four of whom attend a local school; two are not old enough to attend school yet. My husband owns and runs a small restaurant. Currently he needs to buy a variety of items to stock in the restaurant and would like a loan of $175.

loans.use: To buy items for the resturant

loans.name: Alejandrina

texts.es:
Alejandrina belongs to the Mujeres Luchadoras de Yungay community bank and she sells groceries both wholesale and retail. Her business is located on the fairgrounds of the Yungay district and province in the Ancash department.

With her previous loan valued at 2,000 sols, she improved both her business and her income. Currently she has two different stands, one in Yungay and another in Tarica. With the 3,000 sol loan, which she will pay back in 4 months, she will purchase more wholesale goods (10 sacks of sugar, 10 sacks of rice, 20 boxes of oil and 5 boxes of condensed milk).

Alejandrina is 48 years old, a widow and a mother of four. With her income, she supports her children, who also contribute to the business. Her goal is to keep expanding her and her children’s businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Joanne Egnatchik, Kiva volunteer

La Señora Alejandrina pertenece al banco comunal Mujeres Luchadoras de Yungay. Se dedica a la venta de abarrotes al por mayor y menor. El negocio está ubicado en el campo ferial del distrito y provincia de Yungay, departamento de Ancash.

Con el crédito anterior de S/. 2,000 incrementó tanto el negocio como sus ingresos. Actualmente cuenta con dos puestos de venta, uno en el distrito de Yungay y el otro en el distrito de Tarica. Con el préstamo de S/. 3,000, el cual pagará en 4 meses, invertirá en la compra de más abarrotes al por mayor (10 sacos de azúcar, 10 sacos de arroz, 10 cajas de aceite y 5 cajas de leche gloria).

Alejandrina tiene 48 años, es viuda y tiene 4 hijos. Con los ingresos que tiene apoya a sus hijos, quienes también tiene este negocio. Su meta es seguir creciendo con su negocio y la de sus hijos.

loans.use:
To purchase groceries (sugar, rice, oil and milk)

Compra de abarrotes (azúcar, arroz, aceite y leche)

loans.name: Cruz Teresa

texts.es:
Mrs. Cruz belongs to the community bank "Amistad #2," located in Manantay, Ucayali, in Peru. She is 56 years old, the mother of 4 children, and separated from her spouse. With the first loan she received from Manuela Ramos for 300 soles, she decided to invest in a small general store. Now the shop has grown, and she sells other products that she did not sell before. She must get up very early to open the business that she runs with the help of her children, that at the same time carry out various household chores. With this loan for $425, which she will repay in four months, she will purchase 1 sack of rice, 1 sack of sugar, 1 case of milk, fideo noodles, and 1 gallon of oil. Cruz is well pleased because Manuela Ramos has given her the opportunity to prove herself without placing obstacles in her way, and her business is growing more all the time.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Cruz pertenece al banco comunal Amistad N° 2, ubicado en el AA. HH. Inmaculada Mz. F Lt. 2, distrito de Manatay, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 56 años, es madre de 4 hijos y es separada. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/ 300, decide invertir en una pequeña bodega. En la actualidad la bodega creció y vende otros productos que antes no lo hacía. Se tiene que levantar muy temprano para abrir el negocio que atiende con la ayuda de sus hijos, que a la vez se reparten las tareas domésticas. Con este préstamo de S/.1,200 el cual será pagado en 4 meses, invirtió en la compra de 1 saco de arroz, 1 saco de azúcar, 1 caja de leche, fideos, 1 galón de aceite. Cruz se siente bien satisfecha por que Manuela Ramos le di ola oportunidad de valerse por si misma sin que nadie le ponga obstáculos, su negocio esta creciendo cada vez más.

loans.use: Purchase of groceries (rice, sugar, milk, noodles, etc)

loans.name: Lea

texts.es:
Ms. D. E. is a 39-year-old teacher at the school Colegio Tierno Galván in Juigalpa. She is married and has three sons who are students thanks to her husband's support and the previous 4 loans that they requested earlier. With this new loan she wants to start making improvements to her house since her house is still a work in progres and she needs to make improvements to it for her and her family.

Translated from Spanish by Veronica MR, Kiva volunteer

Profesora del Colegio Tierno Galván de la ciudad de Juigalpa, tiene la edad de 39 años, casada con 3 hijos varones, los cuales estudian con la ayuda de su esposo y los 4 créditos anteriores han podido salir adelante, con este ultimo crédito pretende iniciar las mejoras de su vivienda, ya que es una casa de proyecto y necesita mejorarla para tener mejores comodidades para su familia.

loans.use: To buy building materials to make improvements to her house

loans.name: Coralia Argentina

texts.es:
Coralia is 27 years old and lives in Sabana Grande. She is married and has a four-year-old son. Her husband is self-employed as a driver and she owns a small business, which she began a year and a half ago with the help of financing. It has become difficult for her to acquire products; she needs more investment in order to set up and strengthen her locale to increase her sales of motor oil. Her goal is to improve her home and educate her children.

Translated by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva volunteer

La Sra. Coralia tiene 27 años de edad vive en Sabana Grande es casada tiene un niño de 4 años su esposo es conductor por cuenta propia, ella tiene un pequeño negocio de año y medio que comenzó con financiamiento, con dificultad para adquirir los productos ya que necesita mas inversión para fortalecer y condicionar el lugar en la venta de aceite de lubricante de vehiculo y elevar su nivel de ofertas. Esto con el propósito de mejoras de su vivienda y la educación de sus hijos.

loans.use: To set up her workspace

loans.name: Satemi

texts.id:
Satemi, 40 years old, immigrant from Java island. Satemi and husband have lived in Bali for 5 years. This were done since they like to increase family well being. In Java the population is very crowded, and very difficult to open a business. Now they live in a simple rental house with their 2 children. Her husband's occupation is collecting firewood for resale. He already has steady customers, so that he is not worry to market it. To help family income, Satemi opens a foodstall in their house. Satemi also has steady customers, since in the area a plenty of brick making businesses. During rest hours, Satemi's food stall is visited by many customers. To increase business, Satemi hopes to get the Rp 1,000,000 (about US$125) loan. That loan would be used to buy glass rack from stainless steel for Rp500,000 (about $63), so that it would be more hygienic and looks more attractive, since today she is still using wooden rack. The rest of the loan would be used to increase the food stall assortments. Today Satemi could profit Rp25,000 (about $3)/day, and Satemi hopes with the change and additions in her food stall she could increase her profit.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Satemi, 40 tahun, seorang pendatang dari Jawa. Satemi bersama suaminya sudah tinggal di Bali selama 5 tahun. Hal itu dilakukannya karena ia ingin meningkatkan kesejahteraan keluarganya. Di Jawa penduduknya sangat padat dan sangat sulit untuk membuka usaha. Sekarang mereka tinggal disebuah rumah sederhana dengan lahan sewaan bersama 2 orang anaknya. Suaminya bekerja sebagai seorang pencari kayu bakar untuk dijual kembali. Dia sudah mempunyai langganan tetap sehingga pemasarannya tidak perlu dikhawatirkan. Untuk menunjang usaha keluarga, Satemi membuka usaha warung dirumahnya. Satemi juga mempunyai pelanggan tetap, karena disekitar lingkungan tempat tinggalnya banyak terdapat usaha pembuatan batu bata. Sehingga saat jam – jam istirahat siang, warung Satemi banyak dikunjungi pelanggan. Untuk meningkatkan pendapatan warungnya, Satemi mengharapkan untuk mendapat pinjaman sebesar Rp. 1.000.000.- Pinjaman itu akan digunakannya untuk membeli sebuah rak kaca dari bahan stainless seharga Rp. 500.000.- sehingga kelihatan lebih menarik dan hygienis, karena yang sekarang masih dari rak kayu. Sisa dari pinjaman itu akan digunakannya untuk menambah kelengkapan warungnya. Saat ini Satemi bisa memperoleh keuntungan sebesar Rp. 25.000.- per hari dan Satemi berharap dengan adanya perubahan dan penambahan kelengkapan di warungnya, ia bisa meningkatkan keuntungan yang didapatnya.

loans.use: To buy glass rack and add sales items (Membeli rak kaca dan menambah barang dagangan)

loans.name: Rooslana

texts.en:
Rooslana is single. After working for a while as a salesperson, she decided to start her own venture. Three years ago, Rooslana began selling men and women’s clothing in one of the local markets of Ivano-Frankivsk. Roslana has been an outstanding client with “Nadiya Ukraine,” promptly repaying all the loans that he has taken out and that have had a considerable positive impact on her business.

Rooslana is now asking for a short-term seasonal loan (to be repaid within two months) to be able to purchase 40 women’s shirts and 40 pairs of men's socks. She believes that a good variety of clothing items that are both comfortable and durable will sell well and will help her generate additional profit. Rooslana is hoping to invest part of her profits in fulfilling one of her long-term plans of opening a second vending facility and significantly expanding her business.

loans.use: Purchase of additional goods for sale

loans.name: Ye

texts.en: Mrs. Ye O., a resident of Yok Bath Village in Kandal Province, is a vegetable seller. She is a widow with four children, one of whO. is employed in a garment factory while another one is a tailor. The remaining two are of preschool age. Mrs. Ye O.'s business is currently doing well, so she is requesting a loan to buy more vegetables to resell.

loans.use: To purchase vegetables to resell.

loans.name: Riziki

texts.en:
23-year-old Riziki is married with a 5-year-old child. Since 2005, she has owned an art and craft shop where she works every day, earning a monthly profit of about $40 from her sales.

Riziki is now requesting a loan to improve her business by adding more current stock.

loans.use: To improve her business by adding more current stock.

loans.name: Tomasa

texts.es: LA SEÑORA TOMASA, ES UNA CLIENTE ANTIGUA DE LA INSTITUCION, VIVE EN UNA CASA FAMILIAR, DEBIDO A QUE NO CUENTA CON LOS RECURSOS NECESARIOS PARA TENER SU PROPIA CASITA, TIENE UN NIÑO PEQUEÑO, EN EDAD ESCOLAR QUIEN SE LEVANTA A MUY TEMPRANAS HORAS DE LA MAÑANA, PARA AYUDAR A SU MAMÁ, A ORDEÑAR LAS VACAS Y ASÍ PODER DISTRIBUIR LA LECHE POR LAS DISTINTAS ZONAS DE LA CIUDAD DE LA PAZ. EL CRÉDITO LE SERVIRA PARA COMPRAR EL FORRAJE NECESARIO PARA ALIMENTAR BIEN A SU PEQUEÑO GANADO, PARA ASÍ TENER UNA BUENA PRODUCCIÓN DE LECHE LOS PRÓXIMOS MESES.
texts.en:
Tomasa is a long time client of this institution. She lives in a group home given the fact that she doesn't have the financial resources to have her own home. She has a little boy, school aged, who gets up very early in the mornings to helps her milk the cows and distribute milk in different areas of the city of La Paz. This loan will go towards feed that is necessary to nourish her livestock. With this she will be able to have a good quantity of milk produced in the months to come.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed.

loans.name: Ifan Nafa Group

texts.fr: Ce groupement mixte s'investit dans le transport fluvial entre Ziguinchor et sédhiou; ils sollicitent un prêt pour acheter suffisament du carburant. Avec leurs activités les membres de IFAN NAFA arrivent à satisfaire leurs besoins sociaux
texts.en:
This mixed group works in river transport between Ziguinchor and Sédhiou. They are asking for a loan to buy needed fuel. With their businesses the members of IFAN NAFA manage to satisfy their needs.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: river transport

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi: Chị Nguyễn Thị Tuyến 41 tuổi, tham gia Quỹ Tình Thương năm 1997. Trước khi chưa tham gia Qũy Tình Thương gia đình chị còn gặp nhiều khó khăn do không có vốn để phát triển kinh tế.Sau khi tham gia quỹ nhờ đồng vốn vay của Quỹ chị đã mạnh dạn chăn nuôi, trồng trọt từ đó  kinh tế gia đình chị ngày càng phát triển, đến nay gia đình chị đã mua sắm được một số trang thiết bị cho gia đình như: Ti vi, tủ lạnh, xe máy ....Chị có 2 con hiện nay các con chị đang trong độ tuổi ăn học. Vòng vốn này gia đình chị xin vay 10.000.000đ đầu tư nuôi 500 con vịt giống.
texts.en:
Mrs Nguyễn Thị Tuyến is 41 years old, a TYM fund member since 1997. Before joining TYM fund, her family was having great difficulties because they did not have capital. With the loans from TYM fund, she started raising poultry and cultivating and since then her family's financial situation improves. She has been able to buy things like a fridge, a tv, motorcycle. She has 2 children who are still in school. This time she is requesting a loan of 10.000.000 VND to raise 500 breeding ducks.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising ducks

loans.name: Roger

texts.es: Roger tiene 46 años de edad, es soltero, vive junto a su hermana quien siempre le da la mano en su negocio. El se dedica a la venta de ropa que lleva a vender por los distintos lugares de su localidad, la deja al contado o al crédito, esta labor la viene realizando desde hace un año y lo que le gusta de su trabajo es tener un trato directo con sus clientes y darles una buena atención. Le es rentable porque sus prendas de vestir son de muy buena calidad y sus clientes le compran con mucho gusto y constantemente. Es su primer préstamo con MFP, por lo que se compromete a ser puntual en sus cuotas. Con el dinero que solicita quiere alquilar un local para su tienda de ropa, además de comprar más prendas de vestir.
texts.en:
Roger is 46 years old, is single, and lives together with his sister who always gives him a hand in his business. He earns a living at selling clothing. He takes the clothing to retail at various places in his town, and leaves the clothing for cash or on credit. He has been doing this work for a year and what he likes about his work is having a direct contact with his clients and giving them good service. The work is profitable because his clothing is of very good quality and his clients buy constantly and with great pleasure. This is his first loan with MFP and so to him it is extra important that he be on time with his payments. With the money he is requesting he wants to rent a shop for his clothing store and also to buy more clothing.

Translated from Spanish by Diane Lister, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To rent premises to sell his clothing

loans.name: Valeriy

texts.en:
