Valeriy has a second marriage and a four-month-old son. Valeriy owns a retail business and sells clothes and shoes at a market in Simferopol. His monthly gross income is 10,000 UAH; his profit is about 3,000 UAH.

Valeriy has been in this business for 13 years already. He is an experienced salesperson and has a stable position at the market. He works by himself and knows how to organize this business well. His business goal is to grow bigger. On the other hand, Valeriy has got another goal in his life. He wants to legalize his marriage so that his son can be registered with the father's last name. Valeriy has learned that family is the real value in life, and wants to put family first.

Valeriy would like to receive a loan of 3,000 UAH to increase the assortment of his goods. Having more profit would help him to take better care of his wife and baby son.

loans.use: To increase the assortment of his inventory

loans.name: Shame Paris Group

texts.en: Razia is the group leader of Shame Paris group. They live in district 4th Kabul Afghnistan and there are four members in this group. The total requested amount is 30000 Afghani for the term of 8 months and each of them would like to receive the loan for her own business. Razia and Mah Jabin want to receive a loan for their tailoring business. Zia Gul wants to take a loan for her quilt sewing business and Jamila wants to take a loan for her business of carpet weaving. They would like to admire this process and want to thank form Kiva too.

loans.use: They would like to admire this process and want to thank form Kiva

loans.name: Manolita

texts.en:
Mrs. Manolita Q. is 65 years old. She is married and lives in Lobogon, Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She has 3 children. Her husband is a farmer.

For her age, Mrs. Manolita is still very active; she still works to earn a living. She is a very good cook, especially when it comes to making “puto” (bread made of ground rice) and home-made cookies. It is her skill.

Additionally, she is now trying to raise pigs, a new venture. Fortunately, so far, this has been successful. She has already sold some of her pigs.

Manolita joined Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative to gain access to financial assistance and take advantage of the benefits that members get. She initially received start-up capital of only PHP 3,000. Now, she is applying for a loan of PHP 14,900 so she can buy fertilizers for her new farm. She would like to harvest more rice so she can compensate for her expenses.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for rice production

loans.name: Seng's Group

texts.en:
The group of borrowers consists of four members. Its leader R., 33, is a mother of four children, all of whom are single and under her care. She is married to Dieng, 36, who earns a living fishing along the Mekong river. R. is a fish seller in the market since 2000. She has a lot of customers because her store is located in the busy market. She gets up early every morning to gather the fish from her husband at the riverside and also buys some fish from other fisherman. She resells the fish for a good price. She wants to have a small table for her fish selling so that she can increase her family's income. R. is taking a loan to buy a small table and to pay for her store in the market.

The group includes the following members. K., 53, is a fish trader who is looking for a loan to invest in her business. H., 64, earns a living selling cooked ingredients and is applying for a loan to buy more cooked ingredients for her store. K., 43, earns a living fishing along the riverside and is looking for a loan to buy more fishing web. They all live in Siem Reap Province.

loans.use: To buy a small table and to pay for her store in the market

loans.name: Edna

texts.en: Edna T., 41, is married with four children.  She has six years of experience in the retail business. She sells to the general public seven days per week. She has no previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 187 Tala (~ USD).  SPBD loans are Edna’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: Purchase cigarettes, beverages, sacks of rice, flour, salt, sugar, milk, onions, toilet paper, twisties, lollies, ice cream etc.

loans.name: Ifeoma

texts.en: Ifeoma is 28 years old and married with five children. She sells foodstuffs and provisions. She hopes for the loan amount of N50,000 to purchase more foodstuffs and provisions to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions and foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Nfaly

texts.fr: Nfaly G. tient une alimentation au centre ville de Ziguinchor prés du rond point Jean Paul II. Ce sociétaire de IMCEC Caisse de Ziguinchor a mis en place un petit réseau de redistribution avec des chariots exploités par des ambulants pour toucher le maximum de clients. Ce jeune opérateur et pére de famille de 02 enfants sollicite ce prêt pour renforcer ses activités commerciales.
texts.en:
Nfaly G. has a grocery shop in downtown Ziguinchor near the Jean Paul II roundabout. A member of IMCEC, Ziguinchor Office, he has set up a little distribution network with carts used by ambulant salespeople to reach the maximum number of customers. This young entrepreneur, father of two children, is requesting this loan so as to reinforce his commercial activities.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: selling groceries

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe  Danaya est  constitué de cinq femmes  mariées dont quatre sont polygames et une monogame qui ont une moyenne d’âge de 35 ans et ont en moyenne 2 enfants. Elles habitent à Bougoula hameau, une des communes rurales  de  Sikasso  (3ème région administrative du Mali). 
Elles mènent diverses  activités  qui sont entre autres la vente  de savons,  du bois de chauffe, des pagnes de différentes sortes et  des céréales. 
Elles sont à leur  quatrième   collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de  satisfaire le besoin de la  clientèle et augmenter leur profit. Les prêts précédents ont été  bien remboursés.
Avec ce prêt, elles comptent acheter  20 chargements de charrettes en bois de chauffe, 40 cartons de savons et 30 sacs de céréales. Elles s’approvisionnent au grand marché de la ville de Sikasso, et dans les villages environnants. Les marchandises sont vendues au grand marché de Sikasso ville  sur place,  à domicile et de façon ambulante à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes au comptant, en détail et à crédit.
 Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 22 000 FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée pour aider les maris et l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités et le remboursement du prêt.
Les femmes du groupe Danaya  ambitionnent de devenir des commerçantes grossistes.
texts.en:
This Danaya group is made up of 5 married women of whom 4 are polygamous and the other monogamous, with an average age of 35 and on average 2 children. They live in Bougoula hamlet, one of the rural communities of Sikasso (third administrative region of Mali).

They have diverse businesses, among others selling soap, firewood, various sorts of "pagnes" (lengths of brightly colored African print cloth) and cereals.

They are on their fourth loan with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso, so as to satisfy the needs of their clientele and increase their profit. The preceding loans have all been reimbursed correctly.

With this loan, they intend to buy 20 wagonloads of firewood, 40 cases of soap, and 30 sacks of cereals. They stock up in the big open-air market of the town of Sikasso and in the surrounding villages. The merchandise is sold in the big market of Sikasso town where they live, out of their homes, and door-to-door to a clientele composed of women and men, for cash, retail and on credit.

They each expect to make a monthly average profit of 22,000 F CFA of which part will be used to help their husbands support their families and the rest will be reinvested into their businesses and used to repay the loan. The ambition of the women of the Danaya group is to become wholesalers.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of various articles for re-sale

loans.name: Mavis

texts.en:
Mavis A. is thirty-five years old, married, and currently has no child. She lives with her husband in a rented apartment in a commercial town called Dwenase in the Western Region. Her husband works with a cocoa marketing company.

Mavis trades in secondhand clothes – ladies’ underwear such as bras, etc. She buys her goods from Kumasi and sells at the market square in her community. She treks to other markets to sell as well. Mavis has been in business for eight years and wants a loan to buy bales of textiles in bulk. She aspires to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy bales of textiles in bulk

loans.name: Kaïra Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Kaïra est composé de quatre femmes mariées vivant majoritairement dans des familles polygames avec une moyenne d’âge de 35 ans et  ont en moyenne 3 enfants. Elles vivent dans le quartier Babemba, un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso  (3ème région administrative de la république  du Mali.) 
Elles mènent diverses  activités  qui sont entre autres la vente des pagnes wax, d’habits  pour enfants et  des condiments alimentaires.
Dans le but  d’augmenter la clientèle et leur chiffre d’affaire, elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso  et sont à leur sixième  prêt solidaire, tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés.
 Avec ce nouveau prêt, elles comptent acheter, 30 colis de  pagnes wax, 10 colis d’habits  pour enfants et 40 cartons de condiments alimentaires. Elles s’approvisionnent au grand marché de Sikasso ville et effectuent leurs ventes au marché de Médine, dans les quartiers sur place ou de façon ambulante  à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes et la plupart au comptant.
 Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 12 000 FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée dans l’éducation et  la santé des enfants et l’autre partie sera utilisée  pour rembourser le prêt.
Les femmes du groupe Kaïra ambitionnent devenir des grossistes  et d’entreprendre des voyages entre le Mali et les pays frontaliers.
texts.en:
The Group Kaïra is composed of four married women who mostly live in polygamous families; on average, they are 35 years old with 3 children per woman. They live in the neighborhood of Babemba, one of the neighborhoods in the city of Sikasso (3rd Administrative Region of the Republic of Mali).

They run diverse businesses, selling “pagnes” (brightly printed cloth), childrens clothes and condiments, amongst others.

With the goal of increasing their clientele and their business, they are working with the microfinance group Soro Yiriwaso and this will be their sixth loan. All of their previous loans were properly repaid.

With this new loan, they intend to buy 30 sets of wax “pagnes”, 10 sets of children’s clothes and 40 packages of condiments. They will supply themselves at the large market in the city of Sikasso. They will carry out their own sales in the market of Médine, in the neighborhoods, or door-to-door. They sell to a clientele composed of men and women, mostly in cash.

They anticipate each earning a monthly profit of 12,000 FCFA, which they will use partly for the education and health of their children and the other part will be used to repay the loan.

The ambition of the women of Group Kaïra is to become wholesalers and to take trips throughout Mali and bordering countries.

Translated from French by Margot Bonner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a variety of items for their business.

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es: Miguel Angel es una persona joven de 24 años de edad, vive en la zona de Villa Armonía. Tiene un Taller de Reparación de Calzados hace 3 años, pero trabaja reparando calzados hace cinco. Su padre, el señor  G., fue quien le enseñó esta actividad por que tambíen se dedica a lo mismo. Miguel tiene un hijo pequeño a quién quiere mucho. Además de trabajar en su taller, Miguel, tiene por hobby jugar futbol y wally los fines de semana junto a sus amigos de la zona. Él solicita el crédito para comprar material de trabajo como ser plantas de goma, suela y otros. Miguel es una persona muy conocida en su barrio, por que es responsable y puntual y todos sus clientes estan satisfechos con los trabajos que él realiza.
texts.en:
Miguel Angel is a young man of 24 who lives in the Villa Armonía zone. He has had a shoe repair shop for the past three years, but he has worked with footwear for the past five. His father, Mr. G., was who taught him the craft because that's how he made a living as well. Miguel has a young son whom he loves very much.

Along with working in his shop, Miguel's hobby is to play soccer and wallyball (a mixture of volleyball and racquetball) on the weekends with his friends. He is requesting the loan so he can purchase materials for his job, such as glue, soles and other items. Miguel is a person well known in his neighborhood for being responsible and punctual, and all his clients are satisfied with the work he does.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase glue, soles and other items

loans.name: Lona

texts.en:
Lona F. is a 31-year-old woman living in the town of Aufaga. She is married with four school-aged children. To make a living, Lona operates a family member's business raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income comes primarily from planting and harvesting bananas for sale. Lona has been doing this for over six years and earns approximately 800 WST a month.

In 2004, Lona joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lona has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1750 WST from SPBD. This previous loan was used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. Lona is now requesting a new loan of 2200 WST which will be used to invest in expanding the business. The loan will be her sixth loan from SPBD. Lona plans to use the additional revenue generated to financially support immediate members of her family.

About SPBD:

SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand the business

loans.name: Theresia

texts.en:
Theresia is a member of the Embacasy  borrower group ,she is 32 years old woman,she is married and mother of 3 children,Her children are aged 4,8,10 years.

Theresia started her own crops business selling Tobaccos,Beans 5 years ago,she works 10 hours a day and earn monthly profit approximately 180,000 Tanzania shillings.

This is Theresia`s first loan from BRAC_Tanzania,she requested the amount of 200,000 Tsh in order to buy more tobacco and beans.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan,Theresia hopes to save money,pay school fees and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more tobacco,beans

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.es:
La señora Beatriz es socia del Banco Comunal “24 D. Junio”  que esta ubicado en el distrito D. Ilave, Provincia D. El Collao, Departamento D. Puno, ella tiene 47 años D. edad, estado civil casada y madre D. 3 hijos, estudio educación primaria completa, vive en la Parcialidad D. Alinsuyo Ilave.

La señora trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, hace 4 años su préstamo inicial fue D.  S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, el mismo que lo invirtió en la compra D. cereales. 

En este momento ella solicito un préstamo D. S/. 1700.00 Nuevos soles, para la compra D. cereales, además ella se dedica a la compra venta D. ganado menor y mayor en las ferias D. la zona.

Su deseo es seguir trabajando para darles una educación a sus hijos.

A ella le gustan los ahorros.
texts.en:
Mrs. Beatriz is a member of the "24 D. Junio" Community Bank which is located in the district of Ilave, Province of El Collao, Puno State. She is 47 years old, married and the mother of 3 children. She went to elementary school and lives in Parcialidad D. Alinsuyo Ilave.

Mrs. Beatriz has been working with the Manuela Ramos Association for 4 years; her initial loan was 300 nuevos soles that she invested in the purchase of grains.

At this time she is asking for a loan of $600 that will be invested in the purchase of grain. She is also engage in purchase and sale of small livestock and cattle at the fairs in the area.

Her desire is to keep working to give her children an education. She likes the savings.

Translated from Spanish by Adriana Pierce, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Catalina

texts.es:
Catalina tiene 68 años, es una dulce mujer entregada a su trabajo, vive en su casa propia junto a su hijo, con quien comparte todas sus alegrías y triunfos. Tiene un pequeño restaurante ubicado en el parque de su localidad, para este negocio cuenta con una socia, quien es una amiga con la que trabaja arduamente. Desde las 10 de la mañana inicia su actividad preparando los más deliciosos platillos, sobre todo los más solicitados por sus clientes, quienes diariamente se reúnen en el local de doña Catalina y ella los recibe con una gran sonrisa, pues sabe que gracias a ellos su negocio va mejorando. Lo que más le agrada de su trabajo es compartir sus actividades junto a su amiga, quien le ayuda en la atención a los clientes haciéndose menos pesado el trabajo. Esta actividad la viene realizando hace 11 años y considera que lo más difícil es atender a sus comensales durante el medio día, pues la demanda es mayor. Sus planes a futuro son de ampliar su restaurante y ambientarlo con muebles que den mayor comodidad a sus clientes.  
Este es su préstamo 18 con Microfinanzas PRISMA, donde su responsabilidad y compromiso la caracterizan en su banco comunal, donde todas sus compañeras la respetan como líder del grupo. Con los dos mil soles que ahora solicita comprará algunos utensilios de cocina que le hace falta para una mejor atención en su restaurante.

loans.use: Compra de utensilios de cocina

loans.name: Nhem

texts.en: Nhem P., 30, lives with two of her children in the Takeo province. She usually purchase rice and take off the husk with the intention of reselling the rice and turning over a profit. On average, she makes US$2 of profit every day. Her husband, pictured here, is a cow dealer who is able to earn a living of US$3 each day. Nhem P. is asking for a loan of US$600 her husband needs to purchase more cows to resell.

loans.use: Raise cows.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth C. is from the village of Tubod. She is 54 years old, married and has five adult-aged children. To make a living, Elizabeth owns and operates a hog raising business. Elizabeth has been in business for over five years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month.

In 2004, Elizabeth joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to improve her living situation and to engage in business. Elizabeth has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Elizabeth is requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This loan will be the 18th loan taken out by Elizabeth from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue to supplement her family's income. 
--------------
About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.use: Purchase livestock feed and supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy ingredients to prepare food, soft drinks

loans.name: Sènan

texts.fr: M. Sènan est née en 1981 à Adja au Mono au Bénin. Il y a 28 ans de cela que Sènan vit au quartier Cadjèhoun à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Mariée à BENSAN Sévérin, un revendeur de pièces détachées, Sènan à trois enfants à charge, dont deux sont ses propres enfants. Certains enfants sont scolarisés. Sènan vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son conjoint. Le couple supporte ensemble les charges de la famille. Sènan n’a fait que l’école primaire. Depuis 7 ans environs, Sènan vend des divers (savons, omo, lait, papiers torchons, etc.) et aussi du maïs à son domicile. C’est à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin, que Sènan s’approvisionne. Sènan a déjà bénéficié de deux crédits à ALIDé, crédits qui ont été bien remboursés. Sènan ambitionne devenir plus tard une grande commerçante. Sènan souhaite augmenter son fonds de roulement afin d’agrandir son activité. C’est pour cela que Sènan sollicite un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Sènan M. was born in 1981 in Adja, department of Mono, in Benin. She has lived for the past 28 years in the neighborhood of Cadjèhoun in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. She is married to Séverin Bensan, a retailer of spare parts. Sènan provides for three children, of whom two are her own. Some children attend school. She lives with her children and her husband. She and her husband provide together for their family. Sènan attended only primary school.

For about seven years Sènan has been selling various articles (soap, washing powder, milk, paper towels, etc.) and also corn from her home. It is in Dantokpa, the international market of Benin, that Sènan gets her supplies. She received already two loans from Alidé, which she repaid on schedule. Her ambition is to become a great merchant. She wants to increase her working capital and bolster her activity. This is why Sènan came to Alidé and applied for her third loan.

Translated from French by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy soap, washing powder, milk and a sack of corn

loans.name: George Mburu

texts.en:
George is 22 years old and married to Mercy. They have one son aged 4 months.

George learned about KADET through the KADET sign board (marketing). He has no loan or credit history with other micro-finance institutions.

George has been running a greengrocer (fruit and vegetable) business for the past six months. With this loan, he intends to add stock to his business. Specifically, he will purchase bananas and onions to sell to customers, thereby diversifying his stock.

George intends to open a wholesale shop with the extra profits generated from the business as a result of this loan. His dreams are to expand his business and set up a chain of stores (supermarkets). George says he is not afraid to take valuable business risks in the future so long as they are calculated. He describes himself as very hardworking.

loans.use: To add bananas and onions to his business stock

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane B., 43 years old, owns and manages a small rice farm in Banga South Cotabato Mindanao. She has four children. Her eldest child is 15. The second child is 14. The third child is 13 and the youngest is only 6 years old.  She wishes to grow her business so that she will have enough income to support their education and all the family needs.

She is hoping to receive a loan from Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan of PHP 6,000 to buy farm supplies to increase the size of her harvest and her income.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn S. is from the village of Tagulalo, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 39 years old, is married, and has five school-aged children.

Evelyn owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling biscuits,sugar,salt,shampoo, coffee,milo, soap(laundry and bath) and candies in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Evelyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell.

Evelyn is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will also be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her fourth from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 


About GDMPC:
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.
 *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Caring Friends Group

texts.es:
Grupo solidario conformado por tres socias, Nancy, con su esposo tiene un trabajo  de electricidad, Irma, un café internet, y Vilma, costura, miscelánea y librería.
Vilma, tiene 41 años de edad, vive en ciudad Guatemala, tiene 3 hijos el cual 2 de ellos trabajan y uno que es el mas pequeño esta estudiando, su negocio es costura donde esta trabajando los uniformes de una escuela de donde ella vive, tiene 18 años de tener su negocio con la ayuda de su esposo han podido superarse y ahora tiene la necesidad de adquirir un crédito para poder comprar mercadería telas y accesorios para los uniformes, el cual recurrieron a la Fundación FAPE Y KIVA para que puedan brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes y un mejor futuro a sus familia
texts.en:
This is a caring group formed of 3 members. Nancy has an electrical job with her husband, Irma works at an internet cafe, and Vilma sews, sells stationery items, books, and general merchandise from her home.

Vilma is 41 years old and lives in Guatemala city. She has 3 children. Two of them work and the youngest one is in school. She has a sewing business where she works on uniforms for a school from her area. She has been in this business for 18 years and has been able to succeed with her husband's help. Now she is in need of a loan to purchase merchandise, fabrics, and accessories for the uniforms. This is why she requested one through the FAPE Foundation and KIVA as well as to be able to offer better service to their clients and a better future to their families.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Garza, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchase of thread and fabrics.

loans.name: Chy

texts.en:
Mrs. Chy K. is a villager from Ta Daol Bei Village in Kandal Province. She is 52 years old. She is the mother of four children. One of her children is a security guard and the others attend the local public school. 

Mrs. Chy K. breeds pigs. Her husband, Mr. Sok Kong Srun, is a farmer who owns a 1.5-hectare (~3.7-acre) of land on which he grows rice to support his family. They have some problem with their rice field, because the soil is infertile soil and far from an irrigation system. Thus, to improve the productivity of their rice field, Mrs. Chy K. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer and fuel. With the rest of her loan, she would like to buy pig food. 

Her husband is on the left in the picture.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and fuel

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel has owned a barbershop for the past 18 years where he services his town and the neighboring villages. Due to his long experience, he is well known in the whole region and a good number of clients visit his barbershop. He's 38 years old, married and father of two young children. 

Today, Daniel wishes to improve his barbershop and buy tools and supplies such as gel, wax, beauty products etc. to attract more customers. In order to do so, Daniel is requesting to borrow $1,200.

loans.use: To buy tools and supplies

loans.name: Pablo Cruz

texts.es: Pablo Cruz tiene 75 años.es una persona muy responsable pues ha sido un buen cliente. La actividad económica de Pablo es ofrecer los servicios de carpintería. El dio inicio hace más de 44 años, pues era su único  medio de ingreso ya que tenía que proporcionarle el pan de cada día. Y Logro salir adelante, Pablo es un hombre muy luchador y que le gusta el trabajo duro. Por lo que el financiamiento que solicitan es para capital de trabajo para la compra de materiales. Sueña con proporcionarle mejoras a su vivienda.
texts.en:
Pablo Cruz is 75 years old. He is a very responsible person and has been a good customer. Pablo has been offering carpentry services for more than 44 years. This is his only means of income to provide for his daily needs. Having achieved success, Pablo is a very determined man and enjoys hard work.

The loan he is requesting will be used as operating capital to buy materials. He dreams of making improvements to his home.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase carpentry materials

loans.name: Mario

texts.es: Mario F. P. de 44 años de edad, reside en el departamento de La Libertad. Vive junto a su esposa, quien su mano derecha en el negocio, y junto a dos hijos menores de edad, los cuales se dedica a estudiar. Mario posee un comedor, en el cual junto a su esposa se encargan de elaborar desayunos y almuerzos, los cuales comercializan con las personas que viven en los alrededores, como también con personas que transitan en el lugar, ya que el comedor esta ubicado en la carretera principal, lo cual lo hace muy visible para la mayoría de personas, sobre todo las que viajan por largas distancias, quienes se detienen a descansar y a comer. Mario solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda obtener el dinero necesario para comprar granos básicos, bebidas, frutas, verduras y todo lo necesario para la elaboración de alimentos. Tanto para Mario como para su esposa es de mucha importancia mejorar sus ventas, ya que es esta manera en la cual se ganan la vida.
texts.en:
Mario F. P., 44 years of age, lives in La Libertad. He lives with his wife, who manages the business, and two young children who are in school. Mario has a food stall where, together with his wife, he makes breakfast and lunch to sell to local residents. He also sells to people passing by, as the business is located on a major roadway. This makes it highly visible, and a popular stop for travelers who have gone long distances and need to rest and eat. Mario is requesting a loan to have funds for the purchase of basic foodstuffs such as beverages, fruits, vegetables, and all the necessary ingredients to make his meals. It is very important, to both Mario and his wife, to increase their sales since the business is their livelihood.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients for preparing food/meals.

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es:
El Sr. Julio R. es de la  ciudad de Carapegua, es casado, con una hija,  el mismo cuenta con casa propia y se dedica a  la fabricación de calzados, los mismos son comercializados en otras ciudades vecinas.

    Hace muchos años que se dedica a esta actividad y cuenta que le va muy bien en su negocio. 

   Debido a la gran cantidad de pedidos que recibe necesita de mas capital para la fabricación de sus calzados para ello se acercó a la Fundación Paraguaya para solicitar un préstamo para la compra de materia prima (cuero, pinturas, clavos, colas).
texts.en:
Mr. Julio R. is a married man who lives in the city of Carapegua and has one daughter. He has his own house and makes shoes for a living, shoes which he sells in neighboring cities. He states that has been in business for many years, and that his business has been quite prosperous.

Due to the amount of orders that he has received, he needs more working capital so that he can produce the shoes. For this reason, he turns to Fundación Paraguaya in search of a loan so that he can purchase the materials he needs (leather, paint, nails, glue).

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase leather, paint, nails, glue and other shoemaking materials

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en: Jackline A. is currently in the business of selling tomatoes and groundnut phase (peanut butter) and is requesting a loan to stock bread and onions to sell. Jackline is 17 years old and is single. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy a plot and build a rental property. About BRAC BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock bread and onions to sell

loans.name: Gilberto

texts.en:
Gilberto C. was born in Maputo city, the capital of Mozambique, in 1971 and has never lived anywhere else. He studied till 8th grade and then emigrated to neighboring south Africa to learn a living. There he learnt how to build and paint ceilings, although he has not done that any more in a long time.

Gilberto lives with his partner and has two children with her, aged 7 and 4. The eldest goes to school and the youngest will go soon. He also supports one sister of his who lives nearby.

Gilberto had been working for a while as a car painter till, in 2004, he opened a hairdresser's nearby which he now runs. He has a couple of employees and makes an income of about 500 meticals per day.

Gilberto is asking for a loan to start up a little grocery business within his property, at a stall next to his house that he shows in the photo and is about to finish. With the money from Kiva he is going to buy rice, milk, sugar and other food products to sell there with the help of his wife.

This is Gilberto’s third loan from Hluvuku, Kiva´s partner in Mozambique. The first one was also to start a grocery business but that did not work out; the second was used to perform construction work on his property.

Gilberto dreams of starting other businesses nearby if things go well. For example, he names an off-license shop.

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, milk, beverages and other food products for his shop

loans.name: Mrs. Yaem Sok Village Bank Group

texts.en: This village bank loan has fourteen people who are located in Rovieng village, in Takeo province. They will each use a little money from the loan for different purposes to improve their standards of living. Mrs. Yaem S. is a village bank president who has been selected by the other members. She is 64 years old. She owns a general store in the local village where she can resell groceries to support her family. Since her business is going well she wants to expand. So to improve this business, Mrs. Yaem S. is asking for a loan to buy more groceries. Her husband, Mr. Nel Neng, is a farmer who owns one-hectare plot of land, to cultivate rice to sell, to support his family. This couple does not have a child.

loans.use: To buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: María

texts.es: María de 54 años, vive en su casa propia en compañía de sus tres hijos y de su pequeño nieto que es su adoración. El trabajo que realiza es la venta de jugo de frutas, en donde lo prepara de acuerdo a los pedidos que le hacen sus clientes, es entonces que debe levantarse desde muy temprano por la mañana para preparar y llevar a domicilio sus juegos. Paralelo a ello, es una líder de su zona y por ello es muy querida y respetada, dentro de las actividades que realiza es la encargada de repartir alimentos a la gente de su comunidad. Es una mujer muy responsable y entusiasta, que además de los trabajos que realiza, también cuida de su nieto, y por él es que debe trabajar muy duro para brindarle todas las comodidades. Este es su sexto crédito con MFP, por lo que siempre espera ser muy puntual con todos sus pagos. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará frutas para la preparación de sus jugos.
texts.en:
María is 54 years old and lives in her own home with her three children and her young grandson who she adores. She sells fruit juices that she prepares according to what her customers order. María wakes up early in the morning to prepare the juices to take out to sell. At the same, she is an admired and respected leader in her area since she is in charge of distributing food aid to people in the community. María is a responsible and enthusiastic woman. In addition to the activities she is involved in, she also takes care of her grandson, so she must work very hard to provide him all the comforts.

This is her sixth loan with MFP. As always, María expects to be prompt with all of her payments. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy fruits for preparing her juices.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fruits for preparing juices

loans.name: Tawopaneh Group

texts.en:
Mohamed T. sells cigarettes. He has been managing this business for eight years now. With his share of this loan, he will buy different brands of cigarettes – Gold Seal, Bond Street, Capital, 555, Cosmos, etc,. at wholesale prices. He was born in a place called Konta, in Northern Sierra Leone. He is 27 years of age, married and has two children who are not of school-going age.

Mohamed (who is in the back row on the right) is the leader of this group. They are people running small-scale businesses in Makeni, a city in Northern Sierra Leone. They have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva, seeking a loan of 500,000 leones each to enable them to expand their businesses. With the loan, they will be able to add more stock and make more sales and profit.

loans.use: To buy different brands of cigarettes

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.fr:
Femme commerçante de 54 ans, célibataire avec 2 enfants, dont l’age varient entre 22 ans et 19 ans.En classe de première ,quand elle perd ses parents par manque de soutien , elle se lance dans le commerce des poissons fumes.
Elle a une recette journalière de 30000  a 50000frs par jour, elle s’approvisionne 
Dans les marches intérieures du pays  ou les villages riverains ou l’activité principale est la pêche des poissons du fleuve
Avec le prêt qu’elle compte recevoir elle va acheter  5 paniers de Mboto (gros carpes) ,10 paniers de silures (Ngolo) et 8 paniers de lamproie ou anguilles (Nzombo), poissons très consommes dans les familles congolaises.

Avec le temps, elle a des projets d’élargir en  ouvrant un  grand dépôt de poissons, avoir des fournisseurs riverains qui viendront livrer des paniers de poissons sur place au lieu d’effectuer des voyages par pirogues chaque semaine.
Plus elle va accroître son stock, plus les bénéfices seront énormes pour accroître  son épargne et cela va la permettre de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille  et les pousser a faire des grandes études.
texts.en:
Rosalie M. is 54 years old, single and mother of 2 children aged between 19 and 22. In her second last year of high school she lost parents and due to lack of support started a business selling smoked fish. She has a daily revenue of 30000 to 50000 and gets her supplies from the inland markets or from the riverside villages where fishing is the principal activity. With the loan she hopes to receive, she will buy 5 baskets of Mboto (large carp). 10 baskets of brown bullheads (Ngolo) and 8 baskets of sea lamprey or eel (Nzombo), all heavily consumed fish in Congolese familiies. In time, she has plans to expand and to open a large fish outlet, and have the riverside suppliers deliver their baskets of fish rather than her having to make the trip by canoe each week. The more she increases her stock, the greater her profits will be, enabling her to increase her savings and in turn provide for her family and put her children through tertiary level education.

Translated from French by Kate Bennett, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Achat de paniers de poissons fumes de carpes, anguilles,silures

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more clothing

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.es:
Beatriz, de 35 años de edad, convive con su pareja y tienen tres hijos en su haber. Juntos residen en la localidad de Quimbiri, ubicada en la hermosa selva ayacuchana, donde tiene su propia casa a base de madera. 

Tenía 27 años cuando decidió abrir su propia tienda de abarrotes, un proyecto que no tardó en conquistar a sus clientes, desde luego que sus primeras ventas salían de a pocos, pero con el tiempo sus ventas no pararon de incrementar hasta hoy; ella reconoce que la clave está en el esfuerzo y amor al trabajo, es por ello que sus clientes están satisfechos con el producto que recibe. 

Normalmente trabaja por cuenta propia, pero en tiempo de vacaciones recibe la ayuda de sus hijos. Su plan a futuro es ampliar su tienda introduciendo nuevos productos de vanguardia y de diferentes precios, con la finalidad de que pueda aumentar sus ventas. 

Este es su primer crédito con MFP, por el cual se compromete a cumplir con sus obligaciones de pago, además está satisfecha por el buen trabajo de su grupo comunal. 

Con el crédito que solicita lo piensa invertir en la compra de mercadería, de esa manera pueda abastecer su tienda.
texts.en:
Beatriz, 35, lives with her life partner and their three dependent children in Quimbiri, located in the beautiful Ayacucho backcountry, where they have their own wood house. She was 27 years old when she decided to open her own grocery store, a project that soon attracted customers. Needless to say, sales at first were meager but in time they grew and continue to do so to date. She recognizes that the key to success is effort and love of work. This is why her customers are satisfied with the products they receive. Normally she works alone but during school breaks her children help her. Her plan for the future is to expand her store introducing new, cutting edge, products of various prices with the aim of increasing sales. This is her first loan with MFP and she pledges to repay in a timely fashion. She is happy with the level of cordiality that reigns in her communal group. She will use the funds to buy merchandise to stock her store.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock items for her store.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en: Lilia C. is a married woman who lives in Barangay Lumbangan, Mabinay, Negros Oriental. She earns her living by operating two business ventures: a general store and a fruit and vegetable vending business. Her husband, Fredie C., who is 56 years old, works as a kitchenware salesman. They have four children who are between 30 and 36 years old with their own livelihoods and families. Lilia joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2000 because she wished for something better for her family. With the help of her past fifteen loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, she has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 12,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 30,000, uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her 16th loan, Lilia is borrowing PHP 15,000, which she intends to use to purchase additional fruits and vegetables to sell so that she can continue to save for her family's future security and sustain her business. Lilia is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue in its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by visiting the NWTF lending team on Kiva to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase more fruit and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Antonieta Maricela

texts.es:
Antonieta Maricela Z. S.
Antonieta es de 23 años de edad, casada, es tejedora en la actividad tiene 8 años de experiencia, solicita su primer crédito, para gastos personales de servicios, es factible autorizar a la solicitante, en virtud que la misma es utilizada para capital de trabajo. Así mismo los pagos provienen de remesas familiares. Por lo que no tendrá dificultades para efectuar los pagos correspondientes.
texts.en:
Antonieta Maricela Z. S.
Antonieta is 23 years old and married. She is a weaver. She has 8 years of experience in this activity. She is asking for her first loan for personal expenses for utilities. It is feasible to authorize the applicant, because it will be used for working capital.  The payments will come from family remittances.   Because of this, she won't have any problems making the corresponding payments.

loans.use: Personal expenses

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine A. is 41 years old and married to Dalmas Okeyo. They have six children who are above 18 years old. They live in Kisumu city where she runs her business.

Christine is a fishmonger and she has been running this business for the past 15 years. She has created a huge clientele because people have a good rapport with her and because she is reliable. She is applying for her first loan from KADET LTD, having been introduced by a friend who is also a client here.

Her desire is to expand the business and be able to sustain her family from the profits that she makes from her business.

loans.use: To buy fish to add to her stock

loans.name: Damaris

texts.es: L. Señora Damaris  usara su credito para abrir un nuevo restaurant y asi mejorar su ingreso para poder construir su propia casa y ayudar a su familia ya que les daria empleo en el negocio y podra atender a sus clientes mejor ya que ellos fueron los que L. animaron a abrir L. sucursal po r que L. sra. Damaris solo abria los fines D. semana por L. mañana y L. nueva sucursal estaria abierta toda L. semana y el fin D. semana por L. tarD.  y ademas podria poner aparte D. L. venta D. comida L. venta D. ropa L. sra. Damaris es una parsona muy trabajadora y dice que su esposo L. apoya en todo por eso juntos tienen toda L. confianza D. que saldran adelante.
texts.en: Damaris will use her loan to open a new restaurant and thereby improve her income.  This will enable her to build her own home and help her family since she will give them work in the business.  She will also be able to better serve her customers.  It was her customers who encouraged her to open the establishment as Damaris only used to open weekend mornings but the new establishment will be open every weekday and weekend afternoons.  In addition to selling food, she also sells women's clothing.  Damaris is a very hard-working woman and says that her husband supports her in everything.  Together they are confident that they will get ahead.

loans.use: Investment in home-made meals business

loans.name: Betty

texts.es:
Betty es socia del Banco Comunal “Bartolina Sisa”, ubicado en el distrito de Ilave, provincia de EL Collao,  Departamento de Puno, tiene 32 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente con cuatro hijos y tiene grado de instrucción superior.
Betty viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace tres años, el primer préstamo solicitado fue de S/.300.00 nuevos soles, dinero que invirtió en la compra y venta de animales menores,  actualmente se dedica a la venta de utensilios de cocina como cucharas, platos, cuchillos y muchos otros. 
La señora solicitara un nuevo préstamo de S/ 1000.00 nuevos soles, préstamo que le permitirá ampliar la mercadería de su negocio. 
Su sueño  es ser microempresaria. Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es la confianza y las facilidades del préstamo.
texts.en: Betty is a member of the Community Bank, "Bartolina Sisa”, located in the Ilava district, the Collao Province, in the state of Puno. She is 32 years old, married, and lives with four children. She studied through high school.  Betty has been working with the Manuela Ramos Movement for three years. Her first loan she borrowed 300 Soles; money she invested in the buying and selling of young (small) animals. She currently sells kitchen utensils like spoons, plates, knives and other things. Betty is asking for a new loan to borrow 1,000 soles. The loan will enable her to broaden her merchandising base. Her dream is to one day become a successful small-businessness-owner. She likes the Community Bank's security and the ease of its lending services.

loans.use: Broaden the merchandise for her business

loans.name: Bakhaan's Group

texts.en:
Bakhaan lives in a small city called Jaranwala, which is located in Punjab province of Pakistan and known for its agriculture industry. She has been living there in a 2 roomed brick house with her family, in the area named Mughalpura, since her marriage many years ago. Her husband has a construction supplies sales business. He provides cement, bricks and other construction related materials to his customers on order. He has been doing this business for many years and he is well-known for his quality items and good services. 

Bakhaan is the mother of two children, both are sons. Her elder son has a fruit-selling business and the younger one weaves carpets. Bakhaan, herself, is a housewife. She stays at home and does her household responsibilities. She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to financially assist her elder son in his fruit-selling business. With the loan, he will buy more fresh, seasonal fruits and increase his sales. She is hopeful that an investment will successfully improve his business condition and increase his income. 

Bakhaan is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 2nd loan application. In the previous loan year, she built a good credit behavior and never missed any meetings. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Bakhaan.

loans.use: To buy fresh, seasonal fruits for fruit-sellling business.

loans.name: Felistar

texts.en: Felistar is a single mother of two. To raise her family, she runs a salon.  She started the business in 2007 and has been able to grow the business through Faulu Kenya.  This is because of financial support from Faulu Kenya.  Her business is located in the slums and she hopes to move the business into the City Centre in the future.  She has requested 30,000 Kes to buy hair braids, weaves, hair oil and hair chemicals.

loans.use: To buy hair braids, weaves, hair oil and hair chemicals

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “NUEVO AMANECER DEL CUSCO”; Este banco está ubicado en el distrito D. Huanchac en la provincia y departamento D. Cusco.

La socia es la Sra: Teresa; ella tiene  46 años. La socia es soltera, y tiene 1 hijo;  La socia se dedica a la administración y atención diaria D. sus tienda D. abarrotes, ella compra mercadería como leche, fideos, arroz, azúcar, harinas y los venD. al por mayor, la socia ahora desea invertir en crédito en la salud D. su padre él se encuentra enfermo, su padre es adulto mayor y a la socia le preocupa la salud D. su papá, la socia desea llevar a su padre a un examen general y darle calidad D. vida, ella invertirá el crédito en el chequeo general médico D. su papá. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la salud D. su padre.

La socia está feliz con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago D. sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Sra. Teresa is a member of the Communal Bank “Nuevo Amanecer del Cusco” (New Dawn of Cusco), which is located in the District of Huanchac, Province and Department of Cusco.

She is 46 years old, single, and has one child. Teresa manages a grocery store on a daily basis. She buys merchandise such as milk, noodles, rice, sugar, and flour to sell in bulk. Teresa wants to invest this loan in her father’s health because he is currently ill. Her father is an elderly gentleman and she is worried about his health. Teresa wants to bring her father in for a general examination so that he will have quality of life. She will use this loan for a general medical check-up for her father so that she can invest in his health.

Teresa is happy with the loan that has been provided and promises to complete her payments by the established deadlines.

loans.use: Pay for her father's medical exam

loans.name: Cyborg Group

texts.en:
Meet with members of the “Cyborg” group from Magburaka, a town in northern Sierra Leone. They are all local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org to apply for a loan of SLL 800,000 for each. With the help of this loan they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve on their living conditions. 

Adamsay is the leader of this group. The thirty-five-year-old is married to a farmer and they have three children. Adamsay has been a businesswoman for many years now, she sells shoes. With her share of this loan, she will buy bales of shoes to add to her business. 

(Also included in the right of the photo is loan officer Mohamed L. Tarawalie handing over the loan to the clients)

loans.use: Buys bales of shoes to add to her business

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa B. is from the village of Talisayan, Misamis Oriental. She is 39 years old. Elsa is married and has three school children. To make a living, Elsa owns and operates a business making and selling food. The main source of income for the business comes from making and selling snacks and other delicacies like banana and camote (or sweet potato) cue in the local community. Elsa has been engaged in her business for over eight years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities. In 2010, Elsa joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elsa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used as working capital and to purchase additional ingredients. Elsa is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients she needs, like bananas and sugar. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Elsa from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it.

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed like bananas & sugar

loans.name: Choeun

texts.en:
In the province of Battambang, Choeun N. has been selling different kinds of vegetables at the market for years and typically generates an income of $2 per day. Choeun N. has been married for a long time and has seven children. Three of her children are married and four are single. Most of her children work at different jobs, while her husband assists her in delivering vegetables to the market. 

In order to earn additional income and make the business more successful, Choeun N. is asking for a loan to increase the capital of her vegetable sales business.

loans.use: To grow the capital for her vegetable sales

loans.name: Alba Colombia

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Tosagua cada quince días se reúne el Banco Comunal La Inmaculada, este lugar se lo conoce por ser muy dinámico donde la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y a la cría de animales, por ser una zona con gran vegetación.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Alba, ella tiene 51 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene seis hijos, todos son mayores de edad, tres de ellos que son solteros  aun viven con ella. Su esposo es panadero.

Tienen una pequeña panadería en su casa en donde fabrican y venden todo tipo de pan. Trabajan  todos los días desde las 5am para tener el delicioso pan para la venta y así satisfacer a sus  clientes que les encanta el pan que ellos elaboran. Además de vender en su casa también su esposo sale con el producto a recorrer por toda la ciudad para vender un poco más ya que les lleva los panes hasta la casa a los clientes.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar más harina, sal, manteca y otros ingredientes para elaborar el mejor pan. Está en el Banco Comunal hace 10 años  y le gusta porque los créditos le ayudan a desenvolverse en su negocio. Sus metas son seguir adelante en su negocio y que su familia goce de buena salud.
texts.en:
In the city of Tosagua the "La Inmaculada" Communal Bank meets every two weeks, this place is known as being very dynamic where the majority of its residents working in farming and animal rearing, it is an area with a lot of vegetation.

In this place we meet Alba, she is 51 years old, married with six children from this union, all are grown up, three of them who are single still live with her. Her husband is a baker.

They have a small bakery at their home where they make and sell all types of bread. They work every day from 5am to have delicious bread to sell and satisfy their customers who like the bread that they make. As well as selling at their home her husband also goes out through the city with their produce to sell a little more and to deliver bread to the homes of their customers.

This loan is going to be used to buy more flour, salt, butter and other ingredients to make the best bread. She has been in the Communal Bank for 10 years and she is happy because it helps them to do well in their business. Her goals are to keep doing well in the business and that her family to enjoy good health.

loans.use: To buy flour, salt, butter and other ingredients to make bread.

loans.name: Asi

texts.en: Asi Y. sells cooking pots and coal-pots in the market of Jukwa near Abura. Asi's husband passed away and she is left alone with her three children. Most of her income is being used for the well-being of her children. It is also very important for her that they get the chance to go to school. In order to make this possible she tries to provide school books and other learning materials. But she is struggling and would like to see her business grow to get more profit out of it. Therefore she will use the money from the loan to buy more goods and offer her customers a larger variety. (In the picture, Asi is showing one of the cooking pots she sells.)

loans.use: to buy more goods for resale.

loans.name: Johnelyn

texts.en:
Johnelyn D. is from the village of Bolinao. She is 32 years old, married and has 2 school-aged children. Johnelyn owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. Johnelyn has been engaged in her business for over 9 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2008, Johnelyn joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Johnelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from ASKI, which was used to purchase additional products to sell. Johnelyn is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand product offering. This will be the 6th loan taken out by Johnelyn from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children's tuition fees.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Alansan

texts.en:
This is 45-year-old Alansan from Kissy, Sierra Leone. He is married with one child who is four years old. Alansan’s child attends school. He also takes care of three relatives.

Alansan runs a food commodities store. He sells rice, sugar, oil, and flour. He has been running this business for seven years. Alansan has requested a loan in order to purchase more food commodities. The extra income from this loan will allow him to expand his business and improve his standard of living. In the future, he plans to open another branch shop.

loans.use: To purchase more rice, sugar, oil, and flour.

loans.name: Mukono Women's Crafts Enterprise Group

texts.en:
Thirty-seven-year-old Faith N., a widow with five kids, says her decade-long tenure in her grocery store business in Butebe-Mukono is what she has been banking on to provide for herself and her family since the completion of her university education. 

Before she embarked on this business, she was teaching in many primary schools in and around the Mukono Town area. Faith still teaches and she also has a crafts-sales business that she also runs. 

Hard work, she says, has been her recourse in trying times. Faith, who is affiliated with the Mukono Women's Crafts Enterprise group, says this business generates her 200,000 shillings monthly as profit. With this loan, Faith says she is going to pay for the expansion of her grocery store.

loans.use: to expand her grocery-store business by buying more sugar, cooking oil, vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Joygie

texts.en:
Joygie is 45 years old, married and has seven children, three of whom are in school. 

Joygie is in the agricultural business of raising pigs in the Philippines. Joygie has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Joygie has been raising pigs for five years now, and has borrowed 15 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Joygie would like to save enough money so she could continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Tekopora Group

texts.es:
Este comité está integrado por 15 mujeres, con diversas actividades, algunas realizan bordados en ao po'i, camisas, manteles, chombas, otras se dedican a elaborar comidas rápidas como empanadas, sandwiches, milanesas y los venden en su comunidad.
La Sra. Maria como la presidenta, está comprometida con sus compañeras porque cree que solo si trabajan en grupo van a poder salir adelante.
Para conocer mejor a una D. las integrantes nombramos a la Sra. Avelina, ella se dedica a las tareas manuales y busca mejorar y aumentar su negocio y venta por lo que solicita el crédito, ya que con él podrá adquirir los materiales necesarios como telas, hilos, agujas, para bordar sobre los mismos.
texts.en:
This committee is composed of 15 women who have different occupations.  Some do ao po’i (traditional embroidery) on shirts, tablecloths, jackets; others make fast food like turnovers, sandwiches, breaded steaks to sell in the community.

María is the President.  She’s a vendor.  She is committed to her fellow members because she believes that only by working as a team will they get ahead.

Avelina makes crafts and is looking to improve and enlarge her business and sales so is asking for the loan to acquire supplies she needs like fabric, thread and needles to embroider with.

loans.use: to buy crafts supplies like fabric, thread and needles.

loans.name: Chhunny

texts.en:
Chhunny (pictured with her loom) is 26 years old. Her husband, Sam, is 29 years old. They live on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. They have been married since 2006 and have two young sons.  

Chhunny is a weaver, while her husband is a construction worker and assists his wife with weaving when he is free. Chhunny is requesting a loan of $300 to purchase weaving materials for her weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase weaving materials for her weaving business.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 50 years old and married with three children. To earn a living, he operates a taxi business. He has been in the business for eleven years. John also practices mixed farming to generate more income. He says that since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to improve how he manages his business thanks to management trainings conducted by Faulu Kenya.  

John is requesting a loan of 30,000 KES to repair his vehicle. In the future, he hopes to have his own company.

loans.use: to repair his vehicle

loans.name: Dilshod

texts.ru: Дилшод житель района Восеъ. Возраст, 31 год. Женат. У него трое детей. Он имеет высшее образование. Дилшод преподаватель урока физкультуры. На сегодняшний день он занимается растениеводством. Арендует участок земли, где сеет пшеницу и выращивает овощи для продажи. Этим видом деятельности занимается более 8 лет. Кредит берет для закупа минеральных удобрений.
texts.en: Dilshod lives in the Vose region. He is 31 years old. He is married and has three children. He has higher education. Dilshod is a teacher of physical education. At this time he does crop growing. He rents out a plot of land where he sows wheat and grows vegetables for sale. He has been in this business for more than eight years. He is taking out the loan to buy mineral fertilizer.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizer

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John, age 33, is married to Beatrice who does farming, and they are blessed with one child, age three. He operates a motorcycle transport business that has been in operation for two years. The business earns him a monthly income of about 22,500 KES (~$253).

This is his first loan from KADET LTD. He will use the loan funds to service his motorbikes. John intends to buy another motorbike from the anticipated profits and hopes to own a fleet of commercial vehicles in future.

loans.use: To service his motorbikes.

loans.name: Neri

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VILCANOTA”; este banco comunal pertenece al Distrito de Urubamba, provincia de Urubamba y Departamento de Cusco.

La socia  Neri;  tiene 47 años de edad  y es conviviente la socia tiene 4 hijos;  La socia trabaja en el área administrativa en Chinchero, ella es empleada del ministerio público, la socia paralelamente a esto en sus ratos libres y con el apoyo de sus familia atiende su restaurante  “Pintacha”, la socia también se dedica a apoyar a sus conyugue en la carpintería, ella los fines de semana y cuando puede ve los acabados, los pedidos y los cobros de la carpintería que su conyugue administra y trabaja. La socia en esta ocasión desea invertir el préstamo en la compra de  menajería para el restaurante y la compra de platos, cubiertos que siempre se requiere sustituir y aumentar, también los ingredientes y comprar aceite por bidones, papa, arroz, entre lo que más sale y con otra parte pagar la compra de madera. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de madera y en la compra de menajería y de víveres para el restaurante. 

La socia agradece y valora el préstamo que se le otorgara para poder mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Neri, 47, is a member of the “Vilcanota” communal bank which belongs to Urubamba District in Urubamba Province and Cusco Department.

She has a spouse and four children.  She works in the administrative department of the public prosecutor’s office in Chinchero.  In her free time and with help from her family she runs her restaurant “Pintacha.”  She also helps out her spouse with the carpentry: on weekends and when she can she checks over the finishings, orders and payments at the carpentry shop her spouse runs and works.

On this occasion she wants to use the loan to buy kitchenware for the restaurant, to buy dishes and cutlery that always need to be replaced and increased.  She will also buy ingredients and large containers of oil, rice and potatoes among the items that are used the most.  She will use another part of it to buy lumber.  She is asking for the loan to buy lumber, kitchenware and foodstuffs for the restaurant.

She is grateful for and values the loan that will be granted to improve her and her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy lumber, kitchenware and foodstuffs for the restaurant.

loans.name: Zulfiya

texts.ru:
Зулфия умная и честная женщина.  Она замужем и любящая мать 3 детей. Зулфия занимается выращиванием сельскохозяйственных культур, такие как картошка, морковь, и фрукты. Кроме этого занимается скотоводством. Зулфия хочет, чтобы её дети выросли в хороших условиях семьи и стали образованными и культурными людьми. Зулфия хотела бы получит кредит в размере 2000$ США для покупки крупного рогатого скота, которое позволяет ей расширить свой бизнес и получить желаемой прибыли. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj
texts.en: Zulfiya is an intelligent and honest woman. She is married and a loving mother to three children. Zulfiya grows crops such as potatoes, carrots, and fruit. In addition, she works in animal husbandry. Zulfiya wants her children to grow up in a good family situation and to become educated and cultured people. Zulfiya would like to receive a loan for $2,000 to buy cattle, which would allow her to expand her business and make a profit.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Junifen

texts.en:
Junifen is a hard-working father who owns and operates a rice farming business in the village. He is now 50 years old and has two adult-age children. He has cultivated their rice fields for almost 38 years, earning a net profit of only 25,000 PHP per cropping. He aims to increase his productions and income to support all his family's needs and renovate their house to live more comfortably. 

But due to financial difficulty, Junifen is asking for a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy fertilizers and pesticides to sustain their rice production. He hopes that this coming harvest season he can increase his production and he believes that his efforts and sacrifices will make it possible to gain success in the future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides to sustain rice production

loans.name: Pariken

texts.en:
Pariken is 38 years old and married to Helen. They have two children. He has been a farmer for the past nine years. His monthly income is 5,000 KES. Farmers are doing well in his area due to favorable conditions.

He learned about KADET LTD through advertising done by KADET. He has applied for his third loan from KADET, which he plans to use to buy farm supplies. 

He plans to invest the proceeds from the loan back into the farm. He is an honest man who will achieve if supported financially.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies

loans.name: Andrew

texts.en:
Andrew has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last seven years.  He is 36 years old, married to Cecilia, and they have three school-going children.  

He was introduced to KADET LTD  by one of our field officers and this will be his third loan.  He repaid both his previous loans well and in good time.  He plans to use the loan amount to buy a dairy cow.

In future, Andrew hopes to become one of the leading farmers in Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Arthur

texts.en:
Arthur is married and has two children who attend school.  He is from the village of San Juan, Alicia, Isabela. He has been selling ice drops in the village where they are living with his family. He earns about 200 PHP a day.

Arthur is requesting a loan for 5,000 PHP, which he will use to purchase ice drops to sell. In the future, he would like to have his own ice drops stall, so he can continue to send his children to school and to provide his family with an improved standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase ice drops to sell

loans.name: Jumaa

texts.en:
Jumaa is a married man with four school going children. He has a house with electricity but not piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food for his family and school fees for his children. 

Jumaa has operated a barber shop for the past ten years; in addition he also practices small scale farming. His potential clients are local community members and he faces a major challenge of low income due to low service charges. He dreams of expanding his business.

With the Kshs 20,000 he wants to purchase a new hair shaving machine for his business. He decided to join Yehu because Yehu understands its’ clients needs.

loans.use: To purchase a new hair shaving machine for his business.

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es: Miguel, tiene la edad  de 67 años, está casado y vive con su esposa que es su mayor prioridad. El con el crédito pretende comprar pollos para el engorde y compra de los insumos para el crecimiento adecuado de ellos. El tiene la experiencia necesaria para retomar de nuevo el proyecto y generar ganancias para su bienestar. El tiene como meta aumentar las ganancias para el bienestar de su familia y mejorar cada día su nivel económico.   Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Miguel is 67 years old, married, and lives with his wife who is his main priority.  He plans to use his loan to buy chickens to fatten and also supplies to help them grow adequately.  Miguel has the experience he needs to restart this project and make profits for his well-being.  His goal is to increase his profits for the well-being of his family and to improve his financial situation.

This is the first loan that Miguel has received from FUDECOSUR.  He hasn't received previous loans from state banks but FUDECOSUR have offered him this loan with better terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy chickens to fatten

location.town: Bello Oriente, Agua Buena, Coto Brus

loans.name: Vicente

texts.en: Vicente is a 50-year old married man with three children who lives in the Philippines. He owns and operates farm land, planting crops to earn a living. He's been in this business for 10 years and earns 4,500 PHP per month. He is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer such as manure. Vicente has been a member of GDMPC for almost a year. In the future, he wants to build a house and finish educating his children.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure for his crops.

location.town: Campo 5, Ramon Magsaysay, Zamboanga Del Sur

loans.name: Ana Leticia

texts.es:
Leticia tiene cuarenta y cuatro años, es casada tiene dos hijos.Vive con su esposo y uno de sus hijos.
Ella tiene cinco años de operar su bazar ,el cual está ubicado su casa.En el bazar Leticia vende ropa que ella confecciona, cosméticos, bisutería y otros artículos para el hogar.

Todos los días, desde de las 7 de la mañana hasta las 11, ella cose y hace reparaciones a prendas de vestir. Y al mismo tiempo atiende a los clientes del bazar.Por las tardes atiende el bazar y algunos días viaja a una ciudad cercana a comprar mercadería y materiales.

Leticia ha solicitado un préstamo a Fundación Mujer, para comprar una máquina de coser plana, materia prima para producir prendas y mercadería (bisutería, bolsos, cosmésticos y artículos para el hogar).
Dada la temporada navideña ella identificó la posibilidad de incrementar sus ventas. Con la ayuda del préstamo ,Leticia podrá aprovechar el incremento en la demanda durante dicha época.

En un futuro Leticia sueña con trasaladar su negocio al centro de la ciudad, con mayor número de clientes,que permitirán mayor estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Leticia, 44, is married and has two children; she lives with her husband and one of her children.  She has been running her store for five years; it’s home-based.  Leticia sells clothes that she makes herself in her store and also cosmetics, costume jewelry and other items for the home.

Every day from 7 in the morning until 11 she sews and does clothing repairs.  At the same time she takes care of store customers.  In the afternoon she tends to the store and on some days travels to a nearby city to buy merchandise and materials.

Leticia has asked Fundación Mujer for a loan to buy a sewing machine and raw materials to make clothes and merchandise (costume jewelry, purses, cosmetics and items for the home).  She identifies the Christmas season as a time of possibly increasing sales.  With help from the loan Leticia will be able to take advantage of increased demand during this season.  In the future, Leticia dreams with moving her business to the center of the city where there are more customers that will allow for greater economic stability.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine, fabric, thread and costume jewelry to sell in her store.

loans.name: Faustina

texts.es: Faustina, de 49 años de edad, está casada con Augusto de 50 años y tienen 02 hijos, John de 19 años y Gilbert de 12.
