Han renovado la mesa directiva y para este ciclo tiene como presidenta a la señora  Nelly, como tesorera silverio y como secretaria de actas a la señora Nelly los negocios de las señoras son diferentes, entre ellos tenemos: macramé de mantas, comercio de aretes, abrir un comedor, artesanía en mantas, artesanía de tejidos y tienda de barrio.
La señora secretaria de actas comenta que está un año trabajando en Pro Mujer, conoció los servicios de Pro Mujer a través de las promotoras.  El negocio de la señora secretaria es la venta de aretes,  desde hace doce años ella aprendió a llevar adelante este negocio con su esposo.   Actualmente, recibe ayuda de su hermano y un ayudante para realizar la venta, pues su estrategia es llevar sus productos al interior del país, a los departamentos de Oruro y Cochabamba.
Lo que más le gusta de Pro Mujer es que “les enseña  a ser más responsables.”
texts.en:
The Nueva Asuncion community bank is starting their third loan cycle in the Panamericana center. This community bank has eight members. They have changed the board of directors for this loan cycle and have Nelly as president, Silverio as treasurer, and [another] Nelly as secretary. The women have different businesses which include: macrame blankets, an earing business, a food business, artisan blanket sales, artisan knitting and a neighborhood store. 

The secretary tells us that she has worked with Pro Mujer for a year and learned of Pro Mujer's services through advertising. The secretary's current business is selling earings which she learned twelve years ago from her husband. Currently she gets help from her brother and an assistant as salespeople. Her goal is to sell the goods in the interior of the country in the Oruro and Cochabamba departments. What she likes most about Pro Mujer is that "it teaches us to be more responsible."

loans.use: Purchase earings

loans.name: Koey

texts.en:
The woman in the photo is Koey O., age 37, who lives in the province of Kompong Tom in Cambodia, where she earns her living raising pigs. She has run this business and it has provided her with income to attain her standard of living. She is married with three children who are public school. She has a life partner in her husband who earns an income by selling firewood in his community. Besides his job, her husband often helps her in raising pigs.
 
Presently, she and her husband are building a new house to live in but her savings are insufficient for this project. So Koey O. is seeking a loan from Kiva to use to build her new house so she can have a new house soon to live in.

loans.use: To build her new house

loans.name: Carlos Ramos Enrique

texts.es:
Carlos es un joven empresario de 24 años de edad, reside junto a sus padres en el distrito de Ferreñafe, una zona de regular movimiento comercial que se encuentra ubicada a veinte minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

El cuenta con dos mototaxis (vehículo motorizado que consiste en una motocicleta que lleva anexada una cabina para realizar actividades de transporte de carga y pasajeros), usualmente se encarga de manejar una mientras que alquila la otra. El suele brindar su servicio en su localidad y en los centros poblados que conforman la periferia del distrito. La actividad le permite solventar sus gastos personales y apoyar a su familia con el sostenimiento de su economía diaria.

Carlos desea brindar mantenimiento a sus mototaxis, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles que le permitan brindar mantenimiento a su sistema mecánico, asimismo planea adquirir algunos repuestos para equiparlas y brindar una mejor atención a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Carlos is a young entrepreneur of 24 years. He resides with his parents in the Ferrenafe district, an area of regular commercial activity that is located 20 minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

He has two mototaxis (a motorized vehicle that consists of a motorcucle that has a cabin attached so he can transport cargo and passengers). Usually, he is in charge of driving one while he rents out the other. He usually provides his service in his area and in the populated centers that are on the periphery of the district. The activity allows him to pay his personal bills and support his family with daily economic support.

Carlos wishes to provide maintenance for his mototaxis. For this, he has seen fit to request from Edpyme Alternativa a loan of 2,000 new "soles" which will allow him to provide maintenance to the mechanical system. Additionally, he plans to acquire some spare parts to equip them and provide better service to his customers.

loans.use: Expenses for repairing and maintaining his mototaxi.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy building supplies such as: sand, cement, gravel, sheets of corrugated metal, etc.  To tile his living room and to build his roof.

loans.name: Lynie

texts.en: Lynie E. is 47 years old makes a living by planting vegetables and selling her produce to people in her community. Her husband works as a farmer and a carpenter. Thye both work hard because they have a strong commitment to provide for their seven children, five girls and two buys.  She is applying for this loan for 7,000 PHP to buy additional fertilizer and seeds, and believes that this loan will help her improve her harvest and with it, her income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds for a small farm

loans.name: Widow And Needy Group-Jinja

texts.en: K. David, 36, operates a bricklaying and sales business in Mpumudde-Jinja. It is a business this happy-go-lucky and married father of three says he began going by the dictates of his heart. He also has a taxi business which he says is pivotal in his profit maximization efforts. His clientele base cuts across but it is mostly school builders and businesspeople who are regular clients. Weekly, this business generates him shillings 80,000 and he says with this loan, he is going to pay more laborers who he is going to recruit to work at his bricklaying site. David belongs to Widow and Needy group-Jinja.

loans.use: The salaries of the laborers he is going to hire to work at his bricklaying site

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
Juanita R. is from the village of Gusa, Calatunan. She is 60 years old and married, with 4 children. To make a living, Juanita sells baked goods and ice candy. Juanita has been engaged in her business for more than 30 years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Juanita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Juanita is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to add her capital. This loan will be the sixth loan Juanita has taken out from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy additional products to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase additional bags of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Batsaihan

texts.en:
Batsaihan, 35, is married and lives with his wife and three children in the Arhangai province of Mongolia. His wife works as a salesperson and all of his three children attend a local secondary school. The family has a decent standard of living.

Batsaihan began operating a retail business selling meat and animal rawhide in 2006. He purchases meat and animal rawhide from local individuals and sells them in Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. He is a hardworking and modest person who says, "I am trying to expand my business and save money for my children's future studies." He is requesting a loan of 2,000,000 MNT to purchase cashmere and animal rawhide for his business.

loans.use: to purchase cashmere and animal rawhide

loans.name: Cynthia

texts.en:
Cynthia I. is from the village of Dalirig, Manolo Fortich, Bukidnon. She is 49 years old. Cynthia is widowed and has 3 adult children. To make a living, Cynthia owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling canned goods, snack foods, beverages, shampoo, soap & biscuits in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2010, Cynthia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory & fund working capital for her business. 

Cynthia is requesting a new loan of 11000 PHP to restock her inventory with products such as detergents & instant noodles. This will be her 3rd loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to further improve and expand it.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase products like detergents & instant noodles to sell

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary A. is 32 years old. She is married to a house builder and they have three children, two of whom are in school. 

Currently, Mary is in the business of selling breads. She will use her loan to stock more breads.

Her future goal is to pay for her children's school fees.

loans.use: to stock more breads.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou, 29, is married with four children, two of whom are in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.  

She has a upholstery business in the Philippines. Marilou requested a 13,000 Philippine peso (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy raw materials for her business. 

Marilou has been in this business for four years. In the future, Marilou would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials for her business

loans.name: Raquel

texts.es: Raquel, de 34 años, es una mujer muy amable y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Agapito de 29 años y sus 3 queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. Vendiendo zapatos, Raquel a sabido progresar en su vida, los novedosos modelos que vende, la han convertido en una vendedora muy solicitada entre las vecinas del Asentamiento Humano Pachacutec, sus clientes siempre se van muy contentos y satisfechos, además que reciben una buena atención. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus vecinas y enterarse de las cosas que suceden en su barrio, lleva 2 años en este negocio y considera que lo más difícil es tener que caminar todos los días en busca de clientes. En el futuro le gustaría tener una tienda donde pueda vender una mayor cantidad de zapatos. Este es el tercer crédito con MFP, ella no tiene dudas en poder pagar puntualmente sus cuotas, ya que confía mucho en su negocio. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más zapatos, para así poder incrementar la cantidad que vende normalmente.
texts.en:
Raquel, 34, is a very gracious, hard working woman.  She lives in her own house with her husband, Agapito, 29, and their three beloved children for whom she wants to provide a better quality of life.  Selling shoes Raquel has known how to make progress in life.  The up-to-date models she sells have turned her into a very sought after seller among the neighbors in Pachacutec.  Her customers always leave happy and satisfied having received, in addition, good service.

What she enjoys the most about her work is chatting with her customers and learning about everything that’s going on in her neighborhood.  She’s been in business for two years and considers the most difficult part having to walk every day in search of customers.  In the future she’d like to have a store where she can sell larger amounts of shoes.

This is her 3rd loan with MFP.  She has no doubt that she will repay her loan installments on time because she has a lot of faith in her business.  She will use the requested 1000 new soles to buy more shoes to increase the amount she usually sells.

loans.use: to stock up on more shoes.

loans.name: Salvacion

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Salvacion works hard to support her family. She has a food stall (pork barbecue and eatery) business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from her general store. Salvacion is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase different ingredients for her food stall.

Salvacion has been sustaining her business activities through her past 16 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase different ingredients for her business.

loans.name: Lan

texts.en:
Lan is a 42 year-old married woman with two children who lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. For the past four years, Lan and her husband have earned money by making soya bean cakes. 

Lan is requesting a loan to buy more soya beans to increase production and enabL. her to earn more money to provide for her family's expenses. Lan hopes that in the future she can save more money to improve her family's living conditions and reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to buy soya beans and produce soya cakes

loans.name: Madeline

texts.en:
Madeline is 31 years old and married with two children who are in school.

For the past three years Madeline has had a vegetable vending business in the Philippines. Madeline has requested an 11,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks of fruits and vegetables to sell.

Madeline is a very hardworking entrepreneur. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Araksi

texts.en: Please meet Araksi. She and her family live in a remote village outside Talin, Armenia. Araksi and her husband have five children and several grandchildren. Araksi’s husband is a wounded war veteran, and Araksi refers to him as a real hero. Together they raise animals, grow fruits and grass—just enough to keep the cattle and the family fed. Since the Soviet Union disintegrated, income amongst rural Armenian farmers has become unpredictable. In addition, Araksi noted that the weather has been particularly bad for Armenian farmers this year. Hail, strong winds and rain have ruined much of the fruit crop, the house and the barn ceiling. Nonetheless, Araksi wants to be positive. Araksi has applied for a loan to buy a reaper (grass-cutting machine). The grass-cutting machine will make it easier to raise cattle and pigs at her age, as these animals eat grass. The ability to take care of more livestock should increase this family’s monthly income.

loans.use: to pay for a grass-cutting machine

loans.name: Nay Ruth

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VILCANOTA”; este banco comunal pertenece al Distrito de Urubamba, provincia de Urubamba y Departamento de Cusco.

La socia Nay Ruth;  tiene 30 años de edad  y es conviviente la socia tiene 1 hija de 2 años de edad;   La socia trabaja en la Ugel de Urubamba ella trabaja en la parte administrativa, la socia paralelamente a sus trabajo y según a su disponibilidad de tiempo siempre está tratando la forma de ver una actividad extra la socia desea comprar 15 frazadas para venderlas gradualmente a sus compañeras y amistades, la socia con esto adquirirá un dinero extra para los gastos que genera la casa y todo en cuanto al bienestar de la familia, la socia también apoya a su conyugue con la implementación de sus cabina internet, ella es una mujer muy trabajadora y desea a futuro poner un establecimiento propio y poder administrarlo, La socia desea invertir el préstamo en la compra de 15 frazadas las mismas que serán vendidas a sus amistades y compañeros de trabajo. A la socia le traerán las frazadas y ella comprara todas en un solo pago para ir vendiéndolas de a pocos. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de 15 frazadas de lanas que son las únicas que se compran en las comunidades y generalmente en Cusco.

La socia agradece y valora el préstamo que se le otorgara para poder mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the "Vilcanota" communal bank. This communal bank belongs to the Urubamba District, Urubamba privince, in the Department of Cusco.

The member is Nay Ruth. She is 30, lives with her partner, and has one 2-year-old daughter. She works in Ugel de Urubamba in administration. On top of her job, and according to her availability, she is always looking for extra work. She wants to buy 15 blankets to gradually sell to her friends and colleagues. In doing this, she will acquire extra money for her household costs and her family's well-being. She also supports her partner in his internet booth. She is a hard-working woman and wants to establish and run her own business in the future. She wants to invest this loan in the purchase of 15 blankets to sell to her friends and colleagues. The blankets will be delivered to her and she will buy them all with one payment to be sold bit by bit. She is requesting this loan to invest in the purchase of 15 wool blankets. These are the only kinds that are bought in the community and in Cusco, generally. She is grateful for and values this loan that we are authorizing. It will allow her to be able to improve her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: to invest in 15 wool blankets which are the only kind bought in the local communities, and, generally, in Cusco.

loans.name: Abdoulaye

texts.fr:
Monsieur Abdoulaye est un homme marié de 29 et père de 2 enfants. Il réside avec sa femme et ses enfants dans une famille traditionnelle élargie à Hérémakono Nord, un des quartiers de la ville de Bougouni (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Monsieur Abdoulaye est un enseignant  qui en plus de cette fonction, excelle dans les activités génératrices de revenus. Depuis maintenant plus de 6 ans, il fait de l’achat et de la vente des céréales. Il appris cette activité auprès d’un de ses amis enseignants. 
Afin  d’augmenter sa capacité financière, il décide de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et est à sa première expérience avec l’institution.
 Il compte utiliser ce premier prêt pour acheter, 1 tonne de maïs, 1 tonne de petit mil et 10 sacs de riz.
Il s’approvisionne à Bougouni et dans les villages  environnants auprès des paysans producteurs.  Il effectue sa vente au grand marché de Bougouni et une partie est vendue à la maison, à une clientèle composée de revendeurs et de consommateurs.
Avec ce prêt il envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 75.000FCFA, qui servira à rembourser le prêt et subvenir aux besoins de la famille.
texts.en:
Abdoulaye is a 29-year old married man, who is father to two children. He lives with his wife and children in an extended traditional family in Hérémakono Nord, a district of the town of Bougouni (the Republic of Mali's third administrative region).

Abdoulaye is a teacher, who as well as having a teaching job, excels in other income generating activities. For more than six years he has been buying and selling cereals and he learnt this business from one of his teaching colleagues.

In order to boost his financial capacity he decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso and is on his first loan from the institution. He is planning to use this first loan to buy a ton of corn, a ton of pearl millet and ten sacks of rice. He gets his supplies in Bougouni and in the surrounding villages from the peasants that are are growing the cereals. He sells his produce at the large market in Bougouni and part of it is sold at his home to a customer base made up of retailers and consumers. 

With this loan he is expecting to make a monthly profit of 75,000FCFA, which will be used to repay his loan and provide for his family's needs.

loans.use: to buy cereals

loans.name: Safari

texts.en:
Safari is 35 years old and the married father of three children. He has owned a tailoring shop in Kilifi for two years. The business is doing well.

Safari has been a KADET client and this marks his third loan to finance his business. He plans to use this loan to purchase more thread, needles, scissors and cloth materials for his business. Safari will use the anticipated profits to repay the loan, for his upkeep and for the expansion of his business. His dream is to excel in business.

loans.use: to purchase more thread, needles, scissors and cloth materials

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe BENKADI est composé de 4 femmes mariées, ayant une moyenne d’âge de 43 ans et 6 enfants. Elles vivent dans des familles traditionnelles. Ces femmes résident dans le quartier FARABA de la ville de  BOUGOUNI, (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali). 
Elles se sont connues par des liens de leurs activités. 
Dans le souci de satisfaire leurs clientèles et augmenter le niveau de leur activité, elles ont décidé d’intégrer l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso et cela  pour faire le commerce de boissons non alcoolisées et de chaussures à l’image de MAIMOUNA, qui est la première à droite, enfant au pied.
Elles sont à leur troisième prêt de groupe et les prêts précédents ont été remboursés correctement. 
Avec ce nouveau prêt MAIMOUNA., compte acheter, de 15 douzaines  de paires de chaussures, auprès des commerçants venant de Bamako. Elle revend  dans son kiosque sis au quartier FARABA de Bougouni, en détail, au comptant à une clientèle diverse et variée.
Avec ce prêt elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 40.000 FCFA  dont une partie sera utilisée pour rembourser le prêt et le reste sera  réinvesti dans l’entreprise.
texts.en:
Group Benkadi is composed of four married women, who are on average 43 years old with six children. They live in traditional families. These women reside in the Faraba neighborhood of the city of Bougouni (Mali's third administrative region). They got to know each other through business relations.
In order to satisfy their customers and to grow their business, they decided to join micro-finance organization Soro Yiriwaso to retail soft drinks and shoes; so does Maimouna, who is the women to the right with a child by her feet. They are on their third group loan, the previous loans having been repaid punctually.
With this new loan, Maimouna is planning on purchasing 15 dozen pairs of shoes from sellers coming from Bamako. She retails cash to a diverse clientele in her kiosk located in the Faraba neighborhood of Bougouni.
With this loan, she is counting on a monthly profit of 40,000 FCFA, part of which will be reused to pay back her loan, with the remainder to be reinvested in the business.

loans.use: to buy shoes.

loans.name: Barbara's Group

texts.en:
Barbara's group is comprised of four hard-working women. Barbara is 20 years old and lives in the town of Natete in the Kampala North region of Uganda. For the past two years, she has been working hard to manage her food stall, which sells snacks and other kinds of food. 

To help expand her business, Barbara has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more food for resale and will help Barbara generate greater profits and pay school fees for her brother. Barbara hopes that in the future she will be able to open her own hair salon. 

Barbara is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has increased Barbara's future prospects by helping her to invest in her family's education.

loans.use: to purchase more food for resale,

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa is 57 years old and happily married to a farmer and barangay (a village, district, or ward) official. The couple is thankful because they are able to manage their own businesses. 

Rosa runs her retail store while her husband is engaged in hog raising and rice farming businesses. Rosa has been operating her store for almost 21 years. With her patience in managing and dealing with her customers she is able to improve her store. 

Rosa aims to buy more groceries such as soft drinks, biscuits, canned goods, cooking oil, sugar, coffee and instant noodles needed in her retail business. To make her aims come true she is asking for financial assistance in the amount of 10,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP). Through this loan she can meet all the demands of her customers. 

She believes that she can improve her retail store so that she can save some money for her security when she gets older.

loans.use: to buy groceries such as soft drinks, biscuits, canned goods, cooking oil, sugar, coffee and instant noodles

loans.name: Tampouy Paligwende Group

texts.fr:
Mme Fatimata est la représentante du groupe TAMPOUY PALIGWENDE. Elle est mariée et mère de 05 enfants. Le plus âgé a 17ans et le moins âgé a 5mois. Quatre(04) de ses enfants vont à l’école. Elle a 05 personnes en charge.

Elle vend du poisson frais et des pagnes depuis 16ans.Elle a juste presenté les pagnes sur la photo mais elle veut acheter du poisson frais avec l'argent. Elle s’approvisionne au marché du secteur 08 en ville. Ses clients sont les femmes, hommes.

Elle veut s’acheter 03 cartons de poisson frais.

Mme économise pour agrandir son commerce. Elle ambitionne s’acheter un réfrigérateur pour conserver le poisson et aider son mari à payer la scolarité de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Mrs. Fatimata is the representative for the Tampouy Paligwende group. She is married and the mother of five children. The oldest is 17 years old and the youngest only 5 months. Four of her children go to school. She has five people under her care.

She has sold fresh fish and pagnes (colorful West-African fabric) for the past 16 years. She is displaying the pagnes in the picture but she wants to buy fresh fish with the loan. She gets her supplies from the sector 8 market in town. Her customers are both women and men. She wants to buy three boxes of fresh fish.

Mrs. Fatimata is saving to expand her business. She aims to buy a refrigerator to store fish and help her husband pay tuition fees for her children.

loans.use: buy three cartons of fresh fish

loans.name: Sa'ed

texts.en: Sa'ed is a young man who is 31 years old. He is a university student in addition to his work on a cattle farm with a decent salary. Sa'ed wants to pay his university fees so he can complete the course and get his first university degree, but the amount of money he has isn't enough to pay, so he needs to take a loan in the amount of $1,000 from FATEN. When Sa'ed gets the loan, which is repaid on a monthly basis, he will be able to pay his university fees and complete his course. When he gets his first university degree successfully, it will change his life positively and let him live in better conditions. Sa'ed is photographed in the FATEN branch.

loans.use: To pay university fees.

loans.name: Ainakan's Group

texts.en:
Ainakan is the leader of this group. She is 54 and unfortunately, she is a widow. She has raised a son and two daughters. Ainakan works in an Agency of Migration. Her monthly salary is 1,200 soms. In order to earn additional money, she breeds livestock and resells it after fattening. Ten years ago with an initial investment of 10,000 soms, she purchased four goats for breeding. Reselling livestock after fattening and selling the dairy products, Ainakan earns an additional 4,500 soms to meet her daily needs. With money received from the loan, she wants to purchase more livestock for breeding, fattening and further reselling. In the future, she hopes to leave a good inheritance to her children.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Luz Estela

texts.es:
La socia es la Sra: Estela; La socia tiene 62 años de edad, es casada, y tiene 5 hijos, la socia es profesora cesante,ahora que se acerca la navidad,la socia se dedica al negocio de venta de panetones y tambien vende productos de belleza como cremas,perfumes y lapiz labiales. La socia solicita el credito para comprar panetones al por mayor y tambien para comprar productos de belleza como perfumes,cremas y lapiz labiales.

La socia se encuentra satisfecha con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en: Estela, 62, is married and has five children.  She is a retired teacher.  Now that Christmas is approaching she sells panettones [traditional Christmas cake] and also sells beauty products like creams, perfume and lipstick.  She requests the loan to buy panettones at wholesale and also to buy beauty products like perfume, creams and lipstick.  She is satisfied with the granted loan and commits to make her payments according to the established payment schedule.

loans.use: to buy panettones at wholesale and also to buy beauty products.

loans.name: Angela Beatriz

texts.es:
Angela Beatriz tiene 30 años de edad es soltera tiene dos hijos, vive con la cuñada, hermanos  y con los hijos de 8 y 5 años de edad en el Cantón Ventanas provincia de los ríos.

La VRC ALAS DE CRISTO  se encuentra ubicada en las calles sucre y Ernesto Briones, pertenece al Cantón Ventanas se dedican a labores Comerciales en General.

Angela se dedica a vender ropa hace 1 año las compras y las ventas lo realiza en Guayaquil.

Solicita el crédito para poder comprar mercaderia y ofrecer mejores trajes a los clientes. Con la ayuda del crédito logrará obtener beneficios económicos.
No se le ha presentado ningún tipo de problema.

En los tiempos libres le gusta pasar con los hijos.
texts.en:
Angela Beatriz is 30 years old, is single, and has two children.  She lives in the Cantón Ventanas province of the rivers with her sister-in-law, siblings, and her two children who are 8 and 5 years old.

The VRC ALAS DE CRISTO [Wings of Christ] is located on the streets of Sucre and Ernesto Briones.  It belongs to the Cantón Ventanas which is dedicated to the general commercial labor.

Angela has been selling clothing for a year.  She buys them and sells them in Guayaquil.

She is asking for the loan to buy merchandise and to offer better suits to her customers.  With the help of the loan, she will be able to obtain economic benefits.  She has not presented any sort of problem.

In her free time she likes to spend time with her children.

loans.use: to buy merchandise and to offer her customers better suits.

loans.name: Thomas

texts.en:
Thomas is a 27-year-old motorbike (boda boda) operator in Tuskys, Kilifi. He is a married father of four children and has been in this business for the past eight months and is doing great. 

He was introduced to KADET LTD and this marks his first loan to expand his business. Thomas plans to buy another motorbike to increase his operations in the boda boda business and use the anticipated profits to boost his spouse in her tailoring business. 

His dream is to broaden his business to help him to educate his children.

loans.use: to buy another motorbike

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy bales of clothes and dozens of shoes to add to her business

loans.name: Clotilde

texts.es:
Clotilde nació en la provincia de Cusco pero vive en el poblado de Rumichaca Baja de la provincia de Urubamba. (La provincia de Urubamba está ubicada al norte de la ciudad del Cusco, a orillas del río Vilcanota, en una zona que se conoce como el “Valle Sagrado” debido a su clima templado, tierra  fértil y abundantes riachuelos, que hacen de este valle uno de los más bellos del planeta.).

Clotilde tiene 50 años edad y es padre y madre para sus cuatro hijos, ella es una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora que saca adelante a su familia, ella se dedica a la venta de refrescos caseros hechos con sus propias manos, ella prepara chicha morada, agua de limonada, agua de tamarindo, chicha blanca, agua de manzana y otros más, ella vende sus productos de forma ambulatoria en diferentes calles de la ciudad de Urubamba. Ya son ocho años que se dedica a la venta de refrescos y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo.  Clotilde en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar insumos para preparar sus refrescos entonces va comprar maíz, morado, manzana, naranja, piña y otras frutas. 

Clotilde es integrante del banco comunal “Nueva Vision de Rumichaca”. Este  grupo está conformado con 19 socios que viven  en la provincia de Urubamba.
texts.en:
Clotilde was born in Cusco Province but lives in the Rumichaca Baja neighborhood of Urubamba Province. (Urubamba Province is located to the north of the city of Cusco, on the shores of the Vilcanota River.  The area is known as “Valle Sagrado” (Sacred Valley) due to its mild climate, fertile land and abundant streams that make this valley one of the most beautiful on the planet.)

Clotilde is 50 years old and is mother and father to her four children.  She is an enterprising and hardworking  woman who is moving her family forward.  She makes her living selling home-made soft drinks that she prepares with her own hands.  Clotilde makes chicha morada (an alcoholic drink made from fermented purple maize) lemon drink, tamarind drink, white chicha, and apple drink, among others.  She sells her products on the streets of Urubamba City.  She has been making her living selling soft drinks for eight years already, and it has been going very well for her thanks to the effort she puts into her work.  At this time, Clotilde needs the loan to purchase soft-drink making supplies such as maize, purple maize, apples, pineapples and other fruits. 

Clotilde is a member of the communal bank "Nueva Vision de Rumichaca” (New Vision of Rumichaca).  The group is made up of 19 members who live in Urubamba Province.

loans.use: to purchase supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase computer accessories for his business.

loans.name: Nhork

texts.en:
Nhork, 45, is married and resides with his wife and three children in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia. He is a construction worker. His wife runs a grocery store at home. Two of his children are employed in Thailand. 

In order to improve his family’s economy, Nhork is requesting a loan of USD 1,000 to purchase rice to resell at the rice mill to generate more income for the family. In the future, he would like to expand his wife’s business and send his youngest child to a good school.

loans.use: to purchase rice to resell at the rice mill.

loans.name: Adjouavi Viviane

texts.fr: Marié à un revendeur du nom de Respice et mère de quatre enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge, Adjouavi Viviane est âgée de 42 ans. Adjouavi Viviane vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Adjouavi Viviane subvient ensemble avec son mari aux divers besoins du ménage. Adjouavi Viviane n'a pas fréquenté l’école. Pour assurer ses diverses charges, Adjouavi Viviane prépare de la nourriture, qu'elle revend depuis une quinzaine d'années. cette  activité lui permet de contribuer aux diverses charges de sa famille. Afin de renforcer son activité, Adjouavi Viviane sollicite une première fois un crédit auprès de ALIDé en vue d’élever le niveau de son activité et de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle.

loans.use: Acheter du maïs, huile végétale et du poisson.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To improve on the training facilities in the Institution.

loans.name: Gunduz

texts.en: Gunduz is an IDP from occupied Agdam district of Azerbaijan. He came to Baku in 1993. Married, has a child. In 2003-2006 he borrowed three Normicro loans from Baku branch. Now he is planning to borrow $600.

loans.use: To buy some raw materials for the business

loans.name: Vii

texts.en: Most people wouldn’t enjoy waking up every single morning to face a day of work in their field.  But that is seventy-one year old Vii’s life, and she loves it.  Although her husband passed away, her ten children remain near her and help her tend the plantation.  Vii is also a breast cancer survivor.  She was diagnosed with the disease in 2003, but today, she remains active and strong.  Shortly after her bout with cancer, Vii joined the SPBD program to gain access to the capital needed to keep reinvesting in her only income source, her taro plantation.  She has used past loan funds to purchase fertilizer, fencing and various tools.  She is seeking additional loan funds for the same purpose.

loans.use: Buy weed killer and fertilizer

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es:
Business Description

Mr. C. began his business with som savings 8 years ago. Before, he worked selling wholesale products in the center of the city, but decided to install a store in his own him. His business has grown and now his store sees many customers. He sells tinned vegetables, meats and other popular products.

Loan Use

He wishes to invest his loan to purchase more merchandise, because it is easier to buy some items on wholesale, to then resell to his customers at a more affordable price. He hopes that by doing this he will be able to attract more customers as his store is located in a central area.

Personal Information

Mr. C. is 32, married and has three children, one of whom goes to a nearby school. His home is made of cement and he has a healthy, stable family life. His goal is to stock his store and to be able to offer more to his customers.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Descripción del Negocio

El Señor C. empezó su negocio hace 8 años producto de un ahorro que antes trabajaba vendiendo productos al por mayor en el centro de la ciudad pues decidió instalar una despensa en su propia casa, su negocio ha aumentado y hoy su tienda es muy visitada por los clientes ya que el vende legumbres embutidos, carnes y demás productos de consumo mayor

Uso del Préstamo

El quiere invertir su préstamo en comprar mas mercadería ya que ciertos productos es conveniente comprar al por mayor para poder luego distribuir a sus clientes a un costo económico pues con este mecanismo el quiere atraer mas clientes ya que su despensa esta ubicado en un lugar céntrico del sector

Información Personal

El señor C. tiene 32 años esta casado y tiene tres hijos uno de ellos estudia en un establecimiento cercano, su vivienda es de cemento y su estabilidad familiar es muy buena, sus metas es tener su local surtido y de esta manera poder tener de todo para los clientes.

loans.use: To invest in more merchandise.

loans.name: Beydulla

texts.en: Beydulla is 57 years old, married and has two children. For the last ten years, he has owned and operated an orchard in Yenikand village in the Salyan region of Azerbaijan. He has requested a loan of $600 to buy pesticides and fertilizer to improve the size and quality of the produce he grows on his orchard.

loans.use: To buy pesticides and fertilizer

loans.name: Sefulu

texts.en: Sefulu is 26 years old and recently married with one child. Sefulu's husband is a teacher in one of the village schools. His salary is not enough to support them, so Sefulu decided to join SPBD. Her parents used to run a shop but they are very old, so Sefulu is taking over.  Having a small shop, Sefulu decided to apply for a loan so she could expand the shop and buy more goods so that her business can progress well.

loans.use: To buy supplies and inventory for her shop

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary has been in the Elmina Market for 8 years now. She sells canned vegetables, noodles, oil, sugar, and various ingredients from a table in the market. She hopes to use the loan to increase her stock and move into an indoor stall for her products. An indoor stall would provide a more secure environment and, more importantly, she would not have to spend her time packing and unpacking all of her products at the end and beginning of each day.

As a single mother, she feels a strong obligation to succeed in her business for her children. Her youngest son is in junior high school, and her two other children are in senior high school. All three children hope to attend university if Mary can financially support them. It is Mary's strongest desire to see all her three children through university as a single mother.

Mary is a member of the lending group, Nyame Beba of Elmina.

loans.use: She hopes to use the loan to get an indoor stall which is more secure and increase her stock of goods to sell for more profits.

loans.name: Try

texts.en:
Mrs. Try P., 35, runs a stand selling fried banana cakes to the people in her community and typically earns around US$ 4 each day in revenue. Her husband works as a taxi driver, earning on average US$ 3.50 each day. She has one school-age child living with her.

Due to the huge demand from her clients who want her to sell some kinds of soft drinks or sugar cane juice, Mrs. Try P. has recently requested a loan to help her purchase a machine to produce fresh sugar cane juice, which will better satisfy her customers and raise her family's standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase a machine to produce fresh sugar cane juice

loans.name: Janne

texts.es:
Mrs. Janne belongs to the Mariscal Cáceres communal bank. She lives in the region San Martin, in the province of Mariscal Cáceres, in the district of Juanjui. She works selling food items, such as, eggs, breads and vegetables. Her business is located in the lower part of Jr. Huallaga N. 1620- Juanjuicillo.

With a loan of 3,000 Peruvian Soles, which she will pay back in 6 months, she will be able to buy groceries, like sugar and rice in large quantities, milk in boxes, detergent in packets, oil and noodles in packets, powdered milk in boxes and toothpaste.

Mrs. Janne is 44 years of age; she lives with her husband and three children who are very supportive of her work. Sacrificing other activities together to be able to grow economically and now little by little they are starting to see results of their hard work.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela of San Roque High School, Kiva volunteer

La señora Janne pertenece al banco comunal Mariscal Cáceres. Vive en la región San Martín, provincia D. Mariscal Cáceres y distrito D. Juanjui. Se dedica al comercio D. venta D. abarrotes, huevos panes y verduras y el negocio está ubicado en el Jr. Huallaga Nº 1620-Juanjuicillo, parte baja.

Con el préstamo D. S/. 3,000, el cual pagará en 6 meses, comprará abarrotes como azúcar y arroz en sacos, leche Gloria en cajas, jabón Bolívar en cajas, detergente Patito en paquetes, aceite y fideos en paquetes, leche Pura Vida en cajas y pasta dental Colgate y Dento en cajas.

La señora Janne tiene 44 años, vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos que la apoyan diariamente, sacrificando otras actividades para poder crecer y es ahora donD. están viendo los resultados.

loans.use: Buy grocery goods (sugar, rice, milk, oil, noodles, etc.)

loans.name: Dina

texts.en:
Dina has been a member of the community bank “Marcela” for eight months. In her community bank she has learned to be responsible, punctual, and how to manage her business.

Dina is forty-nine years old. She is married and has six children. Dina travels to regional markets where she buys grains and chesses, which she later sells at the Nery Garcia market in Ayacucho. In addition, Dina embroiders blankets.

Dina needs a loan of 400 soles (3 soles = $1), which she will use to buy wheat, barley, corn, and cheese.

Her dream is to own a home, build a larger business, and that her children will become successful business people.

loans.use: To invest in wheat, barley, corn, and cheese.

loans.name: Leafa

texts.en: Leafa is a single mother of three children. She is the only source of income in the household, since her husband abandoned her and left her with full responsibility for the family. She has had an immaculate account history with her first loan and will continue to repay current debt levels in full and on time. With her requested loan she plans to purchase printing boards for her elei business that is in high demand by her clients. Leafa aims to provide better education for her children.

loans.use: To purchase more printing boards and ink for her elei printing (a traditional way of printing textiles for shirts and dresses) business.

loans.name: Inna

texts.en:
Inna is married with two sons. She lives with her family in Zaporozhye, Ukraine. Inna sells children’s toys, table games, strollers and footwear in the Pravoberezhnyi mall. She has a nice variety of merchandise to please her customers. Inna started this business 11 years ago when entrepreneurship in Ukraine really started emerging. She operates her business with integrity and skill and is looked up to by others as an entrepreneur of authority and intelligence. Today she has about $2400 in inventory on hand and her monthly net profit is about $600.

Inna has requested a loan of approximately $525 US to purchase children’s bikes to sell in her kiosk. Additional merchandise combined with Inna’s work ethic and experience will enable her to expand her business, increase her income and continue growing as an entrepreneur.

loans.use: Purchase children's bicycles

loans.name: Gulru.

texts.ru:
Gurlu Rahmatove lives in Nurek with her parents. She is 33 years old, not married. She has a secondary education. She is a teacher in the middle school in Nurek. The family doesn't own their own cow, but it is very expensive to purchase sour milk products at the market. This is why Gulru decided to take out a loan and buy a dairy cow. She plans to repay the loan in three months.

Translated from Russian by Anya Ezhevskaya, Kiva translator

Рахматова Гулру жительница района Нурек. Возраст 33 года, не замужем. Образование средние . Гулру работает учительницей в средней школе района Нурек. Живет с родителями . Своей коровы в их семье нет. А покупать на рынке кисло-молочную продукцию очень дорого. Поэтому Гулру решила взять кредит и купить дойную корову.Планирует погасить кредит в течение 3 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase of a dairy cow.

loans.name: Erika Yulissa

texts.es:
Erika Yulissa S. S. sells food, particularly grilled meats, at a small stand in Tarapoto, in the district of San Martín. Things are going well for her and she has a good base of customers – this is attributable to her courtesy and the cleanliness of her operation. Erika came from Trujillo with her sister to the city of Tarapoto, the largest city in the department of San Martin, looking for a better life. She fell in love with this part of the country and decided to stay. Her career as a businesswoman started then, when she decided to open a small stand selling meals such as beef kabobs, roasted chicken, juanés (similar to a tamale, but made with rice, spices and meat), chicken soup, fried pork rinds, plantains and many other dishes from the region. You can find Cinthia at her stand in the Alameda Marina Aguilar from the afternoon until midnight.

With this loan of 1000 Nuevo Sol ($350), which she will repay in four months, she will purchase supplies needed for the preparation of her food such as rice, sacks of sugar, gallons of oil, and large quantities of condiments in addition to daily purchases of beef, chicken, pork and fish which allows her to prepare many different dishes from the region to satisfy the tastes of her customers. Erika is a young woman of 33 with three children. She wants to provide them a better future and a good education. She has a goal of having her own store front for her business. She is a mature, responsible person who strongly desires to continue working to achieve her dreams.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer Ann Kenney Molloy

La Señora Erika Yulissa S. S. pertenece al Grupo de Crédito Mientras Tanto ” 28 de Julio”, vive en la Región San Martín, Provincia de San Martín y distrito de Tarapoto, ella se dedica a la venta de comidas y asados a la parrilla, le va muy bien por lo que su clientela es bastante y fluida, sus ventas están aseguradas por el buen trato y la higiene de su negocio Erika, nos cuenta que vino con su hermana desde Trujillo, y que también forma parte del grupo de Crédito Mientras Tanto, vino buscando un mejor futuro, donde se enamoro de esta tierra y terminó quedándose, desde allí empieza su historia como empresaria se propuso en poner un pequeño puesto de venta de diferentes platos de comidas como, anticuchos de carne de pollo asados al carbón, juanés, caldo de gallina, chicharrón de chancho, tacacho, y muchos platos típicos mas de la región, a ella le pueden encontrar vendiendo en la Alameda Marina Aguilar del distrito de Tarapoto partir de horas de la tarde hasta la media noche. Con el crédito de S/ 1000.00 que devolverá en un plazo de 4 meses, comprará insumos para la preparación de los alimentos como: arroz, azúcar en sacos, aceite en galones, condimentos en grandes cantidades, además sus compras diarias de carnes de res, pollo, cerdo y pescado también en kilos que le permite preparar los diferentes platos de la región para satisfacer los gustos de sus clientes. Erika es una mujer joven de 33 años con 3 hijos a quienes, quiere darles un mejor futuro y una buena educación, ella tiene como meta tener un local propio para la instalación de su negocio hoy se muestra un mujer realizada y con ganas de seguir trabajando para lograr lo que se propone.

loans.use: Purchase wholesale food items

loans.name: Thi Hoat's Group

texts.vi:
Mrs. T. Thi Hoat (ID Number 060040), 53 years old, would like to borrow 2,950,000VND to invest in rasing chickens. She has two children who are already working to add in to the family's income. Mrs. Hoat likes to join this Fund because she can repay the loan on an installment basis and so she can save. Her family's average daily income is about 130,000VND (about 8.30USD). Her group also consists of:
  • Mrs. M. Thi Thanh (ID Number 060041), wants to borrow 2,006,000VND to purchase wood to make furniture
  • Mrs. N. Thi Nga (ID Number 060042), wants to borrow 2,950,000VND to purchase pig feed
  • Mrs. N. Thi Dan (ID Number 060043), wants to borrow 2,950,000VND to purchase pig feed
  • Mr. M. Ba Nguyet (ID Number 060044), wants to borrow 2,950,000VND to raise pig and hens
  • The total amount requested is 825.00USD

    • Translated from Vietnamese by Pham Yen Thanh, Kiva Volunteer.

    Cô Trương Thị Hoạt (MS: 060040), năm nay 53 tuổi. Cô vay 2.950.000 VND để về nuôi gà thịt. Cô có hai con đã đi làm tạo thêm thu nhập cho gia đình. Cô thích tham gia vì được trả dần và được tiết kiệm. Mức thu nhập của gia đình chị khoảng 130.000 VND/ ngày

    Trong nhóm còn có:

  • Chị Mẫn Thị Thanh (MS: 060041), vay 2.006.000 VND để mua gỗ đóng bàn ghế bán.
  • Chị Nguyễn Thị Nga (MS: 060042), vay 2.950.000 VND để mua cám chăn nuôi lợn.
  • Chị Nguyễn Thị Đản (MS: 060043), vay 2.950.000 VND về mua cám chăn nuôi lợn.
  • Anh Mẫn Bá Nguyệt (MS: 060044), vay 2.950.000 VND để chăn nuôi lợn thịt và gà đẻ trứng.

loans.use: Raising livestock

loans.name: Uljonoy

texts.ru:
Алиева Улжоной родилась в 1962 году. Она замужем и имеет 3 детей. Одна из самых преуспевающих микропредпринимателей в районе Рудаки. Благодаря разборчивости в тканях женской национальной одежды и ее 10-летниму опыту в этом бизнесе она завоевала доверие у многих постоянных клиентов.  Она торгует тканями широкого ассортимента и для любого сезона.  Закупает свой товар с Бишкека и продает в местном рынке «Сафина».  У нее можно купить не только самые модные ткани для шикарного мероприятия и  для деловых встреч, но и можно найти легкие ткани из хлопка для повседневной носки.  
Улжоной очень хотелось бы еще закупить ткани производства Дубай и таким образом  увеличить оборотный капитал. Для этого она хочет получить займ  в сумме 4100 сомони сроком на год.
texts.en:
Uljonoy A. was born in 1962. She is married, with three children. She is one of the most successful entrepreneurs in the Rudaki district. Thanks to her knowledge of traditional women’s fabrics and her 10 year experience in this business, Uljonoy gained trust among many of her clients. She sells a wide array of fabrics, good for any season. She purchases her goods from Bishkek and sells them at a local market, Safin. Not only can one purchase fabrics from Uljonoy for a glamorous occasion and business meetings, but also light cotton fabrics for everyday wear. Uljonoy would like to purchase fabrics made in Dubai in order to increase her capital flow. She wants to obtain a 12 month $1200 loan for this purpose.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fabrics

loans.name: Santos Victoria

texts.es:
La señora Santos Victoria L. E. tiene 50 años vive en la calle Ricardo Palma sin número del distrito de Mache en la provincia de Otuzco en el departamento de La Libertad Perú.
Victoria estudió por correspondencia Enfermería técnica, es Promotora de Salud en su comunidad.
Se casó a los 28 años con el señor Odilón Vega y tiene seis hijos, de los cuales dependen de ella dos hijas, los otros cuatro viven independientemente.
Santos Victoria se dedica a la compra venta de artículos de primera necesidad, quesillo y animales menores, ella trabaja en su casa.
El primer préstamo obtenido de Manuela Ramos fue de 300 soles que devolvió en cuatro meses, gracias al cual amplió su negocio.
Con este crédito de S/ 2,500 soles, para devolverlos en cuatro meses, comprará dos ovejas, un cerdo, trigo, cebada y papa seca.
Su sueño más grande es tener un gran negocio en Trujillo porque quiere vivir cerca de sus hijos que viven allí.
Victoria es presidenta de promotores de salud de su zona y presidenta de su Banco Comunal Mujeres de Mache.
texts.en:
Mrs. Santos Victoria L. E. is 50 years old and lives on Ricardo Palma Street in Mache, Otuzco in the state of La Libertad, Peru. She studied technical nursing and works as a health promoter in her community. She got married at the age of 28 to Odilon Vega and she has six children; two of whom are still dependent and the other four live independently. Santos Victoria works selling necessities, cheese, and small animals out of her home. The first loan she received from the Manuela Ramos organization was for $125 and she repaid it in 4 months; thanks to the loan, she was able to grow her business. With this loan of $850 which she will repay in 4 months, she will purchase two sheep, one pig, wheat, barley, and dried potato. Her dream is to have a large business in the city of Trujillo because she would like to live close to her children who live there. She is the president of the health promoters in her neighborhood and president of the Women of Mache village bank.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of animals (sheep, pigs).  Purchase of grains (wheat, barley) and dried potatoes

loans.name: Rebeca

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 39-year-old Rebeca K. from Mbeya. She is divorced with 2 children, aged 9 and 12. Rebeca K. has been running a cloth and café business since 1998. A local restaurant or café in Tanzania usually consists of a rough wooden table and some long, wooden benches. The food is all local: rice, ugali (a hot sticky dough, made from maize flour), plantain (a cooked savory banana), all served with beans, vegetables, meat, and a variety of sauces.

She works at the business for 12 hours per day, 6 days per week, and is assisted by her brother and sister. Rebeca currently earns about $300 from her business. She is requesting a loan of $400 in order to purchase wheat flour, chairs, and a table for the café and to buy additional cloth for the cloth business. In the future, she plans to open another business.

Rebeca thanks you for your support!

loans.use: To purchase wheat flour, chairs, and a table for the café and to buy additional cloth for the cloth business

loans.name: Naziran M.anwar Group

texts.en:
Naziran baji is the wife of M., and they reside in the city of Borewala, Pakistan. Naziran baji is 53 years old; unfortunately, she has been in very poor health for half of her life. Her husband is a woodcutter by profession, but he is currently in the wood-selling business. More specifically, in the past, he would go into the forest to cut wood per requests from his clients; however, he now simply buys wood from a wholeseller and later sells such wood in different places.

Meanwhile, Naziran baji has worked as a seamstress and as a maid over the years. By doing so, she was able to save enough money to help construct their two-room brick house. Naziran baji is now applying for a loan to buy more wood to expand her husband’s wood-selling business.

She is joined in her loan group by four other members: Parveen baji seeks a loan to buy another motorbike for her motorbike rental business; and Khursheed baji, Yasmeen baji, and Zubaida baji each request a loan to buy clothes to resell. This is a group loan; as such, the loan proceeds will be distributed amongst the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. Notably, the group members mutually guarantee one another's loans; as a result, if one group member does not repay her portion of the loan, then the other members are responsible for curing the arrears.

loans.use: To expand and improve her husband's wood-selling business by purchasing additional wood

loans.name: Tamaly I.

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings) from Tanzania! This is 35-year-old Tamaly A. from Kyela. She is a widow with two children, ages 5 and 11. Additionally, she is responsible for supporting one dependent orphan. Tamaly has been running a crops-selling business since 2006. She buys cocoa seeds and rice from farmers and sells them in the market at a higher price.

Tamaly works at the business for 9 to 12 hours per day, 7 days per week. Tamaly currently earns about 180 USD a month from her business. She is requesting a loan of 400 USD in order to purchase more cocoa and rice in bulk. In the future, she plans to establish another business. Tamaly thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA: SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit through micro-leasing in Tanzania. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women and uses the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets; thus they are deemed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro-leasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more cocoa and rice in bulk

loans.name: Mathieu

texts.fr: Mr Mathieu L. est né le 21 Octobre 1984 à Lomé. Artiste Perlier de métier, il est marié et père de famille. Il détient un atelier boutique dans lequel il vend des perles et des pagnes pour femmes. C’est une activité qui lui rapporte beaucoup en terme de bénéfice, mais il est souvent confronté à une rupture de stock faute de moyens financier. Pour remédier à cette situation, il demande un crédit pour constituer un stock de pagnes et de perles afin de pouvoir satisfaire ses clientes. Cela lui permettra de rentabiliser son commerce et d’augmenter ses revenus.
texts.en:
Mr Mathieu L. was born in Lomé, on October 21, 1984. A trained pearl artist, he's married and the father of a family. He owns a workshop where he sells pearls and pagnes (colorful African cloth) for women. His business brings in a great deal, but he often finds himself out of stock due to a lack of financial means. To remedy this situation, he's seeking a loan to purchase a stock of pagnes and pearls, in order to meet customer demand. This will enable him to make his business more profitable, and to increase his income.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and resell pagnes and pearls

loans.name: Achilova

texts.ru: Женщина в возрасте 48 лет, мать пятерых детей.Умри имеет маленький бизнес по продаже продуктов питания.Сама Умри работает кондитером в кулинарном цехе.В рабочие дни на продаже в ларьке торгует её муж.Она кредитуется уже третий год и без проблем погашает свои кредиты. Для увеличения ассортимента товаров она хочет получить очередной займ.Она считает что благодаря кредитам у неё бизнес расширяется.Она с радостью продолжает свою деятельность.
texts.en:
A 48-year-old woman, U. has a small food retail business. In addition, she works as a confectioner at a pastries plant. During the workweek, U.'s business is run by her husband. U. has been a micro-loan borrower for 3 years, and she always pays her loans back without any problems. With this loan U. plans to purchase additional goods to grow her retail business.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase food products

loans.name: Sikudhani

texts.en:
Sikudhani has been a juice and bites seller in the Mikunguni neighborhood of Zanzibar for 4 years. She belongs to Jitahidi Group (Group code 2014). She currently earns an average monthly profit of US$ 195. Every day she works at her business for 14 hours. She is requesting her third loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can increase her inventory by adding more items for her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business and save money for future use.

Sikudhani is 33 years old, married, and has four children: ages 18, 12, 10 and 4.

loans.use: To increase her inventory by adding more items for her busness

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Nguyễn Thị T. 46 tuổi. Năm 1996 chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương và vay vốn để đầu tư vào chăn nuôi. Qua 13 năm tham gia vay vốn và đầu tư hiệu quả hiện nay công việc chăn nuôi của gia đình chị đang ngày càng được mở rộng và và phát triển. Với mức thu nhập 5.000.000đ/ tháng từ chăn nuôi gia đình chị T. đang ngày càng có thêm điều kiện để cải thiện cuộc sống.
Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 15.000.000đ để đầu mua gà thịt và cá về nuôi.
texts.en:
Ms. Nguyễn Thị T. is 46 years old. In 1996 she joined TYM Fund and borrowed to put towards raising livestock. After 13 years of participation in the fund and getting good investment results, her family's livestock rearing activities continues to grow and evolve. With an income of 5,000,000 VND per month from raising livestock, Ms. T.'s family is more able to improve their livelihood with each day that passes. For the upcoming loan cycle, she hopes to borrow 15,000,000 VND to purchase chicken, ducks, and fish to rear.

Translated from Vietnamese by Catherine Tran, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising Livestock

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Toutes mariées, les  femmes du groupe Benkadi avec une moyenne d’âge de 32 ans, ont en moyenne 2 enfants et  vivent dans des  familles traditionnelles à Sanoubougou I un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso (3ème région administrative de la république du Mali). 
 Elles mènent diverses  activités  qui sont entre autres la vente  de condiments alimentaires, des  vêtements pour enfants, des tissus, des pagnes wax et du sucre. 
Elles sont à leur premier prêt avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso.
Avec ce prêt, elles comptent acheter 15 paquets de condiments alimentaires, 20  douzaines vêtements pour enfants, 20 pièces de pagnes  wax et 10 sacs de  50 kg de sucre. 
Elles s’approvisionnent au grand marché de  Sikasso auprès des grossistes. 
Les marchandises sont vendues au comptant en détail et à crédit, au marché et dans les quartiers d’une façon ambulante à une clientèle composée généralement de femmes.
Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice de 25.000CFCA par mois dont une partie sera utilisée pour les besoins de la famille et l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
texts.en:
All married, the women in the Benkadi group average 32 years of age and 2 children. They live in traditional families in Sanoubougou, one of the neighborhoods of Sikasso (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They run various businesses, such as selling food condiments, children clothing, fabrics, Wax pagnes (a brand of colorful African cloth), and sugar. They are seeking their first loan from Kiva's partner, Soro Yiriwaso. They plan to use it to buy 15 packs of food condiments, 20 dozen children clothing, 20 pieces of Wax pagnes, and 10 sacks of 50 kg of sugar.

They get their supplies from wholesalers at the grand market in Sikasso. The women retail their goods for cash or on credit, at the market and as ambulant saleswomen in the area, to a clientele comprising mostly women. They foresee turning a monthly profit of XOF 25'000 (ca US$ 50 ) each, to be used in part to provide for their families. The remainder will be invested in their businesses.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy food condiments, children clothing, Wax pagnes, and sugar

loans.name: Anthonia

texts.en: Anthonia sells foodstuffs and kerosene. She is requesting a loan in the amount of N80,000 to purchase more foodstuffs and kerosene to sell. She is 38 years old and married with 3 children. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs and kerosene to sell.

loans.name: Haki Sawa Group

texts.en:
Rehema J., 34, is a divorcee with three children, ages 18, 15 and five. She sells fried cassava, ice cream and juice. For over a year she has worked daily from 6am until 3pm. Rehema earns a monthly profit of around $30.

This will be Rehema’s first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She wants to use this loan to buy more cassava and cooking oil, to make more ice cream and to buy more fruit to make juice.

Rehema will share this loan with her group, Haki Sawa which totals 21 members. Members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the entire loan. (Rehema is the first person on the left, in a red top.)

loans.use: Buy more cassava, cooking oil and fruit to make juice and icre cream.

loans.name: Drocelle

texts.en:
Greetings from Drocelle M., a 56 year old widow of 5 children of the  following ages: 30, 27, 23, 19, and 17. She lives together with her 3 younger children in the Nyarugenge district of Kigali city, the capital of Rwanda.

Ms. M. has a transportation business in Kigali city and other villages near Kigali city. She owns a motorcycle. She has one full time employee who rides this motorcycle and produces the monthly profit of approximately $146. The daily business starts at 7:00 A.M and finishes at 8:00 P.M everyday. The requested loan is 240000 Rwf from Vision Finance Company, a partner of World Vision International.
This entrepreneur will buy a cow with the loan and from the increased profit she will get more food for her family and have more savings.

loans.use: Buying a cow

loans.name: Faustina

texts.es:
La señora Faustina, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Niño Jesús de Praga” que esta ubicado en el distrito de Yunguyo, Provincia de Chucuito, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 37 años de edad, es casada y madre de 04 hijos, los dos mayores son estudiantes, tiene estudios de secundaria completa y vive en el Barrio Ciudad Nueva.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela R. desde hace 10 años aproximadamente, con un préstamo inicial de S/. 300.00, ella tiene su negocio de compra y venta de carne. 

Actualmente solicita un préstamo de S/. 2,000.00, para poder invertir en su negocio con el cual comprara carne de ovino y luego lo venderá en el mercado de Yunguyo y en las ferias de la zona. Nos indica que los ovinos los compra vivos, luego los mata y así genera más ganancias.

Su deseo es poner un emporio bien surtido, le gusta las reuniones y los encuentros que realiza Manuela R. ya que en ellos se distrae mucho.
texts.en:
Mrs. Faustina belongs to the Banco Comunal “Niño Jesús de Praga," located in the Yunguyo district, in the Province of Chucuito, Department of Puno. She is 37 years old, married and has four children, the oldest two are students. She has a complete high school education; she lives in the Ciudad Nueva neighborhood. She has worked with the Manuela R. Movement for approximately 10 years, with an initial loan of S/. 300. She has a business of buying and selling meat. She currently needs a loan of S/. 2000 in order to invest in her business and buy sheep's meat which she will later sell in the Yunguyo market and at the local farmers' markets. She tells us that she buys the sheep alive, which she slaughters herself in order to save money. Her desire is to establish a well stocked store. She likes the meetings and the get-togethers organized by Manuela R., because they provide an opportunity for distraction.

Translated from Spanish by Monica Hayden, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Comprara carne de ovino.

loans.name: Sabali Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Sabali est composé de six femmes (dont une célibataire et cinq mariées) vivant en majorité dans des familles polygames. Elles ont en moyenne 35 ans,  3 enfants et habitent dans le quartier Hamdallaye de la ville de  Ségou (4ème  Région administrative de la république  du Mali).
Les femmes du groupe font de l’achat et de la vente des condiments alimentaires et  divers articles ménagers  tels les calebasses etc. 
 Dans le but d’augmenter leur fonds de commerce, elles ont décidé d’adhérer au programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso avec qui elles sont à leur premier prêt solidaire.
Ce prêt  sera utilisé pour acheter,  20 colis de calebasses  et  4  corbeilles de condiments (l’ails, poivres, tomates fraîches etc.) Elles se ravitaillent en calebasses à Tonan et  en condiments alimentaires essentiellement à Bamako (capitale du Mali). Les calebasses sont revendues au marché château de Ségou, à domicile, dans les foires de Dougabougou, Siribala et Macina, quant aux condiments alimentaires, ils sont revendus au marché château de Ségou à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. 
Elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 30.000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour rembourser le prêt et subvenir aux dépenses familiales (savon et de l’habillement pour les enfants). 
Elles ont pour ambition de diversifier leurs activités génératrices de revenus.
texts.en:
The Sabali group is composed of six women (one unmarried and five married), predominantly living in polygamous families. They average 35 years of age and 3 children, and live in the Hamdallaye neighborhood in the city of Ségou (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali). These women buy and resell food condiments, as well as various household items such as "calebasses" (containers made out of hollowed out and dried calabashes).

Eager to increase their working capital, they decided to join the loan program of Kiva's partner, Soro Yiriwaso, from which they are seeking their first solidarity loan (group loan). This loan will be used to buy 20 packages of calebasses and 4 baskets of condiments (garlic, peppers, fresh tomatoes, etc). They get their supplies in Tonan for the calebasses, and mostly in Bamako (capital of Mali) for the condiments. Calebasses are resold at the Château market in Ségou, at home, and at fairs in Dougabougou, Siribala and Macina. Condiments are resold at the Château market in Ségou, to a clientele comprising mainly women.

The women count on turning an average monthly profit of XOF 30'000 (ca US$ 65), to be used to repay the loan and to provide for the family expenses (soap and clothes for the children). They ambition to diversify their businesses.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 20 packages of "calebasses" and 4 baskets of condiments (garlic, peppers, fresh tomatoes, etc)

loans.name: Melodina

texts.en: Melodina O. is from the town of Quezon, Bukidnon. She is 49 years old, is married, and has eight adult children. Melodina owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Melodina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy necessary materials for agriculture

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en: Lourdes H. is from the village of Baluarte, Lumbia Cagayan de Oro City. She is 46 years old, is married, and has six school-aged children. Lourdes owns and operates a business making and selling food, selling specialty food products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Lourdes joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. Lourdes is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her 3rd from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her children. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

location.town: Baluarte, Lumbia, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Susan Day

texts.es:
Susan tiene 21 años de edad y vive junto a su esposo en casa de una tía, ubicada en el distrito de José Leonardo Ortiz, ubicado a 5 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

En Abril de este año ella y su esposo compraron un auto usado con el cual vienen trabajando en la compra y distribución de ropa; ellos viajan a Ecuador o a Lima dos a tres veces por mes para comprar su mercandería y distribuirla en los principales establecimientos de la ciudad; adicionalmente su esposo trabaja como taxista en el auto cuando no están fuera de Chiclayo.

El continuo uso y la antigüedad del vehículo ha hecho que este empiece a sufrir desperfectos mecánicos en el motor por lo que se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a nuestra Institución un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la reparación y mantenimiento de su unidad móvil.

Su más grande anhelo es llegar a ahorrar el dinero suficiente para comprarse un lote de terreno y contruir en él su casa propia, ellos no perciben otro tipo de ingresos económicos por lo que la reparación de su vehículo es muy importante para el logro de sus objetivos.

Susan es muy estimada por sus clientes y vecinos, ellos la consideran una mujer responsable y entregada a su trabajo.
texts.en:
Susan is 21, and she lives with her husband in her aunt’s house, which is located in the José Leonardo Ortiz district. This is five minutes from the city of Chiclayo. In April of this year she and her husband bought a used car. They use it working in the sale and distribution of clothes. They travel to Ecuador or to Lima two or three times a month to buy their merchandise and distribute it to the main establishments in the city. Also, her husband works as a taxi driver in the car when they are not away from Chiclayo. The continual use and the age of the vehicle have made it start to have mechanical problems with the motor. That is why she has seen the need to ask our institution, for the first time, for a loan for 2,000 PEN. She plans to use it for the repair and maintenance of their car. Her biggest goal is to save enough money to buy some land and build her own house. They do not have another type of income, so the repair of their vehicle is very important to achieve their goals. Susan is held in high esteem by her customers and neighbors. They consider her to be a responsible woman and very involved in her work.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair and maintenance of their vehicle

loans.name: Rosaly

texts.en:
Rosaly B. is from the village of Yumbing, Mambajao Camiguin. She is 34 years old and single. To make a living, Rosaly owns & operates a retail business. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of products in the local community. Rosaly has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Rosaly joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her standard of living and be able to engage in expanded business activities. Rosaly has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from HSPFI.
