Rosaly is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her business’s product offering. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Rosaly from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand her business’s product offering.

loans.name: Naomi Cheptarus

texts.en:
Naomi is 47 years old, married and is blessed with six children. Her clothing business is located at Chembulet in Eldoret.

She was introduced to KADET by a friend. With the loan Naomi is expecting from KADET she intends to add more clothes for sale for both adults and children and for both genders. 

Her future dreams are to open a food kiosk so that she can have financial sustainability.

About KADET:
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empower her clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To buy more readymade clothes for both adults and children.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
“Sacrifice and humility are necessary in achieving success in life,” says Janet B.. Janet is married to Eric, a tricycle driver. This couple is blessed with three children: Erica-ten years old,grade-V pupil;Angelica-eight,grade-II pupil and Linette-four years old. 

Janet is selling snacks and frozen foods in their village.  Her husband sometimes helps her in her business. She would like to purchase additional snacks and frozen foods for her to generate bigger income for her family needs. In this regard, she would like to apply a loan amounting PHP5,000 for her business improvement. She hopes that she could avail this amount so that she could be able to budget it wisely.

loans.use: Additional capital for vending activity

loans.name: Bernarda Lucila

texts.es: La Señora Bernarda Lucia tiene la edad de 41 años, tiene 1 hijo que está a su cargo, sus propósitos son de seguir con su negocio adelante para sacar adelante a su familia. Sus deseos son de seguir luchando para darle mejoras a su vivienda. La actividad económica a la que se dedica es la venta ropa nueva. Hace más de  5 años, ella inicia este negocio porque necesitaba un medio que le generara ingresos para su familia y acude a la venta de estos productos, por lo que logra ver los resultados de sus sacrificios. Es el destino del  financiamiento es para capital de trabajo para la compra de los productos como pantalones, faldas, camisolas, shorts y ropa interior.
texts.en:
Sra. Bernarda Lucia is 41 years old and has one dependent child. She intends to move her business forward so that she can support her family. In addition, she hopes to continue working hard so that she can make improvements to her home.

Bernarda sells new clothing. She started her business 5 years ago as a means of generating income for her family. Everything she has achieved has been a result of many sacrifices. The loan she is requesting will be used as operating capital to purchase trousers, skirts, camisoles, shorts, and undergarments.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase additional inventory

loans.name: Taiwo

texts.en: Taiwo is 42 years old and married with two children. His wife is a hairstylist. He makes and sells cellophane bags at retail prices to his customers within his community in Ibadan, Oyo state, Nigeria. He has been in this business for a long time. He is requesting a loan of 50,000 NGN to purchase more materials to make more cellophane bags to sell. With this business he hopes to meet the basic needs of his family. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more materials to make more cellophane bags to sell

loans.name: Heidi

texts.en:
Heidi D. is from the village of Villa Coloma, Bagabag, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 37 years old. Heidi is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Heidi owns & operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. Heidi has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Heidi joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Heidi has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from ASKI. Heidi is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Heidi from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Yashar

texts.en: Yashar A. is married. He has one child. Yashar was born in 1974. A.'s family lives in Baku city. He has had a taxi business for five years. Now he needs a loan of 2,000 AZN to buy spare parts to improve his taxi business.

loans.use: To buy spare parts

loans.name: Abduzoir

texts.ru: Холиков Абдузоир проживает в районе Яван. Возраст, 30 лет. Женат, имеет 3 детей. Холиков Абдузоир имеет высшее образование. В области животноводства работает 4 года. Холиков Абдузоир откармливает и продает скот. Кредит берет для закупа скота.
texts.en:
Abduzoir H. lives in the Yavan district. He is 30 years old, married and has 3 children. Abduzoir H. has a higher education. He has been working in the animal husbandry field for 4 years. Abduzoir H. raises and sells livestock. He is obtaining this loan for the purchase of livestock.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of livestock

loans.name: Minerva Mirabal 1&2 Group

texts.en:
Soraida is the coordinator of her group 'Minerva Mirabal' (named after one of the famed trio of sisters who stood up to Dictator Rafael Trujillo and paid the ultimate price for doing so), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally. Her group is located in the slums north of the capital Santo Domingo where crime is rampant and where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure as a single mother with her 5 children.

Soraida is excited to be taking her second loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business selling bacon and sausage by purchasing 180 lbs of meat. She will use the profits to invest in her business with the goal of one day owning a corner store that will meet all the needs of the people in her neighborhood. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: Meat with which to make bacon and sausage

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica B. is a 49-year-old, married woman from the village of Malaubang in Ozamiz City. Veronica has 4 school-age children. To earn a living, Veronica owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector. Specifically, she operates a specialized retail store, where she sells snacks, including a local delicacy known as "puto maya," and coffee to her community members. Veronica has been engaged in this business for over 25 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP per month from these activities.

In 2010, Veronica joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services. In turn, she is hoping to improve her standard of living as well as her ability to engage in business activities. Veronica is requesting a loan in the amount of 10,000 PHP ($225), which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan would be the first loan taken out by Veronica from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business as a result of the loan to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices, covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte, and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fishermen/women, and entrepreneurs.

loans.use: To expand and improve her business by purchasing additional products

loans.name: Mohsen

texts.en:
Mohsen is a 42-year-old married man and father of 5 children of whom three are unemployed. He has owned a vegetable shop since 2006 with a previous 8 years of experience in this occupation. He offers all types of vegetables according to the season and he's making a good income. 

Today, Mohsen is requesting to borrow US$ 1,200 to buy more vegetables from some farmer in addition to vegetable boxes to present his products to his customers.

loans.use: buy more vegetables from a farmer in addition oto vegetable boxes

loans.name: Ramona Del Socorro

texts.es: Ramona Del Socorro tiene 65 años, su actividad económica es la venta de cosméticos. Hace más de 11 años que se dedica a este negocio por lo que su medio de vida es lo que le proporciona a su familia el pan de cada día. Este negocio lo realiza de manera ambulante por lo que obtiene mucho más clientes de esta Manera sus clientes la tratan con mucho cariño es conocida por Monchita pues ellos se sienten muy contentos. Anteriormente laboraba en la alcaldía pero debido a la necesidad de llevar más ingresos a su hogar. Su deseo es tener otra fuente de ingreso necesaria. El financiamiento es para capital de trabajo que será destinado para la compra de talcos, cremas, colonias, perfumes y pinturas.
texts.en:
Ramona Del Socorro is 65 years old and makes a living selling cosmetics. She has worked in this business for more than 11 years, and her work is how she provides for her family each day. She sells her products as a street vendor and has managed to obtain many customers in this way. Her customers treat her with much affection—they call her Monchita, since she always makes them feel happy. She used to work in the mayor’s office, but left that job because she needed to bring in more income for her household. Her wish is to have another source of income. The loan is for working capital, which Ramona will use to purchase talcum powder, creams, colognes, perfumes, and makeup.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital for purchasing cosmetics

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma S. is from the village of San Miguel, Gingoog City. She is 37 years old. Vilma is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Vilma owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting & harvesting bananas for sale. Vilma has been engaged in her business for over 13 years and earns approximately 4,500 PHP a month for these activities.

Vilma joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Vilma is requesting a  loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business by buying more bananas to sell. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Vilma from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of the family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business.

location.town: San Miguel, Gingoog City, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Manuel Antonio

texts.es: El Sr. Manuel Antonio F. H. de  55 años de edad,  es padre soltero tienen 2  hijos independientes. Tiene casa propia ubicada en Santiago. Labora como obrero de campo en una empresa agroindustrial. Es una persona emprendedora, que gracias a su empeño logró adquirir sus bienes. Requiere el crédito para realizar unas mejoras en su domicilio. Su sueño es lograr construir toda la vivienda con el fin de alcanzar una mejor calidad de vida. Esta muy agradecido por el apoyo que le podamos brindar a través de este financiamiento.
texts.en:
Señor Manuel Antonio F. H. is 55 years old. He is a single father of two independent children. He has his own house located in Santíago. He works as a farmer at an agricultural factory. He is a hard worker, and thanks to his effort he has saved enough to live well. He requests this loan in order to make improvements to his house. His dream is to manage to build the whole dwelling in order to achieve a better quality of life. He is very appreciative for the support that we can offer through this financing.

Translated from Spanish by Lois Parshley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To improve his house

loans.name: Thanh

texts.en: Thanh T. N. was born in 1976. She lives in Luong Quy village. She is married with a son. She is a tailor. Besides that, she breeds pigs and poultry. She has a monthly income of about 2.000.000 Vietnamdong (VND). She has participated in SEDA since 2006 and has repaid punctually. In this loan cycle, she wants to borrow 8.066.000 VND to buy feed for her pigs and poultry.

loans.use: to buy feed for pigs and poultry

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margret is widowed with four children and all her children go to school. She also takes care of her sisters' children. She owns a store in Kisaasi selling charcoal and sells to all categories of people.  both  Margaret is widowed with four children and all her children go to school. She also takes care of her sister's children.  She owns a store in Kisaasi selling charcoal and sells to all categories of people at retail and at wholesale.  She wants to use this loan to buy more bags of charcoal.  Margaret doesn’t incur any transport costs because she buys from her place of work. She has been in this business for five years. Besides this charcoal business, she also sells second hand clothes. Her major customers are her neighbors. She works seven days a week. Margaret's biggest challenges are seasonality and debtors. She aspires to educate her children up to university and to start going directly to villages for charcoal. She joined MCDT because they were giving out timely loans. She resides in and owns a two-room house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and food.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Mohammad Hanef

texts.en: M. Hanef is the son of M. R.. He lives in district of 8, Kabul, Afghanistan. He is married with three children who are in school. He wants to take a loan for his fruit and vegetable shop. He would like to expand his business and buy more items for his shop that he does not stock but are in high demand in the market. He would like to say that Kiva is an effective process.

loans.use: to expand his business

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios T. lives in the village of Lugait in Misamis  Oriental. She is 71 years old, married and has seven adult-aged children. She makes a living running a retail shop where she sells seafood products such as fish and shrimp to people who live in her community. She has been in this business for more than four years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month from her work.

Earlier this year, Remedios joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her life and ability to engage in business. She is requesting her first loan, for 5,000 PHP, to buy additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated by this loan to continue to improve her business. 

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy additional products to sell

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.es:
Ofelia tiene 54 años de edad, es casada, y tiene dos hijos, vive junto a su esposo en el sector Monteverde del distrito de Tambogrande, un distrito de la provincia de Piura, en la región del mismo nombre, caracterizado por que sus pobladores se dedican principalmente al cultivo de frutas.

Ofelia se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza por catálogo, ella cuenta con un grupo de clientes que le compran sus productos con frecuencia, mientras más pedidos le realizan obtiene mas puntos de parte de la empresa que le provee los productos y por consiguiente obtiene mayores ganancias. Por este motivo Carmen se esfuerza por obtener cada vez mas clientes.

Adicionalmente trabaja vendiendo comida en su domicilio, con los ingresos que percibe de estas actividades apoya a su esposo, que es agricultor, con el sostenimiento de la economía de su familia. Ella trabaja incansablemente por mantenerse en estas actividades.

Ofelia desea adquirir mas productos de belleza para empezar a contar con un stock permanente que permita a sus clientes agenciarse de los productos cuando los necesitan si tener que esperar hasta el fin de mes, por ello ha solicitado por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 700 nuevos soles.

Ella es una mujer trabajadora y honrada, su mayor anhelo es seguir trabajando para mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia. En la zona donde vive es bastante conocida y estimada por sus vecinos.
texts.en:
Ofelia is 54 years old, married, and has two children. She lives with her husband in the Monteverde sector of the district of Tambogrande, which is in the province and region of Piura. The area is known for its residents who primarily grow fruit.

Ofelia sells beauty products by catalog. She has a group of customers who buy her products on a frequent basis. The more orders she obtains, the more points she earns from the company to buy merchandise and generate higher profits. For this reason, Ofelia strives to attract more customers.

In addition, she sells food out of her home. The earnings she receives from this business help support her husband, a farmer, with stabilizing the family finances. She works tirelessly to maintain her business activities.

Ofelia wants to acquire more beauty products so that she can establish a permanent inventory that will allow her to supply her customers with products immediately without having to wait until the end of the month. For this reason, she is requesting her first loan with Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 700 PEN.

Ofelia is a hardworking and honorable woman. Her greatest wish is to continue working so that she can improve the quality of life for her family. In the area where she lives, Ofelia is well-known and respected by her neighbors.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase beauty products

loans.name: Emilienne

texts.fr: D. Emilienne est née le 19 Mars 1972 et est mariée à GBETINDE Sébastien, un matelassier. Le couple a quatre enfants à leur charge, dont trois sont leurs propres enfants. Il y a quatre ans que la famille s'est installée au quartier Yagbé à Cotonou, capitale économique du  Bénin. Emilienne et son mari assurent ensemble les différentes charges de la maison. Pour y parvenir, Emilienne  prépare et vend de la nourriture (pâte de maïs) à Cotonou. Emilienne achète ses produits à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. C'est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé, ayant obtenu six prêts qui ont tous été bien remboursés. Dans le but de renforcer son activité et de mieux faire face à la demande de jour en jour nombreuse de sa clientèle, Emilienne sollicite un autre crédit.
texts.en:
Emilienne D. was born on the 19th March 1972 and is married to Sebastien Gbetinde, a quilter. The couple have four children in their care, of which 3 are their own children. It's been four years since the family settled in the Yabe district of Cotonou, economic capital of Benin. Emilienne and her husband together cover all the household expenses. To achieve this, Emilienne prepares and sells food (corn paste) in Cotonou. Emilienne buys her products in Dantokpa, Benin's international market. She is a longterm client of ALIDe, having taken out 6 loans, all of which have been diligently repaid. In order to strengthen her business, and to better face the growing demands of her clientele, Emilienne is requesting another loan.

Translated from French by Kate Bennett, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Achat de sacs de maïs et des condiments de sauce.

loans.name: Margaret  Naanyu

texts.en:
Margaret Naanyu K. is 33 years old. She is single and the mother of two children, 2 and 6 years old. Margaret has been farming on her own piece of land for the last ten years.
  
Margaret learned about KADET from a colleague who is already a KADET registered client. This will be her first loan. She is planning to spend 20,000 KES to buy chemicals and fertilizers for sukumawiki (green leafy vegetables) which she has already planted and 30,000 KES to prepare land to plant more vegetables. With the profits she hopes to make from the proceeds of this loan, she plans to reinvest in the farm and plant different varieties of vegetables such as cabbages, carrots, and spinach. Her hope and dream is to become a large scale vegetable farmer and to start fruit farming. Margaret is a hardworking woman and, with the right resources, she can do great.

loans.use: to buy chemicals and fertilizers for sukumawiki which she has already planted and to prepare land to plant more vegetables

loans.name: Martine

texts.fr: K. Martine est née en 1968 à Avrankou dans le département de l’Ouémé. Martine est mariée à TIKO Alfred et est mère de trois enfants, tous scolarisés. Martine vit ensemble avec sa famille au quartier Agbodjèdo à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin, depuis trois ans environs.  C’est ensemble avec son mari que Martine fait face aux différentes charges de son foyer. Martine n’a pas été à l’école. Depuis une dizaine d’année, Martine vend des friperies à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin, ce qui lui permet de subvenir à ses besoins et d’assurer les besoins de sa famille. C’est la deuxième fois que Martine sollicite l’appui financier de ALIDé, en vue de renforcer son activité et d’accroître sa clientèle. Martine a bien remboursé son premier crédit.
texts.en:
Martine K. was born in 1968 in Avrankou, in the Department of Ouémé. Martine is married to Alfred Tiko and is the mother of 3 children, all of whom have been educated. Martine and her family have lived in the Agbodjèdo neighborhood of Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin, for about 3 years. Together with her husband, Martine faces the varied challenges of managing the household. Martine has not been to school. For the past ten years, Martine has sold used clothes in Dantokpa, the international market of Benin, which has allowed her to meet her needs and those of her family. This is the second time Martine has sought a loan from ALIDé, with the goal of building her business and her client base. Martine repaid her first loan on time.

Translated from French by Eileen Jessop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy bales of used clothes

loans.name: María Jesús

texts.es: María Jesús M. G. 48 años de edad, reside en el municipio de Ilobasco ubicado en el departamento de Cabañas, vive junto a sus dos sobrinos de 18 y 12 años de edad, los cuales no solo se dedican a estudiar sino también a ayudarle a María con los quehaceres del hogar como también a atender el negocio. María es una madre de familia muy responsable y trabajadora, que ha pesar que desempeña tanto el rol de madre como el de padre, ha logrado sacar adelante a su familia, ya que sus dos sobrinos cuentan con todo lo necesario y así mismo se dedican a estudiar gracias a los enormes esfuerzos de María. Ella posee una tienda de productos comestibles como pan y golosinas, y también   de primera necesidad como: jabón y shampoo, y también comercializa verduras a las afueras de su casa. María solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda surtir aún más la tienda, así mismo para comprar mayor cantidad de maíz, y verduras, de manera que pueda atender mejor a sus clientes y de esta misma forma mejorar sus ventas lo cual es su prioridad para sacar adelante su hogar.
texts.en:
María Jesús M. G. is 48 years old and lives in the town of Ilobasco, located in the Cabañas department. She lives with her two nephews, ages 18 and 12. Both of them attend school and also help María with the household chores and help tend the business. María is a very responsible and hard working mother who fills the role of both mother and father and who has managed to move her family ahead. Her nephews have all they need and are able to attend school, thanks to María’s enormous efforts. She has a store where she sells food items, such as bread, sweets, and other things such as ham, and shampoo. She also sells vegetables right outside her home. María is asking for this loan so that she can stock her store a bit more by buying large quantities of corn, and vegetables so that she can better tend to her customers’ needs and increase her sales. Getting ahead with her family is a priority for her.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Jorge Luis

texts.es: Jorge Luis tiene mucho tiempo de ser cliente de Fundación, por lo que no es la primera vez que realiza financiamientos. El se dedica a brindar el servicio de transporte, hace más de 13 años que se dedica a esta actividad. Tiene 1 hijo de 9 años a su cargo, el se encarga de ser una padre responsable, para que su hijo obtenga lo necesario. El ha demostrado pagar sus cuotas en tiempo y forma   ya que el siempre está pendiente de sus pagos. Este crédito es para realizar mejoras a su camión que lo ocupan en diferentes tareas.
texts.en:
Jorge Luis has been a client of Fundación Leon 2000 for a long time, so this is not the first time he has received financing. He has been providing transportation services for more than thirteen years. Jorge has a nine year old son who is a dependent. Being a responsible father, Jorge wants to provide everything his son needs.

He has demonstrated that he completes his payments in a timely manner and always handles them with care. This loan will be used to make repairs to his truck, which is used for different tasks.

loans.use: Vehicle repairs

loans.name: Banche  Mireille  Aimée

texts.fr:
Commerçante de 40ans mère célibataire de 4 enfants dont l’âge varie de 22ans à 9 ans et ayant 1e  personne en charge tous scolarisés. En 1999 elle se lance dans la vente des produits pharmaceutiques avec un capital de 150000frs. Ses ventes sont de 15000 à 60000 frs par jours.

Sa stratégie est d’épargner pour aller de l’avant. Elle aimerait être fournisseur et bien scolariser ses enfants afin qu’ils deviennent l'une des grand cadre de ce pays.

Réputée dans lla pharmacie, avec ce prêt elle va acheter des quinines,des seringues,de l'alcool, du paracetamol, de la nivaquine,des sirop. 
Elle à une bonne réputation dans son entourage elle on l'appel maman docteur.
texts.en: This shopkeeper is a single 40 year-old mother of four, whose children and one ward are aged 9 to 22 years old and all attend school. In 1999 she started her own business selling pharmaceutical products, with base funds of 150,000 FRS. She generates between 15,000 and 60,000 FRS of sales every day.  Her strategy is to save money going forward; she would like to be a supplier and pay for her children's education so that they will be successful in life. She has an excellent reputation in her field, and aims to use this loan in order to purchase quinine, syringes, alcohol, paracetamol, nivaquine and syrups. She is held in such high esteem that those around her call her 'Mother Doctor'.

loans.use: Achat nivaquine, aspirine,paracetamol,seringue

loans.name: Yurima Patricia

texts.es:
Yurima Patricia O. A. es una joven mujer que vive en el barrio Villa San Carlos en la ciudad de Barranquilla, con su cónyuge  dedicado a la compra y venta de madera  y  con sus tres hijos en las edades de 4, 8 y 12 años.  
En el año 2006 Yurima y su esposo iniciaron un negocio de tienda para aumentar sus ingreso familiares , pero Yurima empezó a darle un cambio gradual al esquema de su negocio y fue poco a poco cambiando su actividad por la venta y oferta de productos de mayor rentabilidad, como papelería,  bebidas frías, cervezas y gaseosas , a las que adicionó otros servicios como el de internet y también de fotocopiaje  e impresión,  haciendo su actividad mas coherente con lo que ella le gusta y adicionó también que con ello puede atender a sus hijos  menores de edad.   Finalmente el  gran sueño de Yurima es convertir su negocio en una inmensa papelería con   oferta multifuncional de servicios avanzados de comunicaciones, donde también ofrezca  meriendas, dulces y mecatos para que sus clientes estén cómodos y se deleiten con el servicio. En la actualidad está muy contenta con lo que tiene, su papelería le genera una  utilidad bruta  de un 25%, los refrescos y bebidas  entre el  49%  y 50% y últimamente adicionó un computador y una impresora con las que espera, que le ofrezcan estos dos servicios, un margen de contribución de un 90%.
Este es su segundo crédito con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y con el anterior logró aumentar sus ingresos, porque contó con un nuevo capital de trabajo para responder a sus clientes. Con su credikiva comprará cervezas, refrescos y confitería alistándose para la temporada del final de año que se avecina. Su sueño y gran felicidad  es estudiar belleza y que sus hijos logren tener una profesión que les permita ser exitosos en un futuro.
texts.en:
Yurima Patricia O. A. is a young woman living in the Villa San Carlos neighborhood in the city of Barranquilla with her spouse, who is a lumber merchant, and their three children who are 4, 8 and 12 years old.

In 2006 Yurima and her husband opened a grocery store to increase family income.  However, Yurima gradually modified its nature stocking more profitable items like paper goods, cold beverages, beer and soft drinks as well as services like Internet access, photocopying and printing thereby making her business more in tune with her likes while at the same time making it possible for her to care for her minor children.

Yurima’s ultimate dream is to turn her business into a huge stationery store offering a multitude of advanced communication services as well as meals, candy and snacks so that her customers will be more comfortable and enjoy the services.

She is currently quite happy with what she has.  Her stationery store generates a gross profit of 25%, the beverages and soft drinks around 49%-50% and she recently added a computer and printer that she expects will generate 90% profits.

This is her second loan from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  Her previous loan made it possible for her to increase income because she had new working capital with which to react to customer needs.

She will use this Kiva loan to buy beer, beverages and snacks to prepare for the approaching end of year season.

Her dream and great happiness is to study to be a Beautician and that her children attain professions that will permit them to be successful in the future.

loans.use: She will buy beer, soft drinks and snacks to stock up for the end of year season.
